translated: In this land of Tibet, many individuals who have mistaken ideas about this teaching of the Buddha, the path of the Great Vehicle, argue with one another, and their own ideas, which are not in accord with the profound and vast meaning, are analyzed by their own thoughts.

analyzed: byang chub lam gyi sgron ma de gang yin zhe na / sems can dam pa byang chub mchog / ces bya ba nas / de nyid rig la nyes pa med //

analyzed: ces pa'i bar gyi gzhung 'di yin no //
translated: It is the text from “The supreme being is the supreme enlightenment” up to “The one who knows reality has no faults.”

translated: The passage from “The small” up to “is supreme” teaches who is a vessel and who is not a vessel for the Great Vehicle.

original: skyes bu tha ma dang / skyes bu 'bring ni zhar la bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu tha ma dang / skyes bu 'bring ni zhar la bshad pa yin no //
translated: The inferior man and the middling man are explained incidentally.

original: tshig don rnams ni rtogs par sla'o //🔽rang rgyud gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis //🔽gang zhig gzhan gyi sdug bsngal kun //

original: yang dag zad par kun nas 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag zad par kun nas 'dod //
translated: with his own suffering

original: skyes bu de ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu de ni mchog yin no //
translated: is the supreme man.

original: zhes pas ni theg pa chen po'i snod bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pas ni theg pa chen po'i snod bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches who is a vessel for the Great Vehicle.

original: don 'di la dgongs nas ji skad du /
analyzed: don 'di la dgongs nas ji skad du /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la //
translated: acts toward sentient beings

original: bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin //
analyzed: bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin //
translated: as if they were his only son.

original: rkang gi gting nas byams pa ste //
analyzed: rkang gi gting nas byams pa ste //
translated: He has love from the bottom of his heart

original: de ltar rtag tu byed par 'dod ;
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu byed par 'dod ;
translated: and always wishes to act in this way.🔽And also:

original: / yang ji ltar phug ron rang gi bu mchog byams //
analyzed: / yang ji ltar phug ron rang gi bu mchog byams //
translated: Just as a dove loves her only baby,

original: rang gi bu de pang na 'khyud nas 'dug / de 'dra ba la khong khro 'gal ba ltar //
analyzed: rang gi bu de pang na 'khyud nas 'dug / de 'dra ba la khong khro 'gal ba ltar //
translated: It is contradictory to be angry with such a person.

original: brtser bcas lus can bu la'ang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: brtser bcas lus can bu la'ang de dang 'dra //
translated: Likewise, one who has compassion for embodied beings, his children,

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / slob dpon mkhas pa chen po nor gyi rtsa lag gis kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / slob dpon mkhas pa chen po nor gyi rtsa lag gis kyang ji skad du /
translated: The great scholar and master Vasubandhu also says:

original: dman @242b pa de dang de'i thabs kyis rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i bde ba don du gnyer //
analyzed: dman @242b pa de dang de'i thabs kyis rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i bde ba don du gnyer //
translated: The inferior person seeks his own happiness by whatever means,

original: 'bring po sdug bsngal ldog pa kho na'o bde min gang phyir de ni sdug bsngal gnas yin phyir //
analyzed: 'bring po sdug bsngal ldog pa kho na'o bde min gang phyir de ni sdug bsngal gnas yin phyir //
translated: even if it is wrong. The middling person seeks only to avoid suffering, not happiness, because that is the basis of suffering.

original: dam pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis gzhan dag la ni bde ba dang // sdug bsngal gtan ldog kho na don gnyer gang phyir de yi sdug bsngal gyis de sdug bsngal phyir //
analyzed: dam pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis gzhan dag la ni bde ba dang // sdug bsngal gtan ldog kho na don gnyer gang phyir de yi sdug bsngal gyis de sdug bsngal phyir //
translated: The superior person seeks to end the suffering of others by whatever means, even if it is his own suffering, because he is suffering due to their suffering.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang gang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang gang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Also, it is said:

original: gzhan gyi bde bas yid bde zhing dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde bas yid bde zhing dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: You will be happy and delighted by the happiness of others.

original: bdag gi ni ma yin pa de lta bu'i rigs can la yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi ni ma yin pa de lta bu'i rigs can la yin te /
translated: But it is not so for the compassionate person, who is delighted by the happiness of others.

original: de dag ni rang gi bde ba la mi lta ba dang / de dag ni gzhan dag sdug bsngal gyi chu bo chen po las yongs su bskyab par nus so snyam du 'bad pa byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi bde ba la mi lta ba dang / de dag ni gzhan dag sdug bsngal gyi chu bo chen po las yongs su bskyab par nus so snyam du 'bad pa byed do //
translated: This is the kind of person who is capable of saving others from the great river of suffering.

original: rang bzhin gyis snying rje che bdag ni snying rje la goms pa'i stobs kyis rang sdug bsngal yar gzhan bde ba la mngon par dga' ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis snying rje che bdag ni snying rje la goms pa'i stobs kyis rang sdug bsngal yar gzhan bde ba la mngon par dga' ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The compassionate person, who is naturally compassionate, delights in the happiness of others through the power of habituation to compassion.

original: de bas na skyes bu gang zhig rang bzhin gyis pha rol po nyam thag pa dag mthong na mi bzod cing bdag dang gzhan brje bar sems shing bu gcig pa g-yang sar lhung ba dang / chu bo chen pos khyer ba dang ; me 'bar ba'i nang du 'dug pa mthong ba na de mi bzod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu gang zhig rang bzhin gyis pha rol po nyam thag pa dag mthong na mi bzod cing bdag dang gzhan brje bar sems shing bu gcig pa g-yang sar lhung ba dang / chu bo chen pos khyer ba dang ; me 'bar ba'i nang du 'dug pa mthong ba na de mi bzod pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, when a person who is naturally compassionate sees others in distress, he or she cannot bear it. Thinking to exchange self with others, he or she is as distressed as if he or she were seeing an only child fall into a pit, or being carried away by a great river, or sitting in a fire.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag la bu gcig pa ltar lta ba de ni 'dir theg pa chen po'i snod du bsngags so //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag la bu gcig pa ltar lta ba de ni 'dir theg pa chen po'i snod du bsngags so //
translated: The view of all beings as one's only child is here praised as the vessel of the Great Vehicle.

original: de lta bu'i sems can chen po de la ji ltar bya snyam phal /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems can chen po de la ji ltar bya snyam phal /
translated: What should one do for such a great being?🔽 The answer is:

original: bla ma rnams kyis bstan pa yis //
analyzed: bla ma rnams kyis bstan pa yis //
translated: By the teaching of the gurus,

original: yang dag thabs ni bstan par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: yang dag thabs ni bstan par bya // zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: the right means should be taught.

original: de la bla ma rnams ni rje btsun dpal byang chub bzang po dang / rje btsun su warnna dva'i pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bla ma rnams ni rje btsun dpal byang chub bzang po dang / rje btsun su warnna dva'i pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The gurus are the venerable glorious Bodhibhadra, the venerable Suvarnadvipa, and so on.

original: yang dag thabs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag thabs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The right means is as follows.

original: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis dang / mngon par shes pa bskyed nas gzhan don khyad par can bya ba'i thabs dang / thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba'i tshogs gnyis bsag pa'i thabs dang / bdag dang gzhan don myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i theg pa chen po'i chen po gsang sngags kyi lugs kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i tshogs @243a * //
analyzed: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis dang / mngon par shes pa bskyed nas gzhan don khyad par can bya ba'i thabs dang / thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba'i tshogs gnyis bsag pa'i thabs dang / bdag dang gzhan don myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i theg pa chen po'i chen po gsang sngags kyi lugs kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i tshogs @243a * //
translated: The means of going for refuge to the Three Jewels,🔽the two kinds of enlightenment mind,🔽the means of accomplishing the special welfare of others by generating supernormal knowledge,🔽the means of gathering the two stores of merit and wisdom by combining method and wisdom,

original: gnyis bsags pa'i thabs rnams so //🔽de lta bu'i thabs de dag rgyas par bshad par 'dod nas /🔽rdzogs sangs bris sku la sogs dang // zhes pa nas /🔽de nyid rig la nyes pa med pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gnyis bsags pa'i thabs rnams so //🔽de lta bu'i thabs de dag rgyas par bshad par 'dod nas /🔽rdzogs sangs bris sku la sogs dang // zhes pa nas /🔽de nyid rig la nyes pa med pa'i bar ro //
translated: and the means of quickly completing the welfare of self and others are the uncommon means of gathering the two stores in the system of the Great Vehicle of the Great Vehicle, the Secret Mantra.

original: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni thar pa'i grong khyer chen por 'jug pa'i sgo lta bur gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi gzhi lta bur gyur pas de bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni thar pa'i grong khyer chen por 'jug pa'i sgo lta bur gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi gzhi lta bur gyur pas de bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: With the desire to teach that, he says:🔽Facing the perfect Buddha's images, etc.,

original: rdzogs sangs bris sku la sogs dang // mchod rten dam chos mngon phyogs nas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig rkang bcu gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: rdzogs sangs bris sku la sogs dang // mchod rten dam chos mngon phyogs nas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig rkang bcu gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: and the holy Dharma,

original: mngon phyogs nas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mngon du phyogs par byas shing mthong ba las byang chub kyi sems skye'o zhes theg pa chen po'i mdo rgyal po la gdams pa'i sngon gyi rtogs pa brjod pa las kyang mthong ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag kyang gsung ngo //
analyzed: mngon phyogs nas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mngon du phyogs par byas shing mthong ba las byang chub kyi sems skye'o zhes theg pa chen po'i mdo rgyal po la gdams pa'i sngon gyi rtogs pa brjod pa las kyang mthong ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag kyang gsung ngo //
translated: Facing means that the Thought of Awakening arises from seeing the Tathagata's body, and from that, the Mahayana Sutra Instruction to the King says: One should see the Tathagata's body, and one should hear the Mahayana sutras.

original: cho ga rgyas pa ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga rgyas pa ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The extensive rite will be taught below.

original: 'di ltar byug ris kyi dkyil 'khor nyi shu rtsa bdun du dkon mchog gsum gyi gzugs brnyan so sor bzhugs su gsol la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byug ris kyi dkyil 'khor nyi shu rtsa bdun du dkon mchog gsum gyi gzugs brnyan so sor bzhugs su gsol la /
translated: In this way, invite the Three Jewels to reside in each of the twenty-seven maṇḍalas of the painted images.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dkon mchog gsum yang gnas so so de dag tu spyan drang ba'am /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dkon mchog gsum yang gnas so so de dag tu spyan drang ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, imagine that the pure Three Jewels residing in the world systems of the ten directions are invited to their respective places.🔽Or, imagine that you yourself are residing in those pure lands.

original: yang na zhing khams de dag nyid du bdag nyid 'dug par mos te lus kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i bkod pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' re re'i mdun du bdag nyid 'dug par bsam la pug pug por ram sor mo bsnol la spyi bor thal mo
analyzed: yang na zhing khams de dag nyid du bdag nyid 'dug par mos te lus kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i bkod pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' re re'i mdun du bdag nyid 'dug par bsam la pug pug por ram sor mo bsnol la spyi bor thal mo
translated: With the array of the emanations of your body, imagine that you are in front of each buddha and bodhisattva.🔽With your hands folded in añjali, perform the complete acts of offering.

original: sbyar nas mchod pa'i bya ba rdzogs pa dang / phung po gsum pa byas la bla ma la yon phul te skyabs su 'gro ba bya'o //
analyzed: sbyar nas mchod pa'i bya ba rdzogs pa dang / phung po gsum pa byas la bla ma la yon phul te skyabs su 'gro ba bya'o //
translated: After performing the three-part rite, offer a gift to the guru and go for refuge.

original: de yang dkon mchog gsum ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de yang dkon mchog gsum ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: The Three Jewels are as follows.

original: de kho na nyid kyi dkon mchog gsum dang / mdun du bzhugs pa'i dkon mchog gsum ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi dkon mchog gsum dang / mdun du bzhugs pa'i dkon mchog gsum ste /
translated: The three jewels of reality and the three jewels present in front.

original: de lta bu shes pa sngon du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu shes pa sngon du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: One should proceed with the knowledge of such a distinction.🔽Flowers, incense, and things

original: me tog bdug spos dngos po dag / ces pa ni zang zing gi mchod pa mtshon pa'o ;
analyzed: me tog bdug spos dngos po dag / ces pa ni zang zing gi mchod pa mtshon pa'o ;
translated: indicate the material offerings.

original: / mchod pa rnam pa bdun dag kyang //
analyzed: / mchod pa rnam pa bdun dag kyang //
translated: The seven kinds of offerings

original: zhes pa ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa mtshon pa'o //🔽'dir byang chub sems dpa' tshogs kyi lam pa slob dpon du gyur pa des bsod nams kyi tshogs bsag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa mtshon pa'o // 'dir byang chub sems dpa' tshogs kyi lam pa slob dpon du gyur pa des bsod nams kyi tshogs bsag pa'i phyir /
translated: indicate the offerings of practice.

original: mchod pa la mkhas par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mchod pa la mkhas par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva who is on the path of accumulation and is a master should be skilled in making offerings in order to gather the accumulation of merit.🔽When he wishes to speak about that,

original: de smra ba 'dod nas /🔽kun bzang spyod las gsungs @243b pa yi ;
analyzed: de smra ba 'dod nas / kun bzang spyod las gsungs @243b pa yi ;
translated: he says,

original: / mchod pa rnam pa bdun dag kyang //🔽zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: / mchod pa rnam pa bdun dag kyang // zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The seven kinds of offerings🔽that are taught in the Samantabhadra conduct.

original: kun bzang spyod ces bya ba ni 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las 'byung ba'i 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyal po yin te /
analyzed: kun bzang spyod ces bya ba ni 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las 'byung ba'i 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyal po yin te /
translated: The so-called Samantabhadra conduct is the king of prayers of noble Samantabhadra conduct that appears in the noble Array of Stalks.

original: 'di ni phyogs bcu 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' chen pos chen po la bzhugs pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi rgya mtsho mi zad pa'i brnyes pa rnams kyi kun du bzang po'i spyod pa dang / kun du bzang po'i smon lam yin pas 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sde snod kyi mar me lta bu yin no zhes bla ma dam pa mkhas pa chen po dag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs bcu 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' chen pos chen po la bzhugs pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi rgya mtsho mi zad pa'i brnyes pa rnams kyi kun du bzang po'i spyod pa dang / kun du bzang po'i smon lam yin pas 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sde snod kyi mar me lta bu yin no zhes bla ma dam pa mkhas pa chen po dag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the good conduct and aspiration of the great bodhisattvas abiding in the great stage in the world systems of the ten directions, and it is the good conduct and aspiration of those who have attained the inexhaustible ocean of good conduct and aspiration. Therefore, this is like the lamp of the canon for bodhisattvas of the perfection vehicle. This is what the holy gurus, the great scholars, have said.

original: gsungs pa'i mchod pa rnam pa bdun //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i mchod pa rnam pa bdun //
translated: The seven types of worship mentioned.

original: zhes bya ba ni bla ma kha cig gi zhal nas 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam las mchod pa bdun gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bla ma kha cig gi zhal nas 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam las mchod pa bdun gsungs te /
translated: Some gurus say that the noble Good Conduct Aspiration makes seven types of worship.

original: ji snyed su dag phyogs bcu'i zhes pa shlo kas ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: ji snyed su dag phyogs bcu'i zhes pa shlo kas ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa bstan to //
translated: The verse “However many there are in the ten directions” teaches the worship of prostration with body, speech, and mind.

original: bzang por spyod la dad pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'i shlo kas ni lus dbul ba'i mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: bzang por spyod la dad pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'i shlo kas ni lus dbul ba'i mchod pa bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning “Faith in the excellent conduct” teaches the offering of the body.

original: rdul gcig steng na zhes pa'i shlo kas ni de dag yul du byas te dang ba'i mchod pa bstan to //🔽de dag bsngags pa mi zad rgya mtsho rnams //
analyzed: rdul gcig steng na zhes pa'i shlo kas ni de dag yul du byas te dang ba'i mchod pa bstan to // de dag bsngags pa mi zad rgya mtsho rnams //
translated: The verse beginning “On a single atom” teaches the offering of pure faith by taking those as objects.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni bstod pa'i mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni bstod pa'i mchod pa bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning “The oceans of inexhaustible praise” teaches the offering of praise.

original: me tog dam pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni bla na yod pa'i mchod pa bstan to //🔽mchod pa gang rnams bla med rgya che ba //
analyzed: me tog dam pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni bla na yod pa'i mchod pa bstan to // mchod pa gang rnams bla med rgya che ba //
translated: The verse beginning “Supreme flowers” teaches the offering of what is surpassable.

original: zhes pas ni bla na med pa'i mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pas ni bla na med pa'i mchod pa bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning “Whatever offerings are unsurpassable and vast” teaches the unsurpassable offering.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ces pas ni phung po gsum pa'i mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ces pas ni phung po gsum pa'i mchod pa bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning “Attachment, anger, and delusion” teaches the offering of the three heaps.

original: gzhung gzhan gyis mi mchod pa de dag gi bsngo ba bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhung gzhan gyis mi mchod pa de dag gi bsngo ba bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the other texts teach the dedication of those offerings.

original: yang bla ma dam pa kha cig gi zhal nas /
analyzed: yang bla ma dam pa kha cig gi zhal nas /
translated: Also, some excellent gurus say:

original: 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam las mchod pa bdun gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam las mchod pa bdun gsungs te /
translated: The noble Good Conduct Prayer says that there are seven offerings:

original: 'di ltar me tog dam pa dang / phreng ba dam pa dang / sil snyan dam pa dang / byug pa dam pa dang ; mar me dam pa dang / bdug spos dam pa dang / na bza' dam pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar me tog dam pa dang / phreng ba dam pa dang / sil snyan dam pa dang / byug pa dam pa dang ; mar me dam pa dang / bdug spos dam pa dang / na bza' dam pa rnams so //
translated: excellent flowers, excellent garlands, excellent musical instruments, excellent ointments, excellent lamps, excellent incense, and excellent clothing.

original: dri mchog dam pa dang / phyi ma'i phur ma gnyis ni byug pa dam pa dang / bdug pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa nyid yin la bkod pa'i khyad par zhes pa ni snga ma de dag re re zhing yang brjod du med pa'i bkod pa bya'o @244a * //🔽zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: dri mchog dam pa dang / phyi ma'i phur ma gnyis ni byug pa dam pa dang / bdug pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa nyid yin la bkod pa'i khyad par zhes pa ni snga ma de dag re re zhing yang brjod du med pa'i bkod pa bya'o @244a * // zhes gsung ngo //
translated: The excellent supreme fragrance and the excellent supreme perfume are included in the excellent ointments and the excellent incense, and the excellent special array is that each of the former is to be arrayed in a way that is inexpressible.

original: bla ma mkhas pa gzhan dag ni 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam las mchod pa bdun du gsungs pa ni 'di ltar yan lag bdun par 'dus te /
analyzed: bla ma mkhas pa gzhan dag ni 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam las mchod pa bdun du gsungs pa ni 'di ltar yan lag bdun par 'dus te /
translated: Other scholars say that the seven offerings mentioned in the noble Good Conduct Prayer are included in the seven limbs:

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: they are the offering of practice.

original: de nyid las bdun po de dag rdzogs pa'i rjes la 'di skad du /
analyzed: de nyid las bdun po de dag rdzogs pa'i rjes la 'di skad du /
translated: The same text, after completing those seven, says:

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang da ltar gyi //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang da ltar gyi //
translated: “It is worship of the Buddhas of the past,

original: phyogs bcu dag na gang bzhugs mchod par gyur //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag na gang bzhugs mchod par gyur //
translated: and of those who abide in the ten directions in the present.”

original: zhes mchod pa nyid yin par gsal bar gsungs so zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: zhes mchod pa nyid yin par gsal bar gsungs so zhes gsung ngo //
translated: Thus it clearly says that this is worship.

original: de dag ni gar yang 'gal ba med pa de rang nyid gang la mos pa de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gar yang 'gal ba med pa de rang nyid gang la mos pa de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: There is no contradiction in any of these explanations, so you should hold the one that you prefer.

original: 'di ltar mchod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Worship is of two kinds:

original: zang zing gi mchod pa dang / sgrub pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi mchod pa dang / sgrub pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: worship with goods and services and worship through devotion.

original: zang zing gi mchod pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: zang zing gi mchod pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Worship with goods and services is of two kinds:

original: mngon sum pa nyid dang / yid kyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum pa nyid dang / yid kyis byas pa'o //
translated: worship with goods and services that you have actually obtained and worship with goods and services that you imagine.

original: mngon sum pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon sum pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Worship with goods and services that you have actually obtained is of two kinds:

original: me tog la sogs pa dang / bdug pa la sogs pa dang / rol mo la sogs pa dang / rgyal srid dang / nor bu rin po che la sogs pa bdag nyid la yod pa'o //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa dang / bdug pa la sogs pa dang / rol mo la sogs pa dang / rgyal srid dang / nor bu rin po che la sogs pa bdag nyid la yod pa'o //
translated: worship with goods and services that you have obtained and that are present—such as flowers, incense, music, your kingdom, precious jewels, and so on—and worship with goods and services that you have obtained and that are absent.

original: gnyis pa ni sems rten dang bcas pa dang / bu dang bu mo dang / chung ma dang bran la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sems rten dang bcas pa dang / bu dang bu mo dang / chung ma dang bran la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second is the mind and its support, and sons and daughters, wives and servants, and so on.

original: yid kyis byas pa la gnyis te /🔽dang po ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams kyi bdag po med cing /
analyzed: yid kyis byas pa la gnyis te / dang po ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams kyi bdag po med cing /
translated: The mental is twofold.🔽The first is all the best things in the world of the ten directions that are not owned by anyone,

original: gzhan gyis yongs su ma bzung ba'i rdzas phul du byung ba ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su ma bzung ba'i rdzas phul du byung ba ma lus pa ste /
translated: and are not possessed by others.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin dang / 'phags pa dgongs pa rgyud kyi phreng ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'khor lo'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya'i mdo dang / dkon mchog ta la la'i mdo dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa las gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin dang / 'phags pa dgongs pa rgyud kyi phreng ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'khor lo'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya'i mdo dang / dkon mchog ta la la'i mdo dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa las gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are like those mentioned in the noble Jewel Cloud, the noble Sutra of the Basket’s Display, the Sutra of the Seal of Worship in the Wheel of Concentration, the Jewel Cloud Sutra, and the Guide to the Bodhisattva Way of Life.

original: gnyis pa ni yid kyi rnam par 'phrul pa las byung ba'i bkod pa nam mkha'i mdzod las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yid kyi rnam par 'phrul pa las byung ba'i bkod pa nam mkha'i mdzod las byung ba ste /
translated: The second is the array that arises from the magical creation of the mind, and comes from the sky treasury.

original: 'di ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid rin po che bdun dang / nor bu rin po che gser dang / dngul dang / dung dang / man shel dang / chu shel dang / spug dang / rdo'i snying po dang ; mu tig dang / mu tig dmar po dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid rin po che bdun dang / nor bu rin po che gser dang / dngul dang / dung dang / man shel dang / chu shel dang / spug dang / rdo'i snying po dang ; mu tig dang / mu tig dmar po dang /
translated: In this way, there falls a rain of the seven precious substances of the cakravartin’s kingdom, and of precious jewels of gold, silver, conch, crystal, water crystal, coral, stone essence, pearl, red pearl,

original: man shel dang / padma r'a ga dang / aasma garbha dang / mu sa la gal pa dang / dun las dang / aindra n'i la dang / mar ka ta dang / bee d'urya dang / sham ka shi la dang / byi ru dang / ke ke ru dang /
analyzed: man shel dang / padma r'a ga dang / aasma garbha dang / mu sa la gal pa dang / dun las dang / aindra n'i la dang / mar ka ta dang / bee d'urya dang / sham ka shi la dang / byi ru dang / ke ke ru dang /
translated: crystal, ruby, emerald, musāragalva, dūndubhi, indranīla, marakata, vaiḍūrya, śaṅkhaśila, coral, and keśara.

original: ke ke ru chen po la sogs pa'i nor bu de dag gi char pa 'bab pa @244b dang ; de dag gi gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / gzhal yas khang dang / dra ba'i tshogs brjod du med pa dag gzhan yang dkon mchog ta la la'i gzungs las 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ke ke ru chen po la sogs pa'i nor bu de dag gi char pa 'bab pa @244b dang ; de dag gi gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / gzhal yas khang dang / dra ba'i tshogs brjod du med pa dag gzhan yang dkon mchog ta la la'i gzungs las 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: There also falls a rain of parasols, victory banners, flags, palaces, and nets beyond expression.

original: me tog phal cher me tog bla re dang // me tog bkod pa'i 'od zer rab 'gyed cing //
analyzed: me tog phal cher me tog bla re dang // me tog bkod pa'i 'od zer rab 'gyed cing //
translated: Most of the flowers are canopies of flowers,🔽and they emit the light of the array of flowers.

original: me tog sna tshogs kun du bkram byas te //🔽bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal bas mchod //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs kun du bkram byas te // bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal bas mchod //
translated: They are strewn with various flowers.

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: Those great beings are worshipped by the Victorious Ones.

original: de bzhin du bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / rgyan phreng dang / rgyal mtshan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / rgyan phreng dang / rgyal mtshan te /
translated: Thus, it is the same with incense, perfume, garlands, powders, clothes, jewels, lotuses, jewel necklaces, and victory banners.

original: de dag kyang kha dog sna tshogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de dag kyang kha dog sna tshogs pa'o ;
translated: They are also of various colors.

original: / sngar gyi tshigs su bcad pas kun la sbyar bar bya'o //🔽de bzhin du gdugs bzo legs pa yu ba rin po che las grub pa kha dog sna tshogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa khebs pa brjod du med pa dang / de bzhin du rgyal mtshan yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: / sngar gyi tshigs su bcad pas kun la sbyar bar bya'o // de bzhin du gdugs bzo legs pa yu ba rin po che las grub pa kha dog sna tshogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa khebs pa brjod du med pa dang / de bzhin du rgyal mtshan yang de bzhin te /
translated: The previous verse should be applied to all of them.

original: thams cad gdugs bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad gdugs bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, there are well-made parasols with handles made of jewels, of various colors, covering all the buddha-fields, inexpressibly many. And similarly, there are victory banners, all like the parasols.

original: ba dan dang rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan yang tshad dang rgyu dang grangs snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ba dan dang rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan yang tshad dang rgyu dang grangs snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The victory banners and the banners of victory are the same size, material and number as above.

original: gzhan yang me tog kha dog dang dbyibs dang dri phun sum tshogs pa'i char dang / de'i phreng ba dang / de'i gdugs dang / de'i rgyal mtshan dang / de'i ba dan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang ; gzhal med khang bkod pa sna tshogs pa du ma brjod du med pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang me tog kha dog dang dbyibs dang dri phun sum tshogs pa'i char dang / de'i phreng ba dang / de'i gdugs dang / de'i rgyal mtshan dang / de'i ba dan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang ; gzhal med khang bkod pa sna tshogs pa du ma brjod du med pa dang /
translated: Moreover, there is a rain of flowers with perfect color, shape and fragrance, and garlands, parasols, victory banners, banners, banners of victory and countless palaces with various arrays.

original: mar me yang tshul de bzhin pa dang / spos kyi char la sogs pa yang snga ma'i tshul dang ldan pa dang / zhal zas bza' ba dang / btung ba kha dog dang dri dang ro phun sum tshogs pa dang / na bza' dri zhim pos bsgos pa dang ;
analyzed: mar me yang tshul de bzhin pa dang / spos kyi char la sogs pa yang snga ma'i tshul dang ldan pa dang / zhal zas bza' ba dang / btung ba kha dog dang dri dang ro phun sum tshogs pa dang / na bza' dri zhim pos bsgos pa dang ;
translated: There are also lamps in the same way, and a rain of incense and so forth with the same method as before, as well as food to eat and drink with perfect color, smell and taste, and clothes scented with perfume.

original: rol mo'i sgra dbyangs snyan cing yid 'phrog par byed pa'i pi wang dang / gling bu dang / rnga dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rnga bo che dang / rnga zlum dang / rdza rnga dang / dung dang / zangs dung dang / cha lang dang /
analyzed: rol mo'i sgra dbyangs snyan cing yid 'phrog par byed pa'i pi wang dang / gling bu dang / rnga dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rnga bo che dang / rnga zlum dang / rdza rnga dang / dung dang / zangs dung dang / cha lang dang /
translated: The sounds of music are the sounds of the pleasing and captivating vīṇā, flute, drum, paṭaha, bherī, mṛdaṅga, dūndubhi, conch, copper horn, cymbals,

original: ting ting shag dang / da ma ru dang / lha dang / mi'i glu snyan pa yid 'phrog par byed pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi bstod pa'i sgra dbyangs snyan cing don dang ldan pa dang phye ma'i phur ma ri rab bye ba phrag brgya gcig tu bsdoms pa tsam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting ting shag dang / da ma ru dang / lha dang / mi'i glu snyan pa yid 'phrog par byed pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi bstod pa'i sgra dbyangs snyan cing don dang ldan pa dang phye ma'i phur ma ri rab bye ba phrag brgya gcig tu bsdoms pa tsam la sogs pa'o //
translated: ting shags, damaru, and the captivating and pleasing songs of gods and humans, as well as the pleasing and meaningful sounds of praise to the Three Jewels, and so forth.

original: de yang 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is as it appears in the noble Cloud of Jewels.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The offering of practice is twofold:

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa nyid @245a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa nyid @245a * //
translated: the offering of practice itself

original: dang ; bla na med pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; bla na med pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: and the unsurpassable offering.

original: dang po la bdun te /
analyzed: dang po la bdun te /
translated: The first has seven parts:

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa dang / zang zing gi mchod pa'i mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa'i mchod pa dang / rjes su yi rang pa'i mchod pa dang / de bzhin du bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i mchod pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa dang / zang zing gi mchod pa'i mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa'i mchod pa dang / rjes su yi rang pa'i mchod pa dang / de bzhin du bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i mchod pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The homage offering, the offering of material things, the offering of confession of sins, the offering of rejoicing, and likewise the offering of requesting, the offering of urging, and the offering of dedication.

original: de la phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa la yang gnyis te /
translated: The homage offering is twofold:

original: lus kyi mchod pa dang / ngag gi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mchod pa dang / ngag gi mchod pa'o //
translated: the offering of body and the offering of speech.

original: lus kyi mchod pa ni 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa las /
analyzed: lus kyi mchod pa ni 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa las /
translated: The offering of body is as taught in the noble Good Conduct:🔽As many as there are in the ten directions,🔽and so forth, and in the Good Conduct:

original: ji snyed su dag ces pa la sogs pa dang / bzang po'i spyod la dad pa'i stobs dag gis ;
analyzed: ji snyed su dag ces pa la sogs pa dang / bzang po'i spyod la dad pa'i stobs dag gis ;
translated: By the power of faith in the good conduct,🔽and so forth, and in the Verse Collection for the Vows:

original: / zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: On a single atom, as many as atoms in a buddhafield,🔽and so forth.

original: de dag gis ni dmigs pa'i yul du bya ba dang / lus dbul ba dang / phyag bya ba de gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni dmigs pa'i yul du bya ba dang / lus dbul ba dang / phyag bya ba de gsungs so //
translated: By these, the object of observation is taught, the offering of the body, and the homage.

original: don de nyid 'phags pa phung po gsum pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: don de nyid 'phags pa phung po gsum pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of this is stated in the noble Three Heaps Sutra:

original: de pus mo g-yas pa sa la 'dzugs pa na zhes pa dang / de pus mo g-yon pa sa la 'dzugs pa na zhes pa dang / de lag pa g-yas pas la 'dzugs pa na sems can thams cad g-yas phyogs kyi lam la gnas par gyur cig snyam du sems bskyed do zhes pa dang /
analyzed: de pus mo g-yas pa sa la 'dzugs pa na zhes pa dang / de pus mo g-yon pa sa la 'dzugs pa na zhes pa dang / de lag pa g-yas pas la 'dzugs pa na sems can thams cad g-yas phyogs kyi lam la gnas par gyur cig snyam du sems bskyed do zhes pa dang /
translated: When he places his right knee on the ground, when he places his left knee on the ground, when he places his right hand on the ground, he arouses the thought, “May all sentient beings enter the right path.”

original: de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pa dang mgo sa la gtugs pa na zhes pa'i tshul de bzhin du shes par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pa dang mgo sa la gtugs pa na zhes pa'i tshul de bzhin du shes par bya /
translated: And similarly, when he places his left hand and his head on the ground, you should understand it in the same way.

original: de'i bsngo ba de nyid las 'di skad du bdag gi yan lag lngas phyag btsal ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyi sgrib pa lnga sel bar gyur cig / mi lnga yongs su dag par gyur cig / dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / lam
analyzed: de'i bsngo ba de nyid las 'di skad du bdag gi yan lag lngas phyag btsal ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyi sgrib pa lnga sel bar gyur cig / mi lnga yongs su dag par gyur cig / dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / lam
translated: And in that very dedication, it says, “By my paying homage with my five limbs, may the five hindrances of all sentient beings be removed, may the five nonvirtues be purified, may the five faculties be perfected, may the five knowledges be fully developed, and may they attain the five superknowledges.”

original: lnga la gnas par gyur cig / mngon par shes pa nyams pa med pa lnga thob par gyur cig / sems can 'gro ba lngar skyes pa dag 'gro ba lnga las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / tshul khrims khyad par du 'phags pa dang /
analyzed: lnga la gnas par gyur cig / mngon par shes pa nyams pa med pa lnga thob par gyur cig / sems can 'gro ba lngar skyes pa dag 'gro ba lnga las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / tshul khrims khyad par du 'phags pa dang /
translated: the excellence of destiny, the excellence of morality,🔽the excellence of meditative stabilization, the excellence of wisdom,🔽the excellence of liberation, and the excellence of the vision of the pristine wisdom of liberation.

original: ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'phags pa dang / shes rab khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rnam par grol ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba khyad par du 'phags pa thob par gyur cig / sangs rgyas la lta ba dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'phags pa dang / shes rab khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rnam par grol ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba khyad par du 'phags pa thob par gyur cig / sangs rgyas la lta ba dang /
translated: May they attain the vision of the Buddha,

original: chos nyan pa dag dge 'dun dang 'grogs pa thob par gyur cig ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa dag dge 'dun dang 'grogs pa thob par gyur cig ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the hearing of the Dharma, and the association with the Saṅgha.

original: ngag gis mchod pa yang lus kyis phyag byed pa'i @245b dus de nyid kyi cho ga rtogs pa ci yod pas dkon mchog gsum gyi bstod pa glu dbyangs kyis tshig tu 'don cing phyag byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis mchod pa yang lus kyis phyag byed pa'i @245b dus de nyid kyi cho ga rtogs pa ci yod pas dkon mchog gsum gyi bstod pa glu dbyangs kyis tshig tu 'don cing phyag byed pa'o //
translated: The offering of speech is to make prostrations with the body and to recite the praises of the Three Jewels in song, with whatever liturgy one knows, at the very time one is making prostrations.

original: zang zing gi mchod pa ni sngar brjod zin to /
analyzed: zang zing gi mchod pa ni sngar brjod zin to /
translated: The offering of material things has already been explained.

original: // / sdig pa bshags pa'i mchod pa ni gser 'od dam pa'am /
analyzed: // / sdig pa bshags pa'i mchod pa ni gser 'od dam pa'am /
translated: The offering of confession of wrongdoing is such as the Sutra of Golden Light,

original: ltung ba bshags pa'am /
analyzed: ltung ba bshags pa'am /
translated: the Confession of Downfalls,

original: phung po gsum pa'i mdo'am /
analyzed: phung po gsum pa'i mdo'am /
translated: the Sutra of the Three Heaps,

original: las kyi sgrib pa rgyun gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa rgyun gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and the Sutra Cutting Off the Ground of Karmic Actions.

original: sdig pa bshags pa de yang mchod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa de yang mchod pa nyid yin te /
translated: This confession of wrongdoing is itself an offering.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble Aksayamatinirdesa Sutra says,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi sdig pa bshags pa yang bsod nams su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi sdig pa bshags pa yang bsod nams su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Confessing one’s own and others’ wrongdoings is itself a merit.”

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i mchod pa yang 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las 'byung ba bzhin te mchod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i mchod pa yang 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las 'byung ba bzhin te mchod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The offering of rejoicing is also an offering, as the noble Candrapradīpa Sūtra says:

original: bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa'i mchod pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i mchod par 'gyur ba'i tshul yang mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa'i mchod pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i mchod par 'gyur ba'i tshul yang mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The way of making offerings of urging and supplicating and of dedicating should be understood from the sutra itself.

original: bla na med pa'i mchod pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mchod pa la gnyis te /
translated: The unsurpassed offering is twofold:

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: with reference points and without reference points.

original: de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdo las /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdo las /
translated: The offering with reference points is mentioned in the Sūtra of Sāgaramati:

original: blo gros rgya mtsho gsum po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho gsum po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa bla na med pa ste /
translated: Sāgaramati, these three are the unsurpassed offering and service to the Tathāgata.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are arousing the mind of awakening, upholding the sublime Dharma, and arousing great compassion for sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa mthar gyis yang dag 'phags pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa mthar gyis yang dag 'phags pa'i mdo las /
translated: Similarly, the Sūtra of the Questions of Akṣayamati states:

original: bzang po phan yon bzhi po 'di dag mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa yin te /
analyzed: bzang po phan yon bzhi po 'di dag mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who sees these four good qualities and benefits is making offerings to the Tathagata.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sbyin gnas mchog la dad par 'gyur ba dang / bdag la bzlas bltas te sems can gzhan yang mchod pa byed par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod nas byang chub kyi sems brtan par 'gyur ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis mthong nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bsdus par 'gyur ba ste bzhi po 'di dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyin gnas mchog la dad par 'gyur ba dang / bdag la bzlas bltas te sems can gzhan yang mchod pa byed par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod nas byang chub kyi sems brtan par 'gyur ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis mthong nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bsdus par 'gyur ba ste bzhi po 'di dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: One has faith in the supreme object of offering; one makes offerings to others, thinking of oneself; having made offerings to the Tathagata, one stabilizes the mind of enlightenment; and having seen the thirty-two marks of a great being, one gathers the roots of virtue.

original: sems can mgu bar byed pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bla na med pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can mgu bar byed pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bla na med pa yin te /
translated: Also, pleasing sentient beings is the unsurpassed offering to the Tathagata.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ba tsha'i chu klung gi mdo las ji skad gsungs pa dang / @246a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ba tsha'i chu klung gi mdo las ji skad gsungs pa dang / @246a * //
translated: As the Blessed One said in the Sutra of the River Vaitarani:

original: slob dpon zhi ba lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba lhas kyang /
translated: And Master Śāntideva says:

original: gang dag bde na thub dbang rnams dgyes shing //
analyzed: gang dag bde na thub dbang rnams dgyes shing //
translated: When the powerful sages are pleased,

original: gang la gnod na thub dbang mi dgyes pa //
analyzed: gang la gnod na thub dbang mi dgyes pa //
translated: If you harm them, the Lord of Sages will be displeased.

original: de dag mgu bas thub dbang thams cad dgyes //
analyzed: de dag mgu bas thub dbang thams cad dgyes //
translated: By pleasing them, all the Lord of Sages are pleased.

original: de la gnod byas thub la gnod byas 'gyur //
analyzed: de la gnod byas thub la gnod byas 'gyur //
translated: Harming them is harming the Sage.

original: zhes pa dang / yang de nyid las /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / yang de nyid las /
translated: And again, the same text says:

original: de bzhin gshegs rnams mnyes par bgyi slad du //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rnams mnyes par bgyi slad du //
translated: In order to please the Tathāgatas,

original: 'jig rten bran du deng nas mchi bar bgyi //
analyzed: 'jig rten bran du deng nas mchi bar bgyi //
translated: from now on I will be a servant of the world.

original: skye bo'i tshogs kyis bdag mgo rkang bcad dam //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs kyis bdag mgo rkang bcad dam //
translated: Even if crowds of people cut off my head and limbs,

original: gsod kyang rung ste 'jig rten mgon dgyes mdzod //🔽thugs rje ldan pa dag gis 'gro 'di kun //
analyzed: gsod kyang rung ste 'jig rten mgon dgyes mdzod // thugs rje ldan pa dag gis 'gro 'di kun //
translated: or kill me, may the Lords of the World be pleased.🔽There is no doubt that these compassionate ones

original: bdag gir mdzad pa 'di la dogs ma mchis //
analyzed: bdag gir mdzad pa 'di la dogs ma mchis //
translated: consider all these beings as their own.

original: sems can gzugs su snang ba 'di dag kun //
analyzed: sems can gzugs su snang ba 'di dag kun //
translated: Are all these beings who appear in forms

original: mgon po min nam ci na 'dir mi gus //
analyzed: mgon po min nam ci na 'dir mi gus //
translated: not the Lords? Why are they not respected here?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes bya'ang de nyid yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes bya'ang de nyid yin //
translated: This is also what pleases the Tathāgatas.

original: zhes pa dang / yang de nyid las /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / yang de nyid las /
translated: And again, the same text says:

original: byams pa'i bsam ldan mchod pa gang //
analyzed: byams pa'i bsam ldan mchod pa gang //
translated: Whatever worship is done with a loving attitude,

original: de ni sems can che ba nyid //
analyzed: de ni sems can che ba nyid //
translated: that is the greatness of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas dad pa'i bsod nams gang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dad pa'i bsod nams gang //
translated: Whatever merit there is in faith in the Buddha,

original: de ni sangs rgyas che ba nyid //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas che ba nyid //
translated: That is the greatness of the Buddha.

original: ces bslab pa kun las btus pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bslab pa kun las btus pa las gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said in the Siksasamuccaya.

original: spyod 'jug las kyang /🔽sems can mgu bya ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: spyod 'jug las kyang / sems can mgu bya ma gtogs pa //
translated: And in the Bodhicaryiivatiira:🔽There is no way to please sentient beings

original: rgyal ba mnyes pa'i thabs gzhan med //🔽ces gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las don 'di rgyas par bshad de de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba mnyes pa'i thabs gzhan med // ces gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las don 'di rgyas par bshad de de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Except to please the Victorious Ones.🔽And the same text explains this point extensively, so one should look there.

original: gzhan yang mdo nyid na rgyas pas mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo nyid na rgyas pas mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since the sutras themselves explain this extensively, one should look in the sutras themselves.

original: de la dmigs pa med pa'i mchod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa med pa'i mchod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Among these, the offering that is without reference is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la ni mchod par bya ba dang / mchod par byed pa dang / mchod pa'i rdzas med de /
analyzed: de la ni mchod par bya ba dang / mchod par byed pa dang / mchod pa'i rdzas med de /
translated: In that, there is no object of offering, no one who offers, and no substance of the offering.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: And that is stated in the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras:

original: gang gis nga la gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: gang gis nga la gzugs su mthong //
translated: Those who see me in form,

original: gang gis nga la sgrar shes pa //
analyzed: gang gis nga la sgrar shes pa //
translated: Those who know me in sound,

original: de dag log par mthong pa ste //
analyzed: de dag log par mthong pa ste //
translated: They practice a deviant path;

original: skye bo 'di yis nga mi mthong //
analyzed: skye bo 'di yis nga mi mthong //
translated: These people do not see me.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos kyi sku //🔽'dren pa rnams ni chos nyid blta //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos kyi sku // 'dren pa rnams ni chos nyid blta //
translated: The Leaders are to be seen as the ultimate realm.

original: chos nyid mthong bar bya min pas //
analyzed: chos nyid mthong bar bya min pas //
translated: The ultimate realm is not to be seen.

original: de ni rnam par shes mi nus //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes mi nus // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be known.

original: don 'di ni 'phags pa rtag tu ngu'i le'u las gsal bar gsungs pas der blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don 'di ni 'phags pa rtag tu ngu'i le'u las gsal bar gsungs pas der blta bar bya'o //
translated: This meaning is clearly taught in the chapter on the noble Sadaprarudita.

original: de bas na 'phags pa seng ge sgra'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa seng ge sgra'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, it says in the noble Siṃhanāda-sūtra:

original: sangs rgyas su 'du shes pa la sangs rgyas mthong ba med na /🔽sangs rgyas la mchod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'du shes pa la sangs rgyas mthong ba med na / sangs rgyas la mchod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos de ni gnas med do //
translated: “When there is no seeing of the Buddha in the notion of Buddha,🔽how much less could there be worship of the Buddha? That is impossible.

original: de la sangs rgyas la mchod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas la mchod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is worship of the Buddha?

original: gang 'du shes kyi @246b mtshan ma mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'du shes kyi @246b mtshan ma mi skyed pa'o //
translated: It is the non-production of the sign of notion.

original: gang la sems med pa dang / sems las byung ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas su 'du shes pa med pa dang / chos su 'du shes pa med pa dang / dge 'dun du 'du shes pa med pa dang / gang zag dang / bdag dang /
analyzed: gang la sems med pa dang / sems las byung ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas su 'du shes pa med pa dang / chos su 'du shes pa med pa dang / dge 'dun du 'du shes pa med pa dang / gang zag dang / bdag dang /
translated: Where there is no mind, no mental factor, no notion of Buddha, no notion of Dharma, no notion of Saṅgha, no notion of person, no notion of self, no notion of other, no notion of giving, no notion of taking, no notion of morality, no notion of immorality, no notion of patience, no notion of malice, no notion of perseverance, no notion of laziness, no notion of concentration, no notion of distraction, no notion of wisdom, no notion of foolishness, no notion of affliction, no notion of purification, no notion of worldly dharmas, no notion of supramundane dharmas, no notion of conditioned dharmas, no notion of unconditioned dharmas, no notion of good, no notion of bad, no notion of wholesome, no notion of unwholesome, no notion of Dharma, no notion of non-Dharma, no notion of compounded, no notion of uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded and uncompounded, no notion of compounded

original: pha rol por 'du shes pa med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: pha rol por 'du shes pa med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: The one who has no concept of the other person is making an offering to the Tathagata.

original: 'di'i don rgyas par mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don rgyas par mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood in detail from the sutra itself.

original: de bas na 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas /
translated: Therefore, the statement by the noble Asanga,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de ni sgrub pa'i mchod pas mnyes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de ni sgrub pa'i mchod pas mnyes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: “The Bhagavat Buddha is pleased by the offering of practice,🔽but not by the offering of material things,”

original: zang zing gi mchod pas ni de mnyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zang zing gi mchod pas ni de mnyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: is well drawn.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas ni chos kyi skus gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas ni chos kyi skus gnas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha abides in the Dharma Body.

original: sangs rgyas phal po che'i le'u las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas phal po che'i le'u las /
translated: The Buddhavatamsaka says,

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: “The Buddhas are the Dharma Body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med //
translated: The Tathagata is unborn.

original: rnam dag nam mkha' lta bu ste //
analyzed: rnam dag nam mkha' lta bu ste //
translated: He is pure like space.”

original: zhes gsungs pa dang ; 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang ; 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las kyang /
translated: And the noble Gaganaganja-sutra says,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni chos nyid du yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni chos nyid du yang mi dmigs na /
translated: “The Bhagavat Buddha is not apprehended even as the reality itself.

original: gzugs dang mtshan nyid du lta dmigs par ga la 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang mtshan nyid du lta dmigs par ga la 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: How could form and characteristics be the object of view?

original: slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal nas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal nas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Ārya Nāgārjuna also says:

original: chos rnams thams cad stong pa la //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad stong pa la //
translated: All phenomena are empty.

original: gang la bstod cing gang gis bstod //
analyzed: gang la bstod cing gang gis bstod //
translated: What is praised? By whom is it praised?

original: skye dang 'jig pa rnam spangs shing //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa rnam spangs shing //
translated: Free from arising and ceasing,

original: gang la mtha' dang dbus med pa //
analyzed: gang la mtha' dang dbus med pa //
translated: Without end or middle,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa mi mnga' ba'i //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa mi mnga' ba'i //
translated: Without apprehender or apprehended,

original: 'dir ni khyed bstod nus pa gang //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni khyed bstod nus pa gang // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Who here is able to praise you?

original: de lta bu'i mchod pa'i bye brag ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i bye brag gis de dang de shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mchod pa'i bye brag ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i bye brag gis de dang de shes par bya'o //
translated: Such specific praises should be understood from that and that [text], according to the distinctions of dull and sharp faculties of bodhisattvas.

original: rtsa ba nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: One should enter into the root itself.

original: byang chub snying po'i mthar thug par //
analyzed: byang chub snying po'i mthar thug par //
translated: Until reaching the essence of enlightenment,

original: mi ldog pa yi sems kyis su //
analyzed: mi ldog pa yi sems kyis su //
translated: With an irreversible mind,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: byang chub snying po ni drang ba'i don du dpal rdo rje'i gdan byang chub chen po'i gnas dang / 'og min gyi gnas dpal stug po bkod ba'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: byang chub snying po ni drang ba'i don du dpal rdo rje'i gdan byang chub chen po'i gnas dang / 'og min gyi gnas dpal stug po bkod ba'i zhing ngo //
translated: The essence of enlightenment is the site of great enlightenment, the glorious Vajra Seat, and the site of Akaniṣṭha, the glorious Dense Array.

original: de dag tu rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pas na snying po'o //
analyzed: de dag tu rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pas na snying po'o //
translated: These are the essence because the vajra-like meditative absorption is attained there.

original: nges pa'i don du ting nge 'dzin de brnyes pa'i gnas 'di yin bya ba med de /
analyzed: nges pa'i don du ting nge 'dzin de brnyes pa'i gnas 'di yin bya ba med de /
translated: In the definitive meaning, there is no site where it is said, “This is where that meditative absorption is attained.”

original: don dam par chos thams cad kyi dbyings nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad kyi dbyings nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because it is the basic field of phenomena in the ultimate sense.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi @247a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi @247a * //
translated: In the noble Gaganagañja Sūtra,🔽it says,

original: mdo las / byang chub snying po nam mkha' ste //🔽byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: mdo las / byang chub snying po nam mkha' ste // byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: “The essence of enlightenment is space.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Enlightenment has the characteristic of space.”🔽And,

original: mi ldog pa yi sems kyis su //
analyzed: mi ldog pa yi sems kyis su //
translated: “With an irreversible mind,”

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: here, irreversible bodhisattvas are of three kinds:

original: sbyor ba'i lam nas mi ldog pa dang / bden pa mthong ba nas mi ldog pa dang / sa brgyad pa nas mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam nas mi ldog pa dang / bden pa mthong ba nas mi ldog pa dang / sa brgyad pa nas mi ldog pa'o //
translated: The path of preparation is the stage of irreversibility, the path of seeing is the stage of irreversibility, and the eighth stage is the stage of irreversibility.

original: 'di'i don ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las rgyas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las rgyas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood in detail from the treatise of instructions on the noble perfection of wisdom called Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo nyid nas phyir mi ldog pa dang / bden pa mthong ba nas phyir mi ldog pa dang / sa bdun pa nas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo nyid nas phyir mi ldog pa dang / bden pa mthong ba nas phyir mi ldog pa dang / sa bdun pa nas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Moreover, there are three types of irreversibility: irreversibility from the stage of ordinary being, irreversibility from the stage of seeing the truth, and irreversibility from the seventh stage.

original: 'di'i don slob dpon dpal ye shes grags pas mdzad pa'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i bstan bcos chen por gsal bar mdzad pa der blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don slob dpon dpal ye shes grags pas mdzad pa'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i bstan bcos chen por gsal bar mdzad pa der blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood from the great treatise on the stages of entering into reality composed by the master Śrī Jñāna-prakaśa.

original: yang na phyir mi ldog pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na phyir mi ldog pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Or, there are four types of irreversibility:

original: sems bskyed pa nas phyir mi ldog pa dang gsang ste phyir mi ldog pa dang / bzod pa thob nas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nas phyir mi ldog pa dang gsang ste phyir mi ldog pa dang / bzod pa thob nas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: irreversibility from the generation of the mind, irreversibility from the secret, and irreversibility from the attainment of acceptance.

original: dang por skyabs 'gro lan gsum bya zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum re re la lan gsum gsum bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang por skyabs 'gro lan gsum bya zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum re re la lan gsum gsum bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase first, one should go for refuge three times means that one should go for refuge to each of the Three Jewels three times.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba'i don bsdus nas smras pa /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba'i don bsdus nas smras pa /
translated: The meaning of going for refuge is summarized in the following verse:

original: gnas dang rten dang bsam pa dus ;
analyzed: gnas dang rten dang bsam pa dus ;
translated: The basis, the support, the attitude, the time,

original: / bslab pa rang bzhin tshad dang tshul //
analyzed: / bslab pa rang bzhin tshad dang tshul //
translated: the training, the nature, the measure, the method,

original: bya ba dbye ba nges tshig dbye //
analyzed: bya ba dbye ba nges tshig dbye //
translated: the action, the divisions, the definition, the classification,

original: nyes dmigs dgos pa phan yon yin //
analyzed: nyes dmigs dgos pa phan yon yin //
translated: the faults, the purpose, and the benefits.

original: 'dir skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshul brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshul brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the way of going for refuge should be explained.

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las yid nges par byung ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las yid nges par byung ba /
translated: A person who is thoroughly disgusted with the sufferings of cyclic existence,

original: rtag tu 'chi ba rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: rtag tu 'chi ba rjes su dran pa /
translated: who constantly remembers death,

original: rang bzhin gyis snying rje dang shes rab che ba /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis snying rje dang shes rab che ba /
translated: who is naturally compassionate and wise,🔽and who has faith in the Three Jewels

original: so sor thar pa'i ris bdun po las gang yang rung ba'i tshul khrims la skyon med par gnas pa de gal te khyim pa zhig yin na ni dge bsnyen gyi bslab par gyur pa bslab pa'i gzhi lnga dang / de'i phyogs su gtogs pa bslab pa bzhi bcu rtsa lnga dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i ris bdun po las gang yang rung ba'i tshul khrims la skyon med par gnas pa de gal te khyim pa zhig yin na ni dge bsnyen gyi bslab par gyur pa bslab pa'i gzhi lnga dang / de'i phyogs su gtogs pa bslab pa bzhi bcu rtsa lnga dang ldan pa dang /
translated: If they are lay people, they have the precepts of a lay practitioner, which are the five basic precepts, and they have the forty five precepts that are part of those.

original: de rab tu byung ba zhig yin na ni rang gi bslab pa'i tshul dang / ji ltar nyan thos kyi sar bshad pa'i dge sbyong gi rgyan dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / gzhan yang rten bzhi dang / tshul bzhi la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de rab tu byung ba zhig yin na ni rang gi bslab pa'i tshul dang / ji ltar nyan thos kyi sar bshad pa'i dge sbyong gi rgyan dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / gzhan yang rten bzhi dang / tshul bzhi la sogs pa dang /
translated: If they are monastics, they have their own precepts, the ornaments of a monk or nun as explained in the Sravaka Levels, the qualities of ascetic practice, the four supports, the four modes, and so on.

original: gzhan yang cho ga dang / spyod lam dang / 'tsho ba dang / @247b tshul khrims dang / lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang cho ga dang / spyod lam dang / 'tsho ba dang / @247b tshul khrims dang / lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang /
translated: They also have perfect ritual, behavior, livelihood, ethics and views, and they strive in practice without sleeping during the first and last periods of the night.

original: zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa dang / kha na ma thob phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba'i skyes bu de 'di snyam du ma la so sor thar pa'i tshul khrims 'di tsam gyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa dang / kha na ma thob phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba'i skyes bu de 'di snyam du ma la so sor thar pa'i tshul khrims 'di tsam gyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin par mi 'gyur na /
translated: The person who is mindful of the measure of food, who is restrained in the sense doors, and who sees danger in the slightest transgression of the rules thinks, With just this morality of individual liberation, I will not perfect the welfare of myself and others.

original: ji ltar na bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin par 'gyur zhig gu /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin par 'gyur zhig gu /
translated: How can I perfect the welfare of myself and others?

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen po zhes bya ba bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin par byed pa zhig yod ces grag gi /
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen po zhes bya ba bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin par byed pa zhig yod ces grag gi /
translated: Thus, he thinks, It is said that there is something called the 'Great Vehicle' that perfects the welfare of oneself and others.🔽I will seek it from a holy spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dam pa cig las btsal bar bya'o zhes bsams nas bla mar 'os pa'i dam pa de yun ring du yongs su mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dam pa cig las btsal bar bya'o zhes bsams nas bla mar 'os pa'i dam pa de yun ring du yongs su mnyes par byas te /
translated: Having thought this, he pleases for a long time that holy one who is worthy of being a guru.

original: de mnyes par gyur nas de'i zhabs gnyis la mgo bos gtugs te 'di skad du skyes bu dam pa khyod bdag la thugs brtse bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: de mnyes par gyur nas de'i zhabs gnyis la mgo bos gtugs te 'di skad du skyes bu dam pa khyod bdag la thugs brtse bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: When he is pleased, he touches his head to the feet of the guru and says, Holy being, please have compassion for me.

original: bdag la bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin par byed pa'i thabs theg pa chen po'i lam de stsal du gsol zhes g-yo sgyu dang bral ba'i sems kyis zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin par byed pa'i thabs theg pa chen po'i lam de stsal du gsol zhes g-yo sgyu dang bral ba'i sems kyis zhu bar bya'o //
translated: With a mind free from deceit and pretense, one should request, Please grant me the path of the Great Vehicle, the method for perfecting the welfare of both myself and others.

original: de nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen des slob ma de brtag pa gsum gyis brtags te /
analyzed: de nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen des slob ma de brtag pa gsum gyis brtags te /
translated: Then, the virtuous spiritual friend should examine that disciple with three examinations:

original: 'di ltar spyod lam dang / rmi lam dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i pra dbab pas brtags la de snod du 'dug par shes nas bla ma de yid dga' ba dang / bzhin 'dzum pa dang / zang zing dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyod lam dang / rmi lam dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i pra dbab pas brtags la de snod du 'dug par shes nas bla ma de yid dga' ba dang / bzhin 'dzum pa dang / zang zing dang /
translated: in this way, by examining their conduct, dreams, and the worldly and transcendent deities, if it is known that they are a suitable vessel, that guru, with a joyful mind, a smiling face, and a mind free from material things,

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang bral ba'i sems dang slob ma de la snying brtse ba'i sems kyis sdig pa can gyi skye bos dben pa'i sa phyogs su sa gzhi legs par 'thas par byas la gtsang ba der ba'i rnam lngas skyang nul dang byug pa byas la /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang bral ba'i sems dang slob ma de la snying brtse ba'i sems kyis sdig pa can gyi skye bos dben pa'i sa phyogs su sa gzhi legs par 'thas par byas la gtsang ba der ba'i rnam lngas skyang nul dang byug pa byas la /
translated: gain, and honor, with a mind of love for that disciple, in a place free from sinful beings, having well-leveled the ground, having swept and anointed it with the five cow products,

original: tsandan la sogs pa'i dri phul du byung bas kyang byugs shing der dri zhim po'i me tog sil mas gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan la sogs pa'i dri phul du byung bas kyang byugs shing der dri zhim po'i me tog sil mas gtor bar bya'o //
translated: It should be anointed with excellent scents such as sandalwood, and strewn with fragrant flowers.

original: der dkon mchog gsum gyi gzugs brnyan lugs ma la sogs pa dang / po ti la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams khri'am stegs bu la bzhugs par bya'o //🔽der bla re la sogs pa dang / me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i yo byad ji ltar 'byor pa dang / rol mo'i bye brag dang / zhal zas dang / rgyan cha la @248a * //
analyzed: der dkon mchog gsum gyi gzugs brnyan lugs ma la sogs pa dang / po ti la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams khri'am stegs bu la bzhugs par bya'o // der bla re la sogs pa dang / me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i yo byad ji ltar 'byor pa dang / rol mo'i bye brag dang / zhal zas dang / rgyan cha la @248a * //
translated: There, one should place images of the Three Jewels, such as paintings, books, and so on, and the bodhisattvas on thrones or platforms.

original: sogs pa sta gon byed du bcug la /
analyzed: sogs pa sta gon byed du bcug la /
translated: There, one should arrange canopies and so on, as well as whatever articles of offering one has, such as flowers, and various musical instruments, food, ornaments, and so on.

original: de nas slob ma des gdan khri me tog gis brgyan pa'i steng du dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzhugs su gsol la /
analyzed: de nas slob ma des gdan khri me tog gis brgyan pa'i steng du dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzhugs su gsol la /
translated: Then, the disciple should invite the spiritual friend to sit on a high seat adorned with flowers.

original: 'di snyam du 'di ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i skyabs dang dpung gnyen yin no snyam du bla ma la ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed la ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'di ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i skyabs dang dpung gnyen yin no snyam du bla ma la ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed la ;
translated: Thinking that this spiritual friend is the refuge and protector of all beings without exception, one should generate the perception of the teacher as the Buddha.

original: khrus byas te gos gtsang ma bgos la bsam pa bzang po dang ldan pas 'di skad du rigs kyi bu khyod mkhyen par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: khrus byas te gos gtsang ma bgos la bsam pa bzang po dang ldan pas 'di skad du rigs kyi bu khyod mkhyen par mdzad du gsol /
translated: “Son of good family, please understand this:

original: bdag 'khor ba'i gnas 'dir thog ma med pa'i dus nas sdug bsngal du mas gtses shing shin tu nyam thag par gyur te /🔽mgon ma mchis pa /
analyzed: bdag 'khor ba'i gnas 'dir thog ma med pa'i dus nas sdug bsngal du mas gtses shing shin tu nyam thag par gyur te / mgon ma mchis pa /
translated: I, in this place of cyclic existence, from beginningless time, have been tormented by many sufferings, and have become extremely weak.🔽I have no protector.

original: skyabs ma mchis pa /
analyzed: skyabs ma mchis pa /
translated: I have no refuge.

original: dpung gnyen ma mchis pa /
analyzed: dpung gnyen ma mchis pa /
translated: I have no ally.

original: bdag gi mgon dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen mdzad du gsol zhes lan gsum du bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mgon dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen mdzad du gsol zhes lan gsum du bya'o //
translated: Please be my protector, refuge, and ally.”

original: de nas bla ma des 'di skad du skyes bu khyod 'khor ba las skyo zhing yid byung bas shing rta chen po'i lam la 'jug par 'dod pa shin tu legs so //
analyzed: de nas bla ma des 'di skad du skyes bu khyod 'khor ba las skyo zhing yid byung bas shing rta chen po'i lam la 'jug par 'dod pa shin tu legs so //
translated: Then the guru should say this: “Person, you who are disgusted with cyclic existence, and who wish to enter the path of the great charioteers, that is excellent.

original: 'di ltar shes par gyis shig / dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / dpung gnyen med pa dag gi mgon dang / skyabs dang dpung gnyen du gyur pa yod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes par gyis shig / dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / dpung gnyen med pa dag gi mgon dang / skyabs dang dpung gnyen du gyur pa yod kyi /
translated: You should understand it in the following way: The so-called Three Jewels are the protector, the refuge, and the ally of those who are without a protector, without a refuge, and without an ally.

original: khyod dang ba'i yid dang / shin tu spro ba'i yid kyis 'gro ba mtha' dag yul du byas te /
analyzed: khyod dang ba'i yid dang / shin tu spro ba'i yid kyis 'gro ba mtha' dag yul du byas te /
translated: With a mind full of faith and a mind full of joy, you should take all beings as your object and

original: de las skyabs su 'gro ba gyis shig / de la sri zhu dang / bsnyen bkur tshul bzhin du bya ba'i phyir mchod pa'i yo byad 'byor pa ci yod pas tshogs par gyis shig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las skyabs su 'gro ba gyis shig / de la sri zhu dang / bsnyen bkur tshul bzhin du bya ba'i phyir mchod pa'i yo byad 'byor pa ci yod pas tshogs par gyis shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: take refuge in them. For the sake of properly serving and venerating them, you should gather together whatever offering articles you have.

original: de nas slob ma des pus mo gnyis sa la btsugs shing thal mo sbyar nas me tog phul te //
analyzed: de nas slob ma des pus mo gnyis sa la btsugs shing thal mo sbyar nas me tog phul te //
translated: Then the disciple, having placed his two knees on the ground and joined his palms, should offer a flower and

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: say the following:

original: skyes bu gtso bo dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: skyes bu gtso bo dgongs su gsol //
translated: “Great being, please consider me.

original: thog ma med nas 'di bar du //
analyzed: thog ma med nas 'di bar du //
translated: From beginningless time until now,

original: bdag ni 'khor bar 'khor gyur te //
analyzed: bdag ni 'khor bar 'khor gyur te //
translated: I have been wandering in saṃsāra

original: sdug bsngal rnams kyis shin tu dub //
