analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams kyis shin tu dub //
translated: and am exhausted by suffering.

original: gang gis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa'i //🔽lam de khyod kyis bstan du gsol //🔽zhes lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa'i // lam de khyod kyis bstan du gsol // zhes lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: that leads to the end of suffering.

original: de nas bla ma des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dkon mchog thams cad yul du byas la /🔽lus kyi bkod pa brjod du med par mos la /
analyzed: de nas bla ma des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dkon mchog thams cad yul du byas la / lus kyi bkod pa brjod du med par mos la /
translated: Then, the guru should visualize all the jewels of the world systems of the ten directions as the field of worship.

original: lus re re la mgo brjod du med pa dang / mgo re re la lce brjod du med par mos te /
analyzed: lus re re la mgo brjod du med pa dang / mgo re re la lce brjod du med par mos te /
translated: He should imagine that his body is transformed into an inexpressible number of bodies, each of which has an inexpressible number of heads, and each head has an inexpressible number of tongues.

original: sngar brjod pa'i lus dang ngag gi mchod pa dang / zang zing gi mchod pa rgya @248b che ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dag ni mchod pa rnam pa bdun zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i lus dang ngag gi mchod pa dang / zang zing gi mchod pa rgya @248b che ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dag ni mchod pa rnam pa bdun zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: Then, with those bodies, he should perform the seven-limbed worship, which consists of the previously mentioned offerings of body and speech, the vast offering of gifts, the confession of sins, rejoicing in one’s own and others’ virtues, requesting the buddhas to teach, imploring them not to pass into nirvāṇa, and the dedication of merit.

original: mchod pa rnam pa bdun po de'i rjes la skyabs su 'gro ba bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa bdun po de'i rjes la skyabs su 'gro ba bya'o //
translated: After that seven-limbed worship, one should go for refuge.

original: de ltar skyabs su song ba des skyabs su 'gro ba'i bslab pa bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar skyabs su song ba des skyabs su 'gro ba'i bslab pa bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: One who has thus gone for refuge should observe the precepts of going for refuge.

original: lha gzhan la phyag mi btsal ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang 'tshe ba spang ba dang / mu stegs can dang mi 'grogs shing de dag la bsnyen bkur mi bya ba dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi khyad par dang / yon tan rjes su dran pas yang dang yang du skyabs su 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: lha gzhan la phyag mi btsal ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang 'tshe ba spang ba dang / mu stegs can dang mi 'grogs shing de dag la bsnyen bkur mi bya ba dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi khyad par dang / yon tan rjes su dran pas yang dang yang du skyabs su 'gro ba dang /
translated: One should not bow down to other deities, should avoid harming and injuring others, should not associate with tīrthikas or honor them, and should go for refuge again and again by recollecting the distinctions and good qualities of the Three Jewels.

original: bka' drin chen po rjes su dran pas dus rtag tu mchod pa la brtson zhing bza' ba dang btung ba'i phud kyang dbul ba dang / snying rje rjes su dran pas 'gro ba gzhan yang tshul 'di lta bu la nye bar dgod pa dang / bya ba gang byed pa dang /
analyzed: bka' drin chen po rjes su dran pas dus rtag tu mchod pa la brtson zhing bza' ba dang btung ba'i phud kyang dbul ba dang / snying rje rjes su dran pas 'gro ba gzhan yang tshul 'di lta bu la nye bar dgod pa dang / bya ba gang byed pa dang /
translated: One should always strive to make offerings by recollecting their great kindness and should offer the first portion of one’s food and drink. One should establish other beings in this practice by recollecting compassion.

original: dgos pa ci yod pa na dkon mchog gsum la mchod nas gsol ba 'debs shing 'jig rten pa'i thabs gzhan spang ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ci yod pa na dkon mchog gsum la mchod nas gsol ba 'debs shing 'jig rten pa'i thabs gzhan spang ba'o //
translated: Whatever one does and whatever one needs, one should make offerings to the Three Jewels, make requests, and abandon other worldly means.

original: phan yon ni gsum 'thob ste /
analyzed: phan yon ni gsum 'thob ste /
translated: There are three benefits:

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i dus dang / lam gyi dus dang / 'bras bu'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i dus dang / lam gyi dus dang / 'bras bu'i dus so //
translated: at the time of the cause, at the time of the path, and at the time of the result.

original: dang po ni tshe rabs 'di dang gzhan gyi phan yon te bla ma las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po ni tshe rabs 'di dang gzhan gyi phan yon te bla ma las shes par bya'o //
translated: The first is the benefit in this life and in other lives, which should be known from the guru.

original: de ltar skyabs su song ba'i phan yon shes pa des nyin lan gsum dang mtshan lan gsum du skyabs su 'gro bar bya zhing /🔽dkon mchog gsum than bzhad gad kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: de ltar skyabs su song ba'i phan yon shes pa des nyin lan gsum dang mtshan lan gsum du skyabs su 'gro bar bya zhing / dkon mchog gsum than bzhad gad kyi phyir ram /
translated: One who knows the benefits of going for refuge in that way should go for refuge three times in the day and three times at night.

original: srog gi phyir gtang bar mi bya zhing bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: srog gi phyir gtang bar mi bya zhing bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: One should not give up the Three Jewels for the sake of a joke or for the sake of one's life, but should protect them.

original: de ltar skyabs su 'gro ba khyad par can bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar skyabs su 'gro ba khyad par can bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the special going for refuge,

original: da ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the generation of the mind of enlightenment,

original: de nas sems can thams cad la zhes pa la sogs pa tshig rkang sum cu rtsa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: de nas sems can thams cad la zhes pa la sogs pa tshig rkang sum cu rtsa bzhis bstan te /
translated: it is taught by thirty-four lines beginning with Then, to all sentient beings...

original: de nas zhes pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba byas nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba byas nas zhes bya'o //
translated: Then means having gone for refuge.

original: sems can thams cad ces pas ni sems bskyed pa'i dmigs pa bstan te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces pas ni sems bskyed pa'i dmigs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “all sentient beings” indicates the object of observation for arousing the Thought.

original: de yang sems can ni 'di tsam du zad do zhes tshad gzung bar mi nus te /🔽mdo las gal te phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad chu'i dkyil 'khor du gyur la /
analyzed: de yang sems can ni 'di tsam du zad do zhes tshad gzung bar mi nus te / mdo las gal te phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad chu'i dkyil 'khor du gyur la /
translated: Moreover, one cannot measure the number of sentient beings by saying “sentient beings are just this much.”

original: skyes bu zhig gis lo brgya phrag stong stong na spu'i rtse mo zhig gis chu de las 'thor bar byed na chu'i dkyil 'khor ni zad par @249a * //
analyzed: skyes bu zhig gis lo brgya phrag stong stong na spu'i rtse mo zhig gis chu de las 'thor bar byed na chu'i dkyil 'khor ni zad par @249a * //
translated: A sūtra says: If the water-circle of all the world systems in the ten directions were to become a human body, and if a person were to remove a drop of water from it every hundred years, the water-circle would be exhausted,🔽but the realm of sentient beings would not be exhausted.

original: 'gyur gyi / sems can gyi khams ni zad par 'gyur ba med do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: 'gyur gyi / sems can gyi khams ni zad par 'gyur ba med do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: And the noble Sūtra of the King of Prayers, the Purely Shining Conduct of Samantabhadra says:

original: nam mkha'i mthar thug gyur pa ji rtsam par //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthar thug gyur pa ji rtsam par //
translated: As far as the end of space,

original: sems can ma lus mtha' yang de tsam mo //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can ma lus mtha' yang de tsam mo // zhes gsungs so //
translated: so is the extent of sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i sems can yul du byas nas sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems can yul du byas nas sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should arouse the Thought, taking sentient beings as the object in that way.

original: byams pa'i sems ni sngon 'gro bas //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems ni sngon 'gro bas //
translated: Since the mind of love is the preliminary,🔽The mind of gratitude arises from the perception of mother.

original: zhes pa ni mar 'du shes pa las drin du gzo ba'i sems 'byung ba ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mar 'du shes pa las drin du gzo ba'i sems 'byung ba ni byams pa'o //
translated: Love is the mind of gratitude.

original: byams pa'i sems las snying rje'i sems 'byung la snying rje'i sems las byang chub kyi sems 'byung bas na bdag gis 'dir /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems las snying rje'i sems 'byung la snying rje'i sems las byang chub kyi sems 'byung bas na bdag gis 'dir /
translated: From the mind of love, the mind of compassion arises. From the mind of compassion, the mind of enlightenment arises. Therefore, here I say:

original: byams pa'i sems ni sngon 'gro bas //🔽zhes smras so //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems ni sngon 'gro bas // zhes smras so //
translated: Since the mind of love is the preliminary,

original: tshig rkang pa bdun ni dkyus ji lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshig rkang pa bdun ni dkyus ji lta ba nyid do //
translated: The seven lines are just as they appear in the text.

original: byang chub sems ni bskyed par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba byas pa'i rjes la yang bdag la 'byor pa ci yod pas dkon mchog gsum dang bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen la mchod pa dbul ba tshul bzhin du byas la /
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bskyed par bya // zhes bya ba ni gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba byas pa'i rjes la yang bdag la 'byor pa ci yod pas dkon mchog gsum dang bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen la mchod pa dbul ba tshul bzhin du byas la /
translated: The mind of enlightenment should be generated.🔽After going for refuge to the Three Jewels, one should make offerings to the Three Jewels and to the guru spiritual friend with whatever wealth one has.

original: bla ma'i spyan sngar mandala byas te /
analyzed: bla ma'i spyan sngar mandala byas te /
translated: Having done that properly, one should make a maṇḍala in front of the guru.

original: bsam pa bzang po g-yo sgyu dang bral bas bla ma 'di ni sangs rgyas mngon sum na bzhugs pa nyid yin no snyam du bsams la /
analyzed: bsam pa bzang po g-yo sgyu dang bral bas bla ma 'di ni sangs rgyas mngon sum na bzhugs pa nyid yin no snyam du bsams la /
translated: With a good motivation, free of deceit, think, This guru is like the Buddha himself dwelling in the present.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdzad pa de dag ma lus par bdag gis rdzogs par bya'o zhes bsams la /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdzad pa de dag ma lus par bdag gis rdzogs par bya'o zhes bsams la /
translated: Think, I will complete all the deeds of all the buddhas of the three times without exception.

original: pus mo gnyis sa la btsugs pas me tog phul la /
analyzed: pus mo gnyis sa la btsugs pas me tog phul la /
translated: With your two knees on the ground, offer flowers and say:

original: thal mo legs par sbyar la 'di skad du /
analyzed: thal mo legs par sbyar la 'di skad du /
translated: With your palms joined, say:

original: kun mkhyen ye shes phung po can //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes phung po can //
translated: You who are a mass of omniscient wisdom,

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo rnam sbyong ba //🔽khyod zhabs padma spangs nas ni //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo rnam sbyong ba // khyod zhabs padma spangs nas ni //
translated: You who purify the wheel of existence,🔽 I will not go to another refuge,

original: gtso bo gzhan la skyabs ma mchis //
analyzed: gtso bo gzhan la skyabs ma mchis //
translated: I will not go to another chief.

original: 'gro ba'i dpa' bo thub chen gyis //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dpa' bo thub chen gyis //
translated: Great sage, hero of migrators,

original: bdag la bka' drin stsal du gsol //🔽byang chub sems mchog bla med pa //
analyzed: bdag la bka' drin stsal du gsol // byang chub sems mchog bla med pa //
translated: Please grant me your kindness.🔽 Please grant me the supreme, unsurpassed,

original: dam pa de ni bdag la stsol //
analyzed: dam pa de ni bdag la stsol //
translated: Excellent thought of enlightenment.

original: zhes lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Repeat this three times.

original: de nas bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa chen po la bzhugs pa thams cad dang / sngon dang da ltar gyi bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de nas bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa chen po la bzhugs pa thams cad dang / sngon dang da ltar gyi bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag spyan drangs te /
translated: Then, the spiritual teacher, the guru, invites the Blessed Buddhas of the ten directions and the world systems, and all the bodhisattvas, the great heroes, who abide on the great stages, and the spiritual teachers, the gurus, of the past and present.

original: de dag gi spyan sngar @249b 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i cho gas rgyud legs par dag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi spyan sngar @249b 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i cho gas rgyud legs par dag par bya'o //
translated: In their presence, the disciple should purify his or her mindstream through the rite of the noble Akashagarbha and the Bodhisattva Stages.

original: de ltar snod shin tu sbyangs nas bla ma la slob ma des yang lag pa me tog dang bcas pas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar snod shin tu sbyangs nas bla ma la slob ma des yang lag pa me tog dang bcas pas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having thoroughly purified the vessel, the disciple should then request the guru with hands placed together and with flowers.

original: bla ma des rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang ; grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems med pas 'di snyam du /
analyzed: bla ma des rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang ; grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems med pas 'di snyam du /
translated: The guru, without any thought of gain, honor, fame, reputation, or material things, should think:

original: ae ma ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: ae ma ngo mtshar ro //
translated: “How wonderful!

original: 'jigs pa chen po'i dus 'dir 'di lta bu'i sems can dam pa 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar ro zhes bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa bzang pos chog bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po'i dus 'dir 'di lta bu'i sems can dam pa 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar ro zhes bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa bzang pos chog bya'o //
translated: With a pure superior intention, one should make offerings.

original: de yang 'dzam bu'i gling ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi dgongs pa tha dad par gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'dzam bu'i gling ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi dgongs pa tha dad par gyur te /
translated: Moreover, regarding Jambudvīpa, there were different opinions among the masters of the past.

original: slob dpon rgyal po aindra bh'u ti dang / slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub dang / slob dpon 'phags pa sh'an ta de ba dang / slob dpon 'phags pa tsandra go mi dang / slob dpon damshtra se na dang ; slob dpon dpa' bo dang /
analyzed: slob dpon rgyal po aindra bh'u ti dang / slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub dang / slob dpon 'phags pa sh'an ta de ba dang / slob dpon 'phags pa tsandra go mi dang / slob dpon damshtra se na dang ; slob dpon dpa' bo dang /
translated: Masters such as King Indrabhūti, Ārya Nāgārjuna, Ārya Śāntideva, Ārya Candragomin, Ārya Mañjuśrī, Ārya Dāruka,

original: slob dpon sh'an ta ra te la sogs pa mkhas pa chen po de dag gi dgongs pa ni 'di ltar tha dad par 'gyur te /🔽dang por ni byang chub kyi sems de nyid la tha dad par gyur to //
analyzed: slob dpon sh'an ta ra te la sogs pa mkhas pa chen po de dag gi dgongs pa ni 'di ltar tha dad par 'gyur te / dang por ni byang chub kyi sems de nyid la tha dad par gyur to //
translated: and the great scholars such as Śāntipa had different opinions.🔽First, there were differences regarding the very nature of bodhicitta.

original: gnyis par ni byang chub kyi sems de'i cho ga la tha dad par gyur to //
analyzed: gnyis par ni byang chub kyi sems de'i cho ga la tha dad par gyur to //
translated: Second, there were differences regarding the ritual of bodhicitta.

original: gsum par ni byang chub kyi sems de skye ba'i tshul la'o //
analyzed: gsum par ni byang chub kyi sems de skye ba'i tshul la'o //
translated: The third is the way in which that Thought of Enlightenment is generated.

original: bzhi par ni sems de'i bslab bya'i tshul la tha dad par gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi par ni sems de'i bslab bya'i tshul la tha dad par gyur te /
translated: The fourth is the way of the training in that Thought.

original: don dang po de la slob dpon kha cig gi zhal nas mos pas spyod pa pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems de ni smon pa'i sems yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don dang po de la slob dpon kha cig gi zhal nas mos pas spyod pa pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems de ni smon pa'i sems yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In regard to that first topic, some masters say that the Thought which is included in the mundane path of the one practicing with devoted interest is the Thought of Aspiration.

original: la la'i zhal nas ni ji srid dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems de ni kun rdzob kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: la la'i zhal nas ni ji srid dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems de ni kun rdzob kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: Some say that as long as the Thought is one with an objective reference, it is the conventional aspect,

original: smon pa'i sems so zhes bzhed do //
analyzed: smon pa'i sems so zhes bzhed do //
translated: the Thought of Aspiration.

original: gzhan ni tshogs kyi lam pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i sems de ni smon pa'i sems yin no zhes bzhed do //
analyzed: gzhan ni tshogs kyi lam pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i sems de ni smon pa'i sems yin no zhes bzhed do //
translated: Others say that the Thought which generates the roots of virtue that are favorable to liberation, on the path of accumulation, is the Thought of Aspiration.

original: kha cig ni bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems ni smon pa'i sems yin no zhes bzhed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems ni smon pa'i sems yin no zhes bzhed do //
translated: Some say that the Thought which is not endowed with the performance of merit is the Thought of Aspiration.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some say that

original: 'gro bar 'dod dang 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'dod dang 'gro ba yi //
translated: the Thought of Aspiration is like the desire to go,🔽and the Thought of Engagement is like the act of going.

original: zhes pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub yul du byed pa tsam de ni smon pa'i sems yin no zhes bzhed do //
analyzed: zhes pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub yul du byed pa tsam de ni smon pa'i sems yin no zhes bzhed do //
translated: Thus, the mere taking of perfect enlightenment as an object is the aspirational mind.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan yang yod de gzhung mangs par @250a * //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan yang yod de gzhung mangs par @250a * //
translated: There are other [interpretations], but this text would become too wordy.

original: 'gyur ro // gnyis pa'i don la yang tha dad par gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // gnyis pa'i don la yang tha dad par gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the second [line] is also divided.

original: de dag nyid kyis mdzad pa'i gzhung de dang der blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis mdzad pa'i gzhung de dang der blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should look at that text composed by them.

original: gsum pa'i don la yang kha cig ni gang zag gi drung du byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas kyang de skye bar bzhed do //
analyzed: gsum pa'i don la yang kha cig ni gang zag gi drung du byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas kyang de skye bar bzhed do //
translated: Regarding the meaning of the third [line], some assert that the generation of the mind of enlightenment also arises through generating the mind of enlightenment in the presence of a person.

original: la la ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar ma yin par sems bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: la la ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar ma yin par sems bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Some explain that one should not generate the mind of enlightenment in the presence of a buddha.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di skad du //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di skad du //
translated: Others say:

original: byang chub kyi sems skye ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i tshul gyis skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bzhed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems skye ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i tshul gyis skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bzhed do //
translated: The generation of the mind of enlightenment arises in the manner of four aspects.

original: don 'di bzhi pa la yang tha dad par gyur te /
analyzed: don 'di bzhi pa la yang tha dad par gyur te /
translated: This meaning of the fourth [line] is also divided.

original: kha cig gi zhal nas byang chub sems dpa' ni lnga ste /
analyzed: kha cig gi zhal nas byang chub sems dpa' ni lnga ste /
translated: From the mouths of some, it is said: The bodhisattva is fivefold.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'o //🔽de la snga ma gnyis kyi bslab pa ji snyed pa'i zhes bzhed do //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'o // de la snga ma gnyis kyi bslab pa ji snyed pa'i zhes bzhed do //
translated: the first generation of the Thought, the entrance into the career, the stage of nonretrogression, the acceptance of the nonoriginatedness of things, and the stage of being obstructed by only one birth.

original: la las ni mdo las gsungs pa thams cad bsrung bar bya ba yin no zhes bzhad do ;
analyzed: la las ni mdo las gsungs pa thams cad bsrung bar bya ba yin no zhes bzhad do ;
translated: Some say that one should observe all the precepts taught in the sutras.

original: / la la ni tshogs kyi lam pa'i bslab pa ji snyed pa bsrung bar bya'o zhes bzhad do //
analyzed: / la la ni tshogs kyi lam pa'i bslab pa ji snyed pa bsrung bar bya'o zhes bzhad do //
translated: Some say that one should observe all the precepts of the path of accumulation.

original: gzhan dag ni bslab pa 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes mi bzhed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bslab pa 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes mi bzhed do //
translated: Others do not accept any such precepts as these.

original: kha cig ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i bslab pa'i thog tu sdong po bkod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i mdo dang / dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdo la sogs par yang bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: kha cig ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i bslab pa'i thog tu sdong po bkod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i mdo dang / dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdo la sogs par yang bshad mod kyi /
translated: Some say that in addition to the precepts of taking refuge, one should observe those taught in the Gandavyuha, the Sutra on the Acceptance of the Roots of Virtue, the Sutra on the Generation of the Power of Faith, and so on.

original: re zhig 'phags pa 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las byang chub kyi sems brjed par 'gyur ba dang / brjed par mi 'gyur ba'i chos brgyad bsrung bar bya'o zhes bzhed do //
analyzed: re zhig 'phags pa 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las byang chub kyi sems brjed par 'gyur ba dang / brjed par mi 'gyur ba'i chos brgyad bsrung bar bya'o zhes bzhed do //
translated: For the time being, the noble Kasyapa-pariprccha-sutra accepts that one should protect the eight dharmas which cause one to forget the Thought of Enlightenment and those which do not cause one to forget it.

original: de dag ni mtshon pa tsam dang / 'di ltar sngon gyi mkhas pa chen po de dag gi lugs thams cad 'dir bkod par gyur na ni gzhung shin tu mangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mtshon pa tsam dang / 'di ltar sngon gyi mkhas pa chen po de dag gi lugs thams cad 'dir bkod par gyur na ni gzhung shin tu mangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: These are merely illustrations, for if all the systems of those great scholars of the past were set forth here, this text would become too verbose.

original: slob dpon chen po de rnams ni theg pa chen po'i lam la tshad ma'i skyes bur gyur pa /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po de rnams ni theg pa chen po'i lam la tshad ma'i skyes bur gyur pa /
translated: Those great Acaryas were persons of authority on the Mahayana path.

original: byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po la goms pa /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po la goms pa /
translated: They were accustomed to great love and great compassion.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis la thugs brtan pa'o ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis la thugs brtan pa'o ;
translated: They were firm in the two kinds of Thought of Enlightenment.

original: ; de la slob dpon kha cig gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: ; de la slob dpon kha cig gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub brnyes pa'o //
translated: Some of those Acaryas attained the siddhi of the Great Seal.

original: la las ni bden pa gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: la las ni bden pa gzigs pa'o //
translated: Some saw the Truths.

original: la las ni 'jig rten chos mchog chen po brnyes nas sprul pa'i sku las gdams ngag thob pa dag yin pa dang / mdo nyid na yang de dag ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du bcom @250b ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas /
analyzed: la las ni 'jig rten chos mchog chen po brnyes nas sprul pa'i sku las gdams ngag thob pa dag yin pa dang / mdo nyid na yang de dag ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du bcom @250b ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas /
translated: And in the sutra itself, the Bhagavat taught in accordance with their aspirations.

original: de dag ni lam chen po nyid yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lam chen po nyid yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that they are the Great Path.

original: 'on kyang rang rang gi bla ma dag gis ji ltar gnang ba'i lugs de gzung bar bya'o zhes bdag gi bla ma dag gsung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang rang gi bla ma dag gis ji ltar gnang ba'i lugs de gzung bar bya'o zhes bdag gi bla ma dag gsung ngo //
translated: However, one should follow the system as it was given to them by their own gurus.

original: de la 'dir re zhig slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub dang / slob dpon 'phags pa thogs med dang / slob dpon 'phags pa sh'an ta de ba dag smon pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i cho ga'i tshul 'di la tha dad pa med cing mthun pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'dir re zhig slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub dang / slob dpon 'phags pa thogs med dang / slob dpon 'phags pa sh'an ta de ba dag smon pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i cho ga'i tshul 'di la tha dad pa med cing mthun pa dang /
translated: In this regard, the noble masters Nagarjuna, Asanga, and the noble Santaraksita do not differ in this method of the rite for generating the aspirational spirit of enlightenment.

original: da ltar bdag gi bla ma rje btsun dpal byang chub bzang po dang / bla ma rje btsun su wa rnna dva'i pa dag kyang 'phags pa de dag gi rjes su 'brang ba dang / bdag kyang bla ma rje btsun de dag gi rjes su 'brang ba yin pas bdag la slob ma'i tshogs kyis gsol ba btab nas byas pa'i cho ga'i thangs  cung zhig bdag gis bkod pa ni 'phags pa klu sgrub dang /
analyzed: da ltar bdag gi bla ma rje btsun dpal byang chub bzang po dang / bla ma rje btsun su wa rnna dva'i pa dag kyang 'phags pa de dag gi rjes su 'brang ba dang / bdag kyang bla ma rje btsun de dag gi rjes su 'brang ba yin pas bdag la slob ma'i tshogs kyis gsol ba btab nas byas pa'i cho ga'i thangs  cung zhig bdag gis bkod pa ni 'phags pa klu sgrub dang /
translated: My own gurus, the glorious glorious Jangchup Sempa, and the guru Suvarnadvipa, follow those aryas, and I follow those gurus.

original: 'phags pa thogs med dang / 'phags pa sh'an ta de ba dag gi lugs yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med dang / 'phags pa sh'an ta de ba dag gi lugs yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the brief ritual I have composed at the request of my disciples is in the tradition of the arya Nagarjuna, the arya Asanga, and the arya Santideva.

original: de dag ni zhar la bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zhar la bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the digression.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi ljon shing skye ba la chu'i rlan lta bu'i chos gnyis sngon du 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi ljon shing skye ba la chu'i rlan lta bu'i chos gnyis sngon du 'gro ba yin te /
translated: There are two things that precede the arising of the tree of the thought of awakening like the moisture of water:

original: 'di ltar sems sbyang ba dang / bla ma la yon dbul ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems sbyang ba dang / bla ma la yon dbul ba'o //
translated: the purification of the mind and the offering of gifts to the guru.

original: bla ma la yon dbul ba yang 'phags pa bskal pa bzang po'i mdo dang / snying rje chen po las ji ltar 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bla ma la yon dbul ba yang 'phags pa bskal pa bzang po'i mdo dang / snying rje chen po las ji ltar 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Also, the offering of a gift to the guru should be done in accordance with the noble Akasagarbhasutra and the Mahakarunavatara.

original: sems sbyang ba ni 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i smon lam sngar ji skad brjod pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i tshul gyis bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems sbyang ba ni 'phags pa kun du bzang po'i smon lam sngar ji skad brjod pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i tshul gyis bya ba yin no //
translated: The training of the mind is done in accordance with the noble Samantabhadra's prayer as previously cited and also in accordance with the method of the Bodhicaryiivatiira.

original: de nas skye bo chen po'i chos lugs shing rta chen po'i lam bla ma gcig tu brgyud pa slob dpon chen po sh'an ta de ba'i cho ga'am /
analyzed: de nas skye bo chen po'i chos lugs shing rta chen po'i lam bla ma gcig tu brgyud pa slob dpon chen po sh'an ta de ba'i cho ga'am /
translated: Then, having gone for refuge in the guru's system of the Dharma of the great beings, which is the path of the great charioteers, one should generate the thought of supreme enlightenment in accordance with the rite of the great master Santaraksita, which is transmitted from one guru to another, or in accordance with the rite of the great master Asanga.

original: slob dpon chen po thogs med kyi cho gas tshad med pa bzhi po bsgom pa sngon du song bas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //🔽de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i slob ma'i rgyud de las /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po thogs med kyi cho gas tshad med pa bzhi po bsgom pa sngon du song bas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o // de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i slob ma'i rgyud de las /
translated: Having first cultivated the four immeasurables, one should generate the thought of supreme enlightenment.

original: sems kyi khyad par ji lta bu zhig skye zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par ji lta bu zhig skye zhe na /
translated: What kind of special thought arises in the mindstream of the disciple who has generated the thought of enlightenment in this way?

original: don 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs te /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: don 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs te / ji skad du /
translated: With this point in mind, the Transcendent Conqueror taught in the noble Aksayamatinirdesha-sūtra:

original: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
translated: Aksayamati said:

original: btsun pa sh'a ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems @251a * //
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems @251a * //
translated: Venerable Shariputra, the bodhisattvas’

original: dpa' rnams kyi sems dang po bskyed pa de ni mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' rnams kyi sems dang po bskyed pa de ni mi zad pa'o //
translated: first production of the thought of enlightenment is inexhaustible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unadulterated.

original: sems de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres par skyes so //
analyzed: sems de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres par skyes so //
translated: That thought is produced unadulterated with any afflictions.

original: theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa med pas sems de ni ma 'brel bar skyes so //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa med pas sems de ni ma 'brel bar skyes so //
translated: Because it does not aspire to other vehicles, that thought is produced unmixed.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pas sems de ni sra bar skyes so //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pas sems de ni sra bar skyes so //
translated: Because it cannot be taken away by any opponents, that thought is produced as firm.

original: sems de ni bdud thams cad kyis mi phyed par skyes so //
analyzed: sems de ni bdud thams cad kyis mi phyed par skyes so //
translated: That thought is produced indivisible by any demons.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub pas sems de brtan par skyes so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub pas sems de brtan par skyes so //
translated: Because it accomplishes all roots of virtue, that thought is produced as stable.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag par shin tu rig pas sems de ni rtag par skyes so //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag par shin tu rig pas sems de ni rtag par skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as permanent, because of the thorough knowledge that all compounded things are impermanent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pas sems de ni mi g-yo bar skyes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pas sems de ni mi g-yo bar skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as unmoving, because of the gathering of all the Buddha qualities.

original: log par sgrub pa thams cad dang bral bas sems de ni mi brje par skyes so //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa thams cad dang bral bas sems de ni mi brje par skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as unchangeable, because of being free from all wrong practice.

original: mi bskyed pas sems de ni rtag par skyes so //
analyzed: mi bskyed pas sems de ni rtag par skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as permanent, because of not being produced.

original: gnyen po med pas sems de ni dpe med par skyes so //
analyzed: gnyen po med pas sems de ni dpe med par skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as incomparable, because of being without antidote.

original: chos thams cad 'bigs pas sems de ni rdo rje lta bur skyes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'bigs pas sems de ni rdo rje lta bur skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as diamond-like, because of piercing all dharmas.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pas sems de ni mu med par skyes so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pas sems de ni mu med par skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as boundless, because of the accumulation of immeasurable stores of merit.

original: sems can thams cad la sems de ni mnyam par skyes so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems de ni mnyam par skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as equal, because of being the same in all sentient beings.

original: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas sems de ni rnam par dag par skyes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas sems de ni rnam par dag par skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as pure, because of being naturally without defilement.

original: shes rab kyi 'od gsal ba'i phyir sems de ni dri ma med par skyes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'od gsal ba'i phyir sems de ni dri ma med par skyes so //
translated: This thought is born as stainless, because of the bright light of wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma bor bar sems de ni shin tu nges par skyes so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma bor bar sems de ni shin tu nges par skyes so //
translated: That thought is born with complete certainty, without losing the higher intention.

original: byams pa nam mkha' dang mnyam zhing mtshungs pas na sems de ni yangs par skyes so //
analyzed: byams pa nam mkha' dang mnyam zhing mtshungs pas na sems de ni yangs par skyes so //
translated: That thought is born with vastness, because love is equal to and the same as space.

original: sems can thams cad go 'byed pas sems de ni rgya che bar skyes so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad go 'byed pas sems de ni rgya che bar skyes so //
translated: That thought is born with greatness, because it makes room for all sentient beings.

original: sems chags pa med pa'i ye shes la btang bas sems de ni sgrib pa med par skyes so //
analyzed: sems chags pa med pa'i ye shes la btang bas sems de ni sgrib pa med par skyes so //
translated: That thought is born without obscurations, because it is dedicated to the wisdom of non-attached minds.

original: snying rje chen po rgyun ma chad pas na sems de ni thams cad kyi rjes su song bar skyes so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po rgyun ma chad pas na sems de ni thams cad kyi rjes su song bar skyes so //
translated: That thought is born following after everything, because it is uninterrupted great compassion.

original: yongs su bsdo pa'i cho ga shes pas na sems de ni rgyun ma chad par skyes so //
analyzed: yongs su bsdo pa'i cho ga shes pas na sems de ni rgyun ma chad par skyes so //
translated: That thought is born without interruption, because it knows the ritual of complete inclusion.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas rab tu ston pas na sems de ni sngon du 'gro bar skyes so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas rab tu ston pas na sems de ni sngon du 'gro bar skyes so //
translated: That thought is born as a forerunner, because it is taught by the Omniscient One.

original: theg pa gzhan la ma zhugs pas na sems de ni blta bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la ma zhugs pas na sems de ni blta bar 'os pa'o //
translated: That thought is worthy of being looked at, because it does not enter into other vehicles.

original: de ni sems can thams cad kyis bltar mi mthong bar skyes so //
analyzed: de ni sems can thams cad kyis bltar mi mthong bar skyes so //
translated: That thought is born without being seen by any sentient beings.

original: de ni bsod nams kyi @251b tshogs kyis brgyan par skyes so //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams kyi @251b tshogs kyis brgyan par skyes so //
translated: He is born adorned with the accumulation of merit.

original: de ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyis rab tu rtogs te skyes so //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyis rab tu rtogs te skyes so //
translated: He is born with the realization of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon du skyes so //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon du skyes so //
translated: He is born as the seed of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyis mi shigs par skyes so //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyis mi shigs par skyes so //
translated: He is born as the one who cannot be destroyed by any phenomenon.

original: de ni bde ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi gnas su skyes so //
analyzed: de ni bde ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi gnas su skyes so //
translated: He is born as the abode of all happiness.

original: de ni sbyin pa'i tshogs kyis bsags te skyes so //
analyzed: de ni sbyin pa'i tshogs kyis bsags te skyes so //
translated: He is born as the one who has accumulated the accumulation of generosity.

original: de ni tshul khrims kyi tshogs kyis smon lam gyi 'phags par skyes so //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims kyi tshogs kyis smon lam gyi 'phags par skyes so //
translated: He is born as the one who has the noble aspiration of the accumulation of morality.

original: de ni bzod pa'i tshogs kyis bsnyen bkur bar skyes so //
analyzed: de ni bzod pa'i tshogs kyis bsnyen bkur bar skyes so //
translated: He is born as the one who is served by the accumulation of patience.

original: de ni brtson 'grus kyi tshogs kyis rgyal bar dka' bar skyes so //
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus kyi tshogs kyis rgyal bar dka' bar skyes so //
translated: He is born as the one who is difficult to defeat by the accumulation of effort.

original: de ni bsam gtan gyi tshogs kyis zhi pa'i mtshan nyid du skyes so ;
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gyi tshogs kyis zhi pa'i mtshan nyid du skyes so ;
translated: He is born as the one who has the characteristic of peace by the accumulation of meditation.

original: / de ni shes rab kyi tshogs kyis thogs pa med par skyes so //
analyzed: / de ni shes rab kyi tshogs kyis thogs pa med par skyes so //
translated: He is born as the one who is unimpeded by the accumulation of wisdom.

original: byams pa chen po bsags pas de ni gnod pa med par skyes so //
analyzed: byams pa chen po bsags pas de ni gnod pa med par skyes so //
translated: He was born without harm, having accumulated great love.

original: snying rje chen po bsags pas de ni rtsa ba brtan par skyes so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po bsags pas de ni rtsa ba brtan par skyes so //
translated: He was born with a firm root, having accumulated great compassion.

original: de ni dga' ba chen po bsags te mgu ba dang mos pa dang mchog tu dga' ba la gnas par skyes so //
analyzed: de ni dga' ba chen po bsags te mgu ba dang mos pa dang mchog tu dga' ba la gnas par skyes so //
translated: He was born, abiding in joy, delight, faith, and supreme delight, having accumulated great joy.

original: de ni btang snyoms chen po gnas pa ste bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis mi bsgul bar skyes so //
analyzed: de ni btang snyoms chen po gnas pa ste bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis mi bsgul bar skyes so //
translated: He was born, abiding in great equanimity, not shaken by happiness or suffering.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis brlab par skyes so //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis brlab par skyes so //
translated: He was born, having been blessed by the blessing of the Buddha.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi bcad pa'i phyir tshul rgyun mi 'chad par skyes so //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi bcad pa'i phyir tshul rgyun mi 'chad par skyes so //
translated: He was born, having uninterrupted conduct, in order to not interrupt the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: de ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi 'khor du rab tu grags par skyes so //
analyzed: de ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi 'khor du rab tu grags par skyes so //
translated: He was born, having become famous in the retinues of all the buddhafields in the ten directions.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems 'di 'dra ba la /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems 'di 'dra ba la /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, in this kind of mind of omniscience,

original: zad pa gang yang yod dam /
analyzed: zad pa gang yang yod dam /
translated: is there any exhaustion?”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu de ni ma yin te /
translated: Śāradvatīputra replied, “Noble son, there is not.

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems 'di lta bu zad par 'dod pa ni nam mkha' zad par 'dod do //
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems 'di lta bu zad par 'dod pa ni nam mkha' zad par 'dod do //
translated: Whoever wishes to exhaust this mind of omniscience wishes to exhaust space.

original: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
translated: Aksayamati said:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems de ni mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems de ni mi zad pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, likewise, that mind of omniscience is inexhaustible.

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni de'i rtsa bar skyes pas na de'i phyir de ni mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni de'i rtsa bar skyes pas na de'i phyir de ni mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because that thought of awakening is born as its root, therefore it is inexhaustible.

original: yang mdo de nyid las bsam pa de ni ma byas pas na bcos ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang mdo de nyid las bsam pa de ni ma byas pas na bcos ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: And in that very sūtra, that intention is not fabricated because it is not made.

original: g-yo ba med pas na ma byas pa'o //🔽rab tu rtogs pas g-yo ba med pa'o //🔽sgyu med pas rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pas na ma byas pa'o // rab tu rtogs pas g-yo ba med pa'o // sgyu med pas rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is not made because it is unmoving.🔽It is unmoving because it is well understood.🔽It is well understood because it is without deceit.

original: sgyu med pas rab tu drang ba'o //🔽dag pas sgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu med pas rab tu drang ba'o // dag pas sgyu med pa'o //
translated: It is without deceit because it is well drawn.🔽It is well drawn because it is pure.🔽It is pure because it is without crookedness.🔽It is without crookedness because it is clear.🔽It is clear because it is without darkness.

original: gsal bas gya gyu med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa @252a * //
analyzed: gsal bas gya gyu med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa @252a * //
translated: It is without darkness because it is without delusion.🔽It is without delusion because it is without ignorance.🔽It is without ignorance because it is without defilement.🔽It is without defilement because it is without attachment.🔽It is without attachment because it is without grasping.🔽It is without grasping because it is without desire.🔽It is without desire because it is without craving.🔽It is without craving because it is without anger.🔽It is without anger because it is without pride.🔽It is without pride because it is without conceit.🔽It is without conceit because it is without arrogance.🔽It is without arrogance because it is without haughtiness.🔽It is without haughtiness because it is without envy.🔽It is without envy because it is without avarice.🔽It is without avarice because it is without deceit.🔽It is without deceit because it is without flattery.🔽It is without flattery because it is without hypocrisy.🔽It is without hypocrisy because it is without anger.🔽It is without anger because it is without harmfulness.🔽It is without harmfulness because it is without malice.🔽It is without malice because it is without jealousy.🔽It is without jealousy because it is without pride.🔽It is without pride because it is without arrogance.🔽It is without arrogance because it is without conceit.🔽It is without conceit because it is without desire.🔽It is without desire because it is without craving.🔽It is without craving because it is without anger.🔽It is without anger because it is without ignorance.🔽It is without ignorance because it is without defilement.🔽It is without defilement because it is without attachment.

original: rgyas par gsungs te /🔽mdo de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par gsungs te /🔽mdo de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is without attachment because it

original: de lta bu'i thun mong ma yin pa'i sems /
analyzed: de lta bu'i thun mong ma yin pa'i sems /
translated: Such an extraordinary mind,

original: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i sems /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i sems /
translated: a mind that is superior to all worldly beings,

original: sems can thams cad ma btang ba'i sems de ni sa chen po la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis de nyis sbyangs shing dag par byas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ma btang ba'i sems de ni sa chen po la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis de nyis sbyangs shing dag par byas /
translated: a mind that has not abandoned any sentient being, is purified and cleansed by the great bodhisattvas who have entered the great grounds.

original: de ma nyams par byas shing bsrungs /
analyzed: de ma nyams par byas shing bsrungs /
translated: They guard it so that it does not degenerate.

original: de sa nas sar spel te /
analyzed: de sa nas sar spel te /
translated: They enhance it from one ground to the next.

original: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs yin pas de bskyed phan chad byang chub sems dpa' de la bstan pa la dga' ba'i lhas bsrung ba dang / 'chi ba'i dus su yid dga' bar 'chi ba dang / bar ma do dang ma'i mngal dang bu chung gi dus su yang lha dag gis bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs yin pas de bskyed phan chad byang chub sems dpa' de la bstan pa la dga' ba'i lhas bsrung ba dang / 'chi ba'i dus su yid dga' bar 'chi ba dang / bar ma do dang ma'i mngal dang bu chung gi dus su yang lha dag gis bsrung ba dang /
translated: Since it is the mind of all the buddhas, once it has been generated, the gods who delight in the teachings will guard that bodhisattva, he will die with a happy mind, and in the intermediate state, in his mother’s womb, and as an infant, he will be guarded by the gods.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad chud mi za ba dang / sems bsod nams kyi rgyun dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad chud mi za ba dang / sems bsod nams kyi rgyun dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: All his roots of virtue will be inexhaustible, and his mind will be endowed with a stream of merit.

original: slob dpon zhi ba'i lhas spyod 'jug las /
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba'i lhas spyod 'jug las /
translated: Master Śāntideva says in the Guide to the Bodhisattva Way of Life:

original: dge ba gzhan kun chu shing bzhin du ni ;
analyzed: dge ba gzhan kun chu shing bzhin du ni ;
translated: All other virtues are like the plantain tree:

original: /'bras bu smin nas zad par 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: /'bras bu smin nas zad par 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: They disappear after bearing fruit.

original: byang chub sems kyi ljon shing rtag par yang //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi ljon shing rtag par yang //
translated: But the tree of the thought of awakening always

original: 'bras bu mi zad rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi zad rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Increases its fruit without disappearing.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi sems de mi zad pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi chos thams cad dang / 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi sa'i chos thams cad mi zad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi sems de mi zad pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi chos thams cad dang / 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi sa'i chos thams cad mi zad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the thought of awakening is inexhaustible, all the dharmas of the mundane and supramundane paths and all the dharmas of the result, the stage of buddhahood, are inexhaustible.

original: de bas na dus der sems de lta bu skyes pas na /
analyzed: de bas na dus der sems de lta bu skyes pas na /
translated: Therefore, when that kind of thought arises at that time,🔽The qualities of generating

original: de ltar smos pa'i sems dag ni //🔽bskyed pa'i yon tan gang yin pa //
analyzed: de ltar smos pa'i sems dag ni // bskyed pa'i yon tan gang yin pa //
translated: such thoughts as have been mentioned

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: are as follows.

original: de lta bu'i sems de'i phan yon smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems de'i phan yon smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to explain the benefits of such a thought,

original: de ni sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las 'phags pa byams pas nor bzangs la 'di skad du bshad de /
analyzed: de ni sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las 'phags pa byams pas nor bzangs la 'di skad du bshad de /
translated: Ārya Maitreya explained them to Sudhana in the Array of Stalks Sūtra:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: Son of noble family, the mind of awakening is like a seed for all the qualities of buddhahood.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bar byed pas zhing lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bar byed pas zhing lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a field, for it causes the wholesome qualities of all beings to grow.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad rten pas sa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad rten pas sa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the earth, for it supports all worldly beings.

original: dbul ba thams cad yang dag par 'joms pas rnam thos kyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbul ba thams cad yang dag par 'joms pas rnam thos kyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: It is like Vaiśravaṇa, for it completely destroys all poverty.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su bsrung bas pha lta bu'o //🔽don thams cad yang dag par sgrub pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su bsrung bas pha lta bu'o // don thams cad yang dag par sgrub pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a father, for it protects all bodhisattvas.🔽It is like a wish-fulfilling gem, for it accomplishes all aims.

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs su @252b rdzogs par byed pas bum pa bzang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs su @252b rdzogs par byed pas bum pa bzang po lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a fine vase, for it fulfills all wishes.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra thams cad pham par byed pas mdung thung lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra thams cad pham par byed pas mdung thung lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a spear, for it defeats all the enemies of the afflictions.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa rab tu 'gebs pas go cha lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa rab tu 'gebs pas go cha lta bu'o //
translated: It is like armor, for it covers over improper mental activity.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mgo ltung bar byed pas ral gri lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mgo ltung bar byed pas ral gri lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a sword, since it cuts off the head of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i shing gcod par byed pas sta re lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i shing gcod par byed pas sta re lta bu'o //
translated: It is like an axe, since it cuts down the tree of the afflictions.

original: 'tshe ba thams cad las skyob pas mtshon cha lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba thams cad las skyob pas mtshon cha lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a weapon, since it protects from all violence.

original: 'khor ba'i chu bo'i nang nas steng du 'byin pas mchil pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chu bo'i nang nas steng du 'byin pas mchil pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a bridge, since it leads across the river of cyclic existence.

original: sgrib pas khebs pa thams cad 'thor bar byed pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgrib pas khebs pa thams cad 'thor bar byed pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a wind-wheel, since it scatters all the obscurations that cover.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang smon lam thams cad mdor bsdus pas mdor bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang smon lam thams cad mdor bsdus pas mdor bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a summary, since it summarizes all the bodhisattva deeds and aspirations.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad la mchod rten lta bu ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad la mchod rten lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a shrine, for the whole world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar byang chub kyi sems ni yon tan de dang yon tan gyi bye brag tshad med pa gzhan dang yang ldan no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar byang chub kyi sems ni yon tan de dang yon tan gyi bye brag tshad med pa gzhan dang yang ldan no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Son of noble family, in this way the mind of awakening has these qualities and others, immeasurable specific qualities.

original: de bzhin du rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu bshad do //
translated: It is explained in this way.

original: de bzhin du khyim bdag dpa' sbyin gyis zhus pa'i mdo'i tshig 'og na bkod pa yang 'dir drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyim bdag dpa' sbyin gyis zhus pa'i mdo'i tshig 'og na bkod pa yang 'dir drang bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the words of the Householder Ugra Sutra should be cited here.

original: gzhan mdo du ma dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub dang / slob dpon zhi ba'i lha la sogs pas kyang phan yon mang du gsungs pa yod kyang 'dir yi ge mangs pa'i 'jigs pas ma bkod do //
analyzed: gzhan mdo du ma dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub dang / slob dpon zhi ba'i lha la sogs pas kyang phan yon mang du gsungs pa yod kyang 'dir yi ge mangs pa'i 'jigs pas ma bkod do //
translated: There are many other sutras and many other statements of benefits by the noble Nagarjuna, by the master Santaraksita, and so on. But I will not cite them here for fear of being long-winded.

original: yang de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de yis mdo bklag pa'am bla ma las mnyan te //🔽rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems kyi yon tan tshad med pa //
analyzed: yang de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / de yis mdo bklag pa'am bla ma las mnyan te // rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems kyi yon tan tshad med pa //
translated: To demonstrate just that, [Santideva] says:🔽Having heard about the immeasurable good qualities of the thought of perfect enlightenment,

original: rnam par shes par byas la de gnas rgyu mtshan du //
analyzed: rnam par shes par byas la de gnas rgyu mtshan du //
translated: from reading the scriptures or from a spiritual master,

original: yang dang yang du sems ni bskyed par bya //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /🔽mdo bklag pa'am zhes bya ba ni bslab pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: yang dang yang du sems ni bskyed par bya // zhes bya ba smras te / mdo bklag pa'am zhes bya ba ni bslab pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: one should repeatedly generate that thought🔽as the basis for the attainment of the qualities of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams ni phal cher mdo sde dag las snang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams ni phal cher mdo sde dag las snang ste /
translated: Reading the scriptures means that the topics of training for bodhisattvas appear for the most part in the sutras.

original: mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i kun du spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i kun du spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bcas pa'o //
translated: In this and that sutra, the bodhisattva's conduct and the bases of the bodhisattva training are set forth.🔽Therefore, if you do not look at them, you will not know the transgressions, and so you will come to abandon the trainings. Thus, you should always respect looking at the sutras.

original: de lta bas na de ma bltas na ltung ba byung na yang mi shes na spong bar 'gyur du 'ong bas rtag tu mdo sde lta ba la gus par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid kyi rtsa ba las /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ma bltas na ltung ba byung na yang mi shes na spong bar 'gyur du 'ong bas rtag tu mdo sde lta ba la gus par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid kyi rtsa ba las /
translated: Also, the root text says:

original: dge pa'i bshes gnyen mi gtang zhing //
analyzed: dge pa'i bshes gnyen mi gtang zhing //
translated: Do not abandon the spiritual friend

original: mdo sde dag la rtag blta bas //🔽zhes pa dang / slob dpon zhi ba'i @253a * //
analyzed: mdo sde dag la rtag blta bas // zhes pa dang / slob dpon zhi ba'i @253a * //
translated: and always look at the sutras.

original: lhas 'di skad du /
analyzed: lhas 'di skad du /
translated: And Master Santideva says:

original: mdo sde dag ni blta bar bya //
analyzed: mdo sde dag ni blta bar bya //
translated: Look at the sutras.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo sde ni //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo sde ni //
translated: First look at the sutras of Akashagarbha🔽and then at the sutras of Manjushri.

original: thog ma nyid du blta bar bya //
analyzed: thog ma nyid du blta bar bya //
translated: Then look at the Compendium of Sutras

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i //🔽mdo rnams kun las btus pa yang //
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i // mdo rnams kun las btus pa yang //
translated: composed by the noble Nagarjuna.

original: de yi 'og tu blta bar bya //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu blta bar bya //
translated: After that, look at the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: zhis gsungs pas thog mar mdo sde blta ba la goms par bya'o //
analyzed: zhis gsungs pas thog mar mdo sde blta ba la goms par bya'o //
translated: Thus, you should first become accustomed to looking at the sutras.

original: bla ma las mnyan te zhes bya ba ni bla ma ni sems skyed par byed pa de nyid de /
analyzed: bla ma las mnyan te zhes bya ba ni bla ma ni sems skyed par byed pa de nyid de /
translated: Having heard it from the guru means that the guru is the one who generates the thought of awakening.

original: de yang 'di ltar 'phags pa thogs med nas brgyud pa dang / slob dpon zhi ba'i lha nas brgyud pa'i bla ma'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar 'phags pa thogs med nas brgyud pa dang / slob dpon zhi ba'i lha nas brgyud pa'i bla ma'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the guru lineage of noble Asanga and the guru lineage of master Śāntideva.🔽If one wonders, What is the purpose of relying on the guru?

original: de yang bla ma bsten pa la dgos pa ci yod snyam pa la yod par mthong ste /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang bla ma bsten pa la dgos pa ci yod snyam pa la yod par mthong ste / ji skad du /
translated: it is seen to be as follows.

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las /
translated: As it says in the noble Array of Stalks:

original: dpal 'byung ba 'di skad du rigs kyi bu dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ngan 'gror mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: dpal 'byung ba 'di skad du rigs kyi bu dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ngan 'gror mi 'gro'o //
translated: Śrīsaṃbhava said this: “Son of noble family, bodhisattvas who are truly held by a spiritual friend do not go to the lower realms.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bslab pa 'gal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bslab pa 'gal bar mi byed do //
translated: Bodhisattvas who are cared for by a spiritual friend do not violate the trainings.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bsams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa las mngon par 'phags so //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bsams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa las mngon par 'phags so //
translated: Bodhisattvas who are considered by a spiritual friend rise above the worldly.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni spyod pa thams cad la ma brjed par gnas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni spyod pa thams cad la ma brjed par gnas so //
translated: The bodhisattva who serves the spiritual friend does not forget any of the practices.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis thub par dka'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis thub par dka'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is protected by the spiritual friend is invincible to all actions and passions.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni bya ba ma yin pa rnams khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni bya ba ma yin pa rnams khong du chud par byed do //
translated: The spiritual friend causes one to understand what should not be done.

original: bag med pa'i gnas las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnas las bzlog pa'o //
translated: He turns one away from the abode of heedlessness.

original: 'khor ba'i grong khyer nas 'don pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i grong khyer nas 'don pa'o //
translated: He takes one out of the city of cyclic existence.

original: rigs kyi bu de bas na de ltar yin la rgyun ma chad par dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bas na de ltar yin la rgyun ma chad par dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, son of noble family, you should constantly go to the spiritual friends.

original: khur thams cad khur bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir sa lta bu'i sems dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i sems dang / mi khro bas khyi lta bu'i sems dang / sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi bsgul ba'i phyir khor yug lta bu'i sems dang /
analyzed: khur thams cad khur bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir sa lta bu'i sems dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i sems dang / mi khro bas khyi lta bu'i sems dang / sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi bsgul ba'i phyir khor yug lta bu'i sems dang /
translated: The mind is like the earth, for it is not at all discouraged by the burden of all beings. The mind is like a diamond, for it is unbreakable. The mind is like a dog, for it is not angry. The mind is like a mountain, for it is unshaken by any suffering.

original: las thams cad la mi smod pas bran lta bu'i sems dang / nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal rnam par spong bas phyag dar ba lta bu'i sems dang / khur lci ba khur bas theg pa lta bu'i sems dang / 'gro zhing 'ong @253b bas mi skyo bas gru lta bu'i sems dang /🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor blta bas bu mdzangs pa lta bu'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bskur bya'o //
analyzed: las thams cad la mi smod pas bran lta bu'i sems dang / nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal rnam par spong bas phyag dar ba lta bu'i sems dang / khur lci ba khur bas theg pa lta bu'i sems dang / 'gro zhing 'ong @253b bas mi skyo bas gru lta bu'i sems dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor blta bas bu mdzangs pa lta bu'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bskur bya'o //
translated: The mind is like a servant, for it does not criticize any task. The mind is like a sweeper, for it abandons pride and arrogance. The mind is like a vehicle, for it carries heavy burdens. The mind is like a boat, for it is not discouraged by going and coming.🔽The mind is like a good son, for it looks at the spiritual teacher with love.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis bdag la ni nang pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis bdag la ni nang pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “Noble sir, you should think of me as a friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sman pa'i 'du shes dang ; rjes su bstan pa la ni sman gyi 'du shes dang / nan tan nyams su len pa la ni nad 'tsho ba'i 'du shes dag bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa nor bzangs kyis dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin gyi skabs nas 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sman pa'i 'du shes dang ; rjes su bstan pa la ni sman gyi 'du shes dang / nan tan nyams su len pa la ni nad 'tsho ba'i 'du shes dag bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa nor bzangs kyis dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin gyi skabs nas 'byung ba dang /
translated: Moreover, as the noble Sudhana says in the chapter on the bhikṣu Sāgaramegha:

original: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang khyim bdag gal te byang chub sems dpa' lung nod pa'am /🔽kha ton bya ba'am /🔽sbyin pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang khyim bdag gal te byang chub sems dpa' lung nod pa'am / kha ton bya ba'am / sbyin pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: “Householder, if a bodhisattva hears a verse of four lines that is related to generosity,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am /🔽bzod pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am / bzod pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: that is related to moral discipline,🔽that is related to patience,

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'am /
translated: that is related to perseverance,

original: bsam gtan dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ldan pa'am /
translated: that is related to meditative concentration,

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'am /
translated: that is related to wisdom,🔽or that is related to the accumulation of the path of the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa su las mnyan tam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa su las mnyan tam /
translated: from whom should he listen to it?

original: lung nos sam blangs pa'i slob dpon de la de chos kyis gus par bya'o //
analyzed: lung nos sam blangs pa'i slob dpon de la de chos kyis gus par bya'o //
translated: You should respect the master who has given you the transmission or the reading of the scriptures.

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge ji snyed pa de snyed kyis bskal par gal te slob dpon la g-yo med par rnyed pa dang / bkur stis rim gro dang / bkur sti byas kyang khyim bdag da dung du slob dpon de la gus par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge ji snyed pa de snyed kyis bskal par gal te slob dpon la g-yo med par rnyed pa dang / bkur stis rim gro dang / bkur sti byas kyang khyim bdag da dung du slob dpon de la gus par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin na /
translated: Even if you were to serve the master with gain and honor for as many eons as there are letters, words, and syllables in the scriptures, without deceit, still, householder, you would not have fully repaid your debt of gratitude to the master.🔽How much less could you repay your debt of gratitude to the master through Dharma?

original: chos ma yin pa gus par bya ba lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du lag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'phags pa rtag tu ngu'i le'u dang / 'phags pa legs par sbyin pas ji ltar bla ma bsten pa rnams ni de dang der blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa gus par bya ba lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du lag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'phags pa rtag tu ngu'i le'u dang / 'phags pa legs par sbyin pas ji ltar bla ma bsten pa rnams ni de dang der blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should look at the Vajrapany-abhisheka-tantra, the chapter on the noble Sadaprarudita in the Perfection of Wisdom, and the noble Subahupariprccha, to see how you should serve your guru.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyis kyang bla ma bsten pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyis kyang bla ma bsten pa gsungs te /
translated: The noble Asanga also taught how to serve your guru.

original: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa las /
analyzed: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa las /
translated: As the Bodhisattvabhumi says:

original: de la rnam pa du dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya /
analyzed: de la rnam pa du dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya /
translated: What are the aspects of a bodhisattva who is a spiritual friend?

original: rnam pa du zhig gis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen don yod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa du zhig gis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen don yod pa yin /
translated: What are the aspects of a spiritual friend who is not in vain?

original: rnam pa du zhig dang ldan na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dad pa'i gzhi la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa du zhig dang ldan na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dad pa'i gzhi la gnas pa yin /
translated: What are the aspects of a spiritual friend who is a basis of faith?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa'i 'dul ba rnams dge pa'i bshes @254a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa'i 'dul ba rnams dge pa'i bshes @254a * //
translated: What are the trainings of a bodhisattva who is a spiritual friend?

original: gnyen gyi bya ba ni du zhig yod /
analyzed: gnyen gyi bya ba ni du zhig yod /
translated: What are the activities of a spiritual friend?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa ni rnam pa du zhig yod /🔽'du shes dus ni byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos mnyan par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa ni rnam pa du zhig yod / 'du shes dus ni byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos mnyan par bya /
translated: What are the ways in which a bodhisattva relies on a spiritual friend?🔽What are the attitudes with which a bodhisattva listens to the teachings of a spiritual friend?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos nyan pa na gang zag chos smra ba de la gnas du zhig ni yid la mi byed par bya zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos nyan pa na gang zag chos smra ba de la gnas du zhig ni yid la mi byed par bya zhe na /
translated: What are the states of mind that a bodhisattva who is listening to the teachings of a spiritual friend should not have with regard to the person who is expounding the Dharma?

original: de la rnam pa brgyad dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams rnam pa thams cad rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa brgyad dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams rnam pa thams cad rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: When they have eight attributes, bodhisattvas' spiritual masters are to be known as perfect in every way.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnams la gnas shing ma nyams pa dang skyon med par byed pas tshul khrims la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnams la gnas shing ma nyams pa dang skyon med par byed pas tshul khrims la gnas pa yin /
translated: They are ethical in that they observe the bodhisattva vows and do not let them deteriorate or become flawed.

original: blo ma byang ba ma yin pas mang du thos pa yin /
analyzed: blo ma byang ba ma yin pas mang du thos pa yin /
translated: They are learned in that their minds are not untrained.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba gang yang rung ba thob cing rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba gang yang rung ba thob cing rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have realization in that they have attained and realized any of the virtues that come from meditation.

original: snying rje ldan pas snying brtse ba can yin /
analyzed: snying rje ldan pas snying brtse ba can yin /
translated: They are compassionate in that they are full of love.

original: de tshe 'di la rang gi bde ba bor nas gzhan gyi don la sbyor ba yin /
analyzed: de tshe 'di la rang gi bde ba bor nas gzhan gyi don la sbyor ba yin /
translated: They are dedicated to others' welfare in that they give up their own happiness in this life and apply themselves to others' welfare.

original: de gzhan la chos ston pa na bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pas dran pa dang spobs pa nyams pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de gzhan la chos ston pa na bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pas dran pa dang spobs pa nyams pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa yin /
translated: They are fearless in that when they teach the Dharma to others, they are free of the fear of forgetting or losing their confidence.

original: gzhan dag gis brnyas pa dang 'phya ba dang bsting ba dang ngan du brjod pa mi 'dod pa'i tshig rnams dang sems can log par zhugs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams bzod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brnyas pa dang 'phya ba dang bsting ba dang ngan du brjod pa mi 'dod pa'i tshig rnams dang sems can log par zhugs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams bzod pa yin /
translated: It is to be patient with the unpleasant words of others, such as their contempt, ridicule, and insults, as well as with the various kinds of wrongdoings of beings.

original: 'khor bzhi po dag chos bstan pa la stobs dang ldan zhing ngal ba med pas yid yongs su mi skyo ba yin /
analyzed: 'khor bzhi po dag chos bstan pa la stobs dang ldan zhing ngal ba med pas yid yongs su mi skyo ba yin /
translated: It is to be tireless in teaching the Dharma to the four kinds of followers, being strong and indefatigable.

original: tshig chos nyid las ma nyams shing gsal la tshig bya ba dang ldan pa yin no ;
analyzed: tshig chos nyid las ma nyams shing gsal la tshig bya ba dang ldan pa yin no ;
translated: It is to speak words that are not divorced from reality and that are clear and to the point.

original: / de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu'i yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad ldan pa ni rnam pa lnga lngas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba don yod pa yin te /
analyzed: / de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu'i yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad ldan pa ni rnam pa lnga lngas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba don yod pa yin te /
translated: A bodhisattva who is endowed with all the above-mentioned qualities of a spiritual teacher is a meaningful spiritual teacher in five ways.

original: de ni snga nas kyang gzhan dag la phan pa dang bde bar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni snga nas kyang gzhan dag la phan pa dang bde bar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: He or she is someone who has previously wished to benefit and bring happiness to others.

original: phan pa dang bde ba de ji lta bar shes pa yin /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba de ji lta bar shes pa yin /
translated: He or she knows what will benefit and bring happiness.

original: de blo phyin ci ma log pa yin /
analyzed: de blo phyin ci ma log pa yin /
translated: He or she is someone whose mind is not mistaken.
