original: thabs gang dang chos bstan pa'i tshul gang gis sems can gang 'dul nus pa de la nus shing mthu yod pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba yin /
analyzed: thabs gang dang chos bstan pa'i tshul gang gis sems can gang 'dul nus pa de la nus shing mthu yod pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba yin /
translated: He is able to train beings by whatever means and by whatever methods of teaching the Dharma are appropriate to them.🔽He is not discouraged.

original: sems can tha ma dang 'bring po dang / khyad par du 'phags pa la phyogs 'dzin pa med par @254b snying rje snyoms pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can tha ma dang 'bring po dang / khyad par du 'phags pa la phyogs 'dzin pa med par @254b snying rje snyoms pa yin no //
translated: He is impartial in his compassion toward inferior, middling, and superior beings.

original: de la dge ba'i bshes gnyen de ni rnam pa lngas dad pa'i gzhi la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i bshes gnyen de ni rnam pa lngas dad pa'i gzhi la gnas pa yin te /
translated: The spiritual master is the basis of faith in five ways.

original: gang gi phyir gtam thos pas kyang shin tu dang bar byed na mngon sum du mthong na lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtam thos pas kyang shin tu dang bar byed na mngon sum du mthong na lta ci smos te /
translated: He is a source of faith because he inspires great faith when he is heard of, let alone when he is seen.

original: spyod lam rab tu zhi ba dang / spyod lam dang ldan pa dang / yan lag dang / nyid lag mi 'gyur bas spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / lus dang dag dang yid kyi las kyi mtha' la god pa med cing 'gyur ba med pas brtan pa yin /
analyzed: spyod lam rab tu zhi ba dang / spyod lam dang ldan pa dang / yan lag dang / nyid lag mi 'gyur bas spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / lus dang dag dang yid kyi las kyi mtha' la god pa med cing 'gyur ba med pas brtan pa yin /
translated: He is steadfast because he is endowed with perfect conduct, with calm behavior, with proper behavior, and with a perfect body, speech, and mind that are not subject to reversal.

original: gzhan dag la tshul 'chos pa'i phyir spyod lam brtan pa ltar mi 'chos pas tshul 'chos pa med pa yin /🔽gzhan gyi chos kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: gzhan dag la tshul 'chos pa'i phyir spyod lam brtan pa ltar mi 'chos pas tshul 'chos pa med pa yin / gzhan gyi chos kyi gtam mam /
translated: He is not hypocritical, for he does not pretend to have a firm moral practice in order to impress others.🔽He is not envious, for he is pleased with others’ Dharma teachings,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la bdag dga' ba dang / rang gi rnyed pa dang bkur sti yang gzhan la stobs par byed pas phrag dog med pa yin /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la bdag dga' ba dang / rang gi rnyed pa dang bkur sti yang gzhan la stobs par byed pas phrag dog med pa yin /
translated: their gains and honors, and he even extols their gains and honors to others.

original: yo byad bsnyungs shing yo byad bsnyungs pas 'tshog chas rnyed do cog thams cad la gtod bas yo byad bsnyungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs shing yo byad bsnyungs pas 'tshog chas rnyed do cog thams cad la gtod bas yo byad bsnyungs pa yin no ;
translated: He is austere, for he is content with few possessions and gives away all the few possessions he has.

original: ; de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa de ni rnam pa lngas gdul ba gzhan dag la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: ; de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa de ni rnam pa lngas gdul ba gzhan dag la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva who is a spiritual master performs the activities of a spiritual master for other disciples in five ways:

original: gleng bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: gleng bar byed pa yin /
translated: he or she initiates them;

original: dran par byed pa yin /🔽'doms par byed pa yin /🔽rjes su ston par byed pa yin /
analyzed: dran par byed pa yin / 'doms par byed pa yin / rjes su ston par byed pa yin /
translated: he or she reminds them;🔽he or she instructs them;🔽he or she teaches them;

original: chos ston par byed pa yin ;
analyzed: chos ston par byed pa yin ;
translated: and he or she gives them Dharma teachings.

original: tshig 'di dag gi dbye ba ni nyan thos kyi sar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig 'di dag gi dbye ba ni nyan thos kyi sar rig par bya'o //
translated: The divisions of these terms should be understood from the Sravakabhumi.

original: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni stobs kyi le'u las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni stobs kyi le'u las rig par bya'o //
translated: Instruction and counsel should be understood from the chapter on the powers.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa bzhis yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa bzhis yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: The bodhisattva's reliance on a spiritual teacher is fulfilled in four ways:

original: dus dus su nad g-yog dang / tha mal pa'i g-yog byas pa dang / gus pa dang / dga' ba dang / dus dus su gus par smra ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: dus dus su nad g-yog dang / tha mal pa'i g-yog byas pa dang / gus pa dang / dga' ba dang / dus dus su gus par smra ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang /
translated: by service, by acting in accordance with the teachings, by acting in accordance with the instructions, and by acting in accordance with the counsel.🔽Service is of four types: service in giving gifts, service in giving teachings, service in doing the same as the teacher, and service in doing what is to be done.

original: 'dud par bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / chos dang mthun pa'i gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / nad pa'i gsos sman dang / yo byad sbyin pas mchod pa dang / gnas bcas nas gzud pa dang /
analyzed: 'dud par bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / chos dang mthun pa'i gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / nad pa'i gsos sman dang / yo byad sbyin pas mchod pa dang / gnas bcas nas gzud pa dang /
translated: Acting in accordance with the teachings is to practice the teachings that one has received.

original: nyes pa dag 'chags pa dang / drung du 'gro ba dang / dri ba dang nyan pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dag 'chags pa dang / drung du 'gro ba dang / dri ba dang nyan pa'o //
translated: Acting in accordance with the instructions is to practice the teachings that one has received and to do so with great effort.🔽Acting in accordance with the counsel is to practice the teachings that one has received, to do so with great effort, and to inform the teacher of one's success.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen las chos nyan par 'dod pas 'du shes rnam pa lngas chos mnyan par bya @255a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen las chos nyan par 'dod pas 'du shes rnam pa lngas chos mnyan par bya @255a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to listen to the Dharma from a spiritual master should listen to the Dharma with five attitudes.

original: ste ; dkon pa'i don gyis rin po che'i 'du shes dang / shes rab rgya chen po 'thob pa'i rgyu'i don gyis mig gi 'du shes dang / chos thams cad yang dag par ston pas snang ba'i 'du shes dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyu'i don gyis phan yon che ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: ste ; dkon pa'i don gyis rin po che'i 'du shes dang / shes rab rgya chen po 'thob pa'i rgyu'i don gyis mig gi 'du shes dang / chos thams cad yang dag par ston pas snang ba'i 'du shes dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyu'i don gyis phan yon che ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: The attitude of preciousness, in the sense of rarity; the attitude of vision, in the sense of being the cause of attaining great wisdom; the attitude of illumination, in the sense of revealing all dharmas; the attitude of great benefit, in the sense of being the cause of attaining unsurpassed enlightenment;

original: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dga' ba kha na ma tho ba med pa'i rgyu'i don gyis kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dga' ba kha na ma tho ba med pa'i rgyu'i don gyis kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: and the attitude of being irreproachable, in the sense of being the cause of the irreproachable joy of serenity and insight, which lead to nirvana in this life and to attaining perfect enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos nyan pa na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen la chos nyan pa na /
translated: When the bodhisattva listens to the Dharma from a spiritual master,

original: de la gnas lngar yid la mi byed de /
analyzed: de la gnas lngar yid la mi byed de /
translated: He does not pay attention to five things.

original: de tshul khrims nyams pa nyams so snyam du yid la mi byed de /
analyzed: de tshul khrims nyams pa nyams so snyam du yid la mi byed de /
translated: He does not pay attention to the thought that his morality is impaired.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims nyams shing sdom pa la mi gnas pas bdag gis 'di las chos mnyan par mi bya'o snyam du yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims nyams shing sdom pa la mi gnas pas bdag gis 'di las chos mnyan par mi bya'o snyam du yid la mi bya'o //
translated: He does not pay attention to the thought that he should not listen to the Dharma from someone whose morality is impaired and who does not observe the vow.

original: rigs dma' ba la yang 'di la bdag gis chos mnyan par mi bya'o snyam du yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: rigs dma' ba la yang 'di la bdag gis chos mnyan par mi bya'o snyam du yid la mi bya'o //
translated: He does not pay attention to the thought that he should not listen to the Dharma from someone of low social class.

original: chos la rton pas bya'i gang zag la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos la rton pas bya'i gang zag la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: He should rely on the Dharma, not on the person.

original: don la rton par bya'i tshig 'bru la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: don la rton par bya'i tshig 'bru la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: He should rely on the meaning, not on the letter.

original: byad dang gzugs ngan pa dang / tshig 'bru ngan pa la yang yid la mi bya ste /
analyzed: byad dang gzugs ngan pa dang / tshig 'bru ngan pa la yang yid la mi bya ste /
translated: He should not pay attention to physical appearance or to the beauty or ugliness of the letter.

original: gus pa dang bcas pas chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pas chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: He should listen to the Dharma with devotion.

original: chos ni nams kyang gang zag gi skyon gyis mi gos shing skyon can du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ni nams kyang gang zag gi skyon gyis mi gos shing skyon can du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Dharma is never sullied by the faults of the person, nor does it become faulty.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po gang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po gang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is of dull faculties

original: gang zag gi skyon rnams la sems mngon par ldang zhing /
analyzed: gang zag gi skyon rnams la sems mngon par ldang zhing /
translated: One should know that if one’s mind is averse to the faults of persons,

original: chos nyan par mi 'dod pa de ni bdag nyid kho na la gnod cing shes rab yongs su nyams par gyur par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos nyan par mi 'dod pa de ni bdag nyid kho na la gnod cing shes rab yongs su nyams par gyur par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and one does not want to listen to the Dharma, one is harming oneself and one’s wisdom will be impaired.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bla ma la rag las pas na byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen mkhas pa rtag tu bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bla ma la rag las pas na byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen mkhas pa rtag tu bsten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since all the qualities of the Buddha depend on the guru, the beginner bodhisattva should always rely on the wise spiritual friend, the guru.

original: phan yon gzhan yang bshad de /
analyzed: phan yon gzhan yang bshad de /
translated: There are other benefits that are explained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi nang na gnas pa dbang po rtul po kha cig la ni smon pa'i sems 'di nyid la brten nas rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur bar gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi nang na gnas pa dbang po rtul po kha cig la ni smon pa'i sems 'di nyid la brten nas rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur bar gsungs te /
translated: It is said that some bodhisattvas who are householders with dull faculties attain complete enlightenment in dependence on just this aspiration thought.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the Buddha said in the Sūtra of Advice to a King:

original: rgyal po chen po khyod ni 'di @255b ltar bya ba mang ba byed pa mang ba ste thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyin pa la bslab pa nas /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyod ni 'di @255b ltar bya ba mang ba byed pa mang ba ste thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyin pa la bslab pa nas /
translated: “Great King, you have many things to do and many things to attend to. You are not able to train in all aspects of all the perfections, from generosity

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la bslab par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la bslab par mi nus kyi /
translated: to wisdom.

original: de bas na rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa dang / dad pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / smon pas 'gro yang rung /🔽'greng yang rung /
analyzed: de bas na rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa dang / dad pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / smon pas 'gro yang rung / 'greng yang rung /
translated: Therefore, Great King, whether you are walking,🔽standing,

original: 'dug kyang rung /🔽nyal yang rung /
analyzed: 'dug kyang rung / nyal yang rung /
translated: sitting,🔽sleeping,

original: sad kyang rung /🔽za yang rung /
analyzed: sad kyang rung / za yang rung /
translated: awake,🔽eating,

original: 'thung yang rung /
analyzed: 'thung yang rung /
translated: or drinking,

original: rtag par rgyun du dran par gyis la yid la zung ste sgoms shig / sangs rgyas dang po so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / bdag gi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus shing gzhol te rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su yi rang ba mchog dang /
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du dran par gyis la yid la zung ste sgoms shig / sangs rgyas dang po so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / bdag gi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus shing gzhol te rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su yi rang ba mchog dang /
translated: Rejoice with the highest rejoicing,🔽with rejoicing like space, with rejoicing equal to nirvana.🔽Having rejoiced, make offerings to all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, noble shravakas, and pratyekabuddhas.🔽Having offered, share them with all sentient beings.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pas rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su yi rangs nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod par bya ba phul cig / phul nas sems can thams cad dang thun mong du gyis shig / de nas sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du thob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pas rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su yi rangs nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod par bya ba phul cig / phul nas sems can thams cad dang thun mong du gyis shig / de nas sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du thob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Then all sentient beings will attain omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngos shig / rgyal po chen po khyod de ltar zhugs nas rgyal po yang byed la rgyal po'i bya🔽ba yang nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngos shig / rgyal po chen po khyod de ltar zhugs nas rgyal po yang byed la rgyal po'i bya ba yang nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Great King, if you practice in this way, you will be a king and you will not fail in your royal duties.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: And you will complete the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i zhal nas bslab pa kun las btus pa las don 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i zhal nas bslab pa kun las btus pa las don 'di gsungs te /
translated: The master Śāntideva also teaches this point in his Compendium of Training:

original: 'di skad du spyod pa dang mi ldan pa yang byang chub kyi sems ni 'khor ba'i bde ba mtha' yas pa bskyed pa'i phyir de la brnyas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di skad du spyod pa dang mi ldan pa yang byang chub kyi sems ni 'khor ba'i bde ba mtha' yas pa bskyed pa'i phyir de la brnyas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Even if you do not have the practice, you should not disparage the thought of awakening, because it produces infinite happiness in cyclic existence.”

original: de'i nus pa yang mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i nus pa yang mdo las gsungs te /
translated: The power of this is taught in the sūtras.

original: byams pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sdong po bkod pa las /
analyzed: byams pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sdong po bkod pa las /
translated: The Sūtra on the Layout of the World (Lokanirdeśa-sūtra) says:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na rdo rje rin po che na tshig kyang gser gyi rgyan khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad zil @256a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na rdo rje rin po che na tshig kyang gser gyi rgyan khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad zil @256a * //
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this: even when a diamond is broken, it still outshines golden ornaments.

original: gyis gnon cing rdo rje rin po che'i ming yang mi 'dor la dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par bzlog go //
analyzed: gyis gnon cing rdo rje rin po che'i ming yang mi 'dor la dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par bzlog go //
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this: even if a diamond jewel is broken, it outshines all ornaments of gold and is still called a diamond jewel, and it still can remove all poverty.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che nan tan dang bral yang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che nan tan dang bral yang /
translated: Son of noble family, in the same way, even if the diamond jewel of the mind of awakening is divorced from practice,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi gser gyi rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon cing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi gser gyi rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon cing /
translated: it outshines all the golden ornaments of the qualities of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang mi 'dor la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang mi 'dor la /
translated: and it is still called the mind of awakening,

original: 'khor ba'i dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par bzlog go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par bzlog go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and it still can remove all the poverty of cyclic existence.

original: rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las kyang don de nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las kyang don de nyid gsungs te /
translated: The Sūtra of Advice to a King also teaches this very point:

original: rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa des /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa des /
translated: O great king, by the maturation of the roots of virtue of the thought of perfect complete enlightenment,🔽you have been born many times among the gods, not to mention when you have engaged in such activities.

original: lan du mar lha'i nang du skyes pa nas gang de ltar mang du bya ba byed pa lta ci smos zhes 'byung ste mdo de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lan du mar lha'i nang du skyes pa nas gang de ltar mang du bya ba byed pa lta ci smos zhes 'byung ste mdo de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should look at that very sūtra.

original: rtsa ba nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: You should enter into the very root.

original: byang chub smon pa'i sems ni bskyed nas ni //
analyzed: byang chub smon pa'i sems ni bskyed nas ni //
translated: Having generated the thought of aspiration for enlightenment,

original: 'bad pa mang pos kun tu spel bya zhing //
analyzed: 'bad pa mang pos kun tu spel bya zhing //
translated: you should increase it with many efforts.

original: 'di ni skye ba gzhan du'ang dran don du //
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba gzhan du'ang dran don du //
translated: For the sake of remembering it in other lives,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bslab pa yongs su bsrung //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bslab pa yongs su bsrung //
translated: you should completely protect the training as it has been explained.

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar sems bskyed cing de'i phan yon shes pa des de spel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed cing de'i phan yon shes pa des de spel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In that way, the one who has generated the thought and who knows its benefits should increase it.

original: 'bad pa mang pos kun du spel bya zhing //
analyzed: 'bad pa mang pos kun du spel bya zhing //
translated: You should increase it with many efforts.

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di'i don ni bdag gis byas pa'i sems bskyed pa'i cho gar gsal bar byas te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni bdag gis byas pa'i sems bskyed pa'i cho gar gsal bar byas te /
translated: The meaning of this is clarified in the ritual for generating the thought that I have composed.

original: 'di skad du de ltar sems bskyed pa'i gang zag gis byang chub kyi sems spel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad du de ltar sems bskyed pa'i gang zag gis byang chub kyi sems spel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The following is stated: The person who has generated the Thought in this way should generate the Thought of enlightenment in order to increase the Thought of enlightenment.

original: tha na nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du /🔽sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs kyi mchog rnams la //
analyzed: tha na nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du / sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs kyi mchog rnams la //
translated: Even if it is only three times a day and three times a night,

original: byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
translated: he should go for refuge until enlightenment to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Supreme Assembly.

original: bdag gis sbyin sogs byas pa 'di dag gis //
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin sogs byas pa 'di dag gis //
translated: By my having done these things such as giving,🔽may I attain Buddhahood for the sake of helping living beings.

original: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the generation of the Thought of enlightenment.

original: 'di ni skye ba gzhan du'ang dran don du //
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba gzhan du'ang dran don du //
translated: In order to remember this even in other lives,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bslab pa yongs su bsrung //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bslab pa yongs su bsrung //
translated: he should thoroughly protect the training as it has been explained.

original: zhes pa 'di'i don yang bdag gis 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las blangs nas cho ga de nyid du bkod de 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems nyams par byed pa'i chos bzhi las ldog par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di'i don yang bdag gis 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las blangs nas cho ga de nyid du bkod de 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems nyams par byed pa'i chos bzhi las ldog par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of this is taken from the Kasyapa-parivarta Sutra, and the rite is set forth in that very sutra. One should turn away from the four dharmas which cause the Thought of enlightenment to deteriorate.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / sbyin gnas la bslu ba dang / gzhan 'gyod pa @256b med pa la 'gyod pa nye bar bsgrub pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i gang zag la bsngags pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / sbyin gnas la bslu ba dang / gzhan 'gyod pa @256b med pa la 'gyod pa nye bar bsgrub pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i gang zag la bsngags pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: deceiving preceptors, teachers, gurus, and those worthy of honor;🔽causing regret in those who have no regrets;🔽speaking uncomplimentarily, unfavorably, and unflatteringly about people who have entered the Great Vehicle;

original: mi snyan pa dang brjod pa ma yin pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin pa dang / g-yo dang sgyu gzhan la nye bar spyod kyi lhag pa'i bsam pas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi snyan pa dang brjod pa ma yin pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa 'byin pa dang / g-yo dang sgyu gzhan la nye bar spyod kyi lhag pa'i bsam pas ma yin pa'o //
translated: and acting deceitfully and hypocritically toward others, not with a higher motivation.

original: byang chub kyi sems nyams par mi byed pa'i chos bzhi la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nyams par mi byed pa'i chos bzhi la bslab par bya ste /
translated: “There are four dharmas for not losing the mind of awakening.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: srog gi phyir ram tha na bzhad gad kyi phyir yang brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba dang / g-yo dang sgyu med par sems can thams cad kyi drung na lhag pa'i bsam pas gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston par 'du shes bskyed cing de dag gi yang dag pa'i bsngags pa phyogs bzhir brjod pa dang /
analyzed: srog gi phyir ram tha na bzhad gad kyi phyir yang brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba dang / g-yo dang sgyu med par sems can thams cad kyi drung na lhag pa'i bsam pas gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston par 'du shes bskyed cing de dag gi yang dag pa'i bsngags pa phyogs bzhir brjod pa dang /
translated: Not to tell a lie even to save one’s life, or even as a joke; to be without deceit and hypocrisy, and to live with a higher intention in the presence of all sentient beings; to generate the perception that all bodhisattvas are teachers and to proclaim their true praises in the four directions;

original: nyi tshe ba'i theg pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir sems can gang yongs su smin par byed pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i theg pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir sems can gang yongs su smin par byed pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: and to cause all sentient beings whom one brings to full maturity to take up the unsurpassed, perfect, complete Awakening, because one does not want the limited vehicle.

original: khyad par du mngon par shes pa myur du thob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis zhus pa'i chos bdun pa zhes bya ba'i theg pa chen po'i mdo la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du mngon par shes pa myur du thob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis zhus pa'i chos bdun pa zhes bya ba'i theg pa chen po'i mdo la bslab par bya'o //
translated: In particular, a bodhisattva who wishes to quickly attain the superknowledges should train in the Mahāyāna sūtra called the Sūtra of the Seven Dharmas Requested by Avalokiteśvara.

original: sngar bstan pa'i /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i /
translated: The seven dharmas are taught above.

original: 'bad pa mang pos kun du spel bya zhing ;
analyzed: 'bad pa mang pos kun du spel bya zhing ;
translated: It should be increased through much effort.

original: ; zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'di yin te /
analyzed: ; zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of these words is as follows.

original: rje btsun dag gi zhal nas spel ba rnam pa gsum las rgyas par spel ba ni /🔽'jug sems bdag nyid sdom pa ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: rje btsun dag gi zhal nas spel ba rnam pa gsum las rgyas par spel ba ni / 'jug sems bdag nyid sdom pa ma gtogs pa //
translated: Of the three ways of increasing taught by the masters, the extensive way is as follows.

original: yang dag smon pa 'phel bar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: yang dag smon pa 'phel bar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: The perfect aspiration will not increase🔽Except for the one who has the vow of the thought of awakening.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sdom pas spel 'dod pas //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sdom pas spel 'dod pas //
translated: Therefore, those who wish to increase the vow of complete awakening

original: de phyir 'bad pas 'di ni nges par blang //
analyzed: de phyir 'bad pas 'di ni nges par blang //
translated: Should make effort and definitely take it up.

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'jug sems bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug sems bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The one who has the thought of awakening is the one who has the pure superior intention.

original: de yang 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las ji skad du /
translated: Moreover, as it is said in the noble Gaganagañja Sūtra,

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i byang chub kyi sems de chos gang gis bsdus /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i byang chub kyi sems de chos gang gis bsdus /
translated: “Son of noble family, the thought of awakening, the thought of awakening, that thought of awakening is included in which phenomena?

original: ji ltar phyir mi ldog par kun du gnas //
analyzed: ji ltar phyir mi ldog par kun du gnas //
translated: How does it remain irreversible?”

original: nam mkha' mdzod kyis smras pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod kyis smras pa /
translated: Gaganagañja said,🔽“Son of noble family, the thought of awakening is included in the perfection of generosity.

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni chos rnam pa gnyis kyis bsdus pas phyir mi ldog par gnas so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni chos rnam pa gnyis kyis bsdus pas phyir mi ldog par gnas so //
translated: Son of noble family, the thought of awakening is included in two things, and so it is irreversible.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //🔽bsam @257a * //
analyzed: bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa'o // bsam @257a * //
translated: They are intention and superior intention.

original: pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa gang gis bsdus /
analyzed: pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa gang gis bsdus /
translated: What is included in intention?

original: bsam pa ni g-yo med pa dang sgyu med pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni g-yo med pa dang sgyu med pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in non-deception and non-fraudulence.🔽What is included in superior intention?

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni de la ma chags pa dang khyad par du 'gro bas bsdus so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni de la ma chags pa dang khyad par du 'gro bas bsdus so //
translated: It is included in non-attachment to that and in progress.

original: bzhi po de dag gang gis bsdus /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag gang gis bsdus /
translated: What is included in those four?

original: chos brgyad kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: chos brgyad kyis bsdus te /
translated: They are included in eight things.

original: g-yo med pa ni drang po dang gsal bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo med pa ni drang po dang gsal bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Non-deception is included in straightforwardness and clarity.

original: sgyu med pa ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang bsam pa dag bas bsdus so //
analyzed: sgyu med pa ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang bsam pa dag bas bsdus so //
translated: Non-fraudulence is included in non-artificiality and pure intention.

original: de la ma chags pa ni sems ma gong ba dang brtson 'grus ma gong bas bsdus so //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni sems ma gong ba dang brtson 'grus ma gong bas bsdus so //
translated: Non-attachment to that is included in an uninflated mind and uninflated effort.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis bsdus te rgyas par mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis bsdus te rgyas par mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In particular, the bodhisattva's progress is summarized in the one hundred and twenty-eight qualities, such as the bodhisattva is included in the collection of merit and the collection of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang 'di skad du /
translated: The noble Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together also says, What is superior intention?

original: yon tan khyad par can 'dod pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can 'dod pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: It is the desire for special qualities.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni srog chags 'byung po rnams la des pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni srog chags 'byung po rnams la des pa'o //
translated: Superior intention is gentleness toward living beings.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa'o //
translated: It is love for all sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa thams cad la gus pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad la gus pa'o //
translated: It is respect for all noble beings.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams la snying brtse ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams la snying brtse ba'o //
translated: It is compassion for worldly people.

original: bla ma la rim gro byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma la rim gro byed pa'o //
translated: It is service to teachers.🔽It is the refuge, the protector, the island, the shelter, the resort for those who have no refuge, no protector, no island, no refuge, no resort.

original: skyabs dang dpung gnyen dang gling med pa dang mgon med pa'i mgon dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen dang gling ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skyabs dang dpung gnyen dang gling med pa dang mgon med pa'i mgon dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen dang gling ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so on.

original: rgya cher de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be studied in detail in the same text.

original: gzhan yang mdo de las byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa dag pa la ni nam mkha' dang rtsig ba dang shing dang chu bo dang nags tshal la sogs pa dag las kyang chos 'byung la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo de las byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa dag pa la ni nam mkha' dang rtsig ba dang shing dang chu bo dang nags tshal la sogs pa dag las kyang chos 'byung la /
translated: Moreover, that same sutra says that for a bodhisattva whose attitude is pure, the Dharma appears even in the sky, in walls, in trees, in rivers, in forests, and so on.

original: rang nyid kyi spyod pa nyid las kyang gdams dag dang rjes su bstan pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi spyod pa nyid las kyang gdams dag dang rjes su bstan pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: And instructions and teachings appear even in his own conduct.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the Akṣayamatisūtra says,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa yin te /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the superior intention of bodhisattvas is inexhaustible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad lhag par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad lhag par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they focus on all the roots of virtue with a superior intention.

original: tha na gang byang chub sems dpa' gang ci sems pa de thams cad dge ba'i bsam pa las lhag pa'i bsam pas dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha na gang byang chub sems dpa' gang ci sems pa de thams cad dge ba'i bsam pa las lhag pa'i bsam pas dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Even when they are doing something trivial, whatever a bodhisattva thinks, all of that is focused with a superior intention on virtue.

original: sa nas sar bzhag pa'i phyir 'pho ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang btsun @257b ba sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa nas sar bzhag pa'i phyir 'pho ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang btsun @257b ba sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa mi zad pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: And again, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable superior attitude.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: 'di ltar sa gzhi bzang po las nags tshal dang lo tog phun sum tshogs pa skye ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa gzhi bzang po las nags tshal dang lo tog phun sum tshogs pa skye ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as a good field produces an abundance of forests and crops,

original: tshul khrims bzang po'i sa gzhi las sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims bzang po'i sa gzhi las sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: so a good field of morality produces and increases all the qualities of a buddha.

original: 'dir 'di dpyad do //
analyzed: 'dir 'di dpyad do //
translated: Here, this should be analyzed.

original: smon pa byang chub kyi sems dang 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems de gnyis kyi don la /
analyzed: smon pa byang chub kyi sems dang 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems de gnyis kyi don la /
translated: Regarding the meaning of those two, the aspiration thought of awakening and the venturing thought of awakening,

original: sngon gyi mkhas pa chen po rnams dang / da ltar gyi mkhas pa chen po dag rnam pa du mar 'chad de /
analyzed: sngon gyi mkhas pa chen po rnams dang / da ltar gyi mkhas pa chen po dag rnam pa du mar 'chad de /
translated: the great sages of the past and the great sages of the present explain them in many ways.

original: de dag gi 'dod pa de dag la bdag gi blo 'phro bar nus mod kyi yi ge mngas par 'gyur bas gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dod pa de dag la bdag gi blo 'phro bar nus mod kyi yi ge mngas par 'gyur bas gzhag go //
translated: I could elaborate on these assertions, but that would lengthen this work excessively.

original: 'di gnyis kyi don mdo nyid na gsal bar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi don mdo nyid na gsal bar gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of these two passages is clearly stated in the sutras themselves.

original: sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Array of Stalks Sidra says:

original: rigs kyi bu sems can gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag kyang dkon no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag kyang dkon no //
translated: Son of noble family, it is rare for any sentient being to generate the mind of unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening.

original: de bas kyang gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu chas pa'i sems can de dag ni shin tu dkon no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas kyang gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu chas pa'i sems can de dag ni shin tu dkon no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even rarer are those sentient beings who set out toward unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening.

original: slob dpon zhi ba lha'i zhal nas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba lha'i zhal nas kyang /
translated: Master Śāntideva also says:

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That mind of awakening is of two kinds:🔽the mind aspiring to awakening and the mind entering awakening.

original: byang chub tu smon pa'i sems dang / byang chub tu 'jug pa'i sems so zhes bslab pa kun las btus pa las gsungs pa dang / spyod 'jug las kyang /
analyzed: byang chub tu smon pa'i sems dang / byang chub tu 'jug pa'i sems so zhes bslab pa kun las btus pa las gsungs pa dang / spyod 'jug las kyang /
translated: And Guide to the Bodhisattva Way of Life says:

original: 'gro bar 'dod dang 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'dod dang 'gro ba yi //
translated: Those who wish to go and those who are going

original: bye brag ji ltar shes pa ltar //🔽de bzhin mkhas pas 'di nyid kyi //
analyzed: bye brag ji ltar shes pa ltar // de bzhin mkhas pas 'di nyid kyi //
translated: The wise should know the distinctions🔽of this very [awakening mind] in stages,

original: bye brag rim bzhin shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: bye brag rim bzhin shes par bya // zhes gsungs so /
translated: just as they are.

original: yang slob dpon gyi zhal nas /
analyzed: yang slob dpon gyi zhal nas /
translated: The master [Atiśa] also said:

original: de la smon pa'i sems ni ngas sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya'o zhes smon pa las skyes pa'o zhes bslab pa kun las btus pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: de la smon pa'i sems ni ngas sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya'o zhes smon pa las skyes pa'o zhes bslab pa kun las btus pa las gsungs so //
translated: The aspiring mind is that which arises from the aspiration, “I will become a buddha.”

original: de bas na 'bras bu rdzogs pa'i byang chub yul du byed cing dmigs pa ni smon pa'i sems yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu rdzogs pa'i byang chub yul du byed cing dmigs pa ni smon pa'i sems yin te /
translated: Thus, the aspiring mind is that which takes the result, complete awakening, as its object and objective reference.

original: ji skad du mgon po byams pas kyang /🔽sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: ji skad du mgon po byams pas kyang / sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: As the protector Maitreya says in the Ornament of Clear Realization:🔽The generation of the mind is the wish for complete,

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //🔽ces mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod // ces mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las gsungs so //
translated: perfect awakening for the sake of others.

original: lam gyi chos yul du byed cing dmigs pa ni 'jug pa'i sems yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi chos yul du byed cing dmigs pa ni 'jug pa'i sems yin te /
translated: The venturing mind is that which takes the phenomena of the path as its object and objective reference.

original: mgon po byams pa'i zhal nas /🔽rang @258a * //
analyzed: mgon po byams pa'i zhal nas / rang @258a * //
translated: As the protector Maitreya says:🔽For the sake of oneself and others,

original: gzhan don dang de nyid don //
analyzed: gzhan don dang de nyid don //
translated: and for the sake of reality itself,

original: mthu dang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: mthu dang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: Power, one’s own buddha-field,🔽and the full maturation of sentient beings:

original: zhing dang sems can yongs smin dang // bdun pa byang chub mchog yin no //
analyzed: zhing dang sems can yongs smin dang // bdun pa byang chub mchog yin no //
translated: these seven are the supreme enlightenment.

original: zhes med sde rgyan las gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes med sde rgyan las gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi sems de nyid rgyu'i dus dang / 'bras bu'i dus thams cad du de nyid yin te ;
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi sems de nyid rgyu'i dus dang / 'bras bu'i dus thams cad du de nyid yin te ;
translated: Therefore, this very spirit of enlightenment is the cause and the effect at all times,

original: gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is so in terms of the distinctions of the stages.

original: de yang mgon po byams pa'i zhal nas rgyas par bshad de /
analyzed: de yang mgon po byams pa'i zhal nas rgyas par bshad de /
translated: This is explained extensively in the words of the protector Maitreya.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
translated: Gold, the moon, fire,

original: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
analyzed: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
translated: a treasure, a jewel mine, an ocean,🔽a vajra, a mountain, a friend,

original: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma klu //
analyzed: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma klu //
translated: a wish-fulfilling jewel, the sun, a nāga,

original: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //
analyzed: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //
translated: a king, a treasury, a highway,

original: bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
translated: a vehicle, a river,

original: sgra snyan chu bo sprin rnams kyis //
analyzed: sgra snyan chu bo sprin rnams kyis //
translated: a musical instrument, a river, and a cloud:

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: these are the twenty-two.

original: de la gnyis ni rgyu'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de la gnyis ni rgyu'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Of these, the first two are the causal spirit of enlightenment.

original: bcu bdun ni lam gyi byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: bcu bdun ni lam gyi byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The seventeenth is the thought of enlightenment of the path.

original: gsum ni 'bras bu'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: gsum ni 'bras bu'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The last three are the thought of enlightenment of the result.

original: gnyis ni smon pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gnyis ni smon pa'i sems so //
translated: Two are the thought of aspiration.

original: nyi shu ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: nyi shu ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: Twenty are the thought of engagement.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang gsum ni rgyu'i dus kyi sems so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang gsum ni rgyu'i dus kyi sems so //
translated: Another enumeration: three are the thought of the time of the cause.

original: bcu drug ni lam gyi dus kyi sems so //
analyzed: bcu drug ni lam gyi dus kyi sems so //
translated: Sixteen are the thought of the time of the path.

original: tha ma gsum ni 'bras bu'i dus kyi sems so //
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni 'bras bu'i dus kyi sems so //
translated: The last three are the thought of the time of the result.

original: de dag gi don rgyas pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan de nyid du blta bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de dag gi don rgyas pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan de nyid du blta bar bya'o ;
translated: The extensive meaning of these should be seen in the Abhisamayālaṅkāra itself.

original: / de ltar byang chub kyi sems rin po che de khyad par du spel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de ltar byang chub kyi sems rin po che de khyad par du spel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to increase that precious thought of enlightenment,

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa nges par blang par bya'o zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa nges par blang par bya'o zhes bstan nas /
translated: one should definitely take the vow of morality.

original: da ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i rten khyad par can bstan par 'dod nas /🔽so sor thar ba ris bdun gyi //
analyzed: da ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i rten khyad par can bstan par 'dod nas / so sor thar ba ris bdun gyi //
translated: Having taught that, now, wishing to teach the special basis of the vow of morality,🔽he says,🔽Those who always possess another vow,

original: rtag tu sdom gzhan ldan pa dag ; byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yi //
analyzed: rtag tu sdom gzhan ldan pa dag ; byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yi //
translated: the vow of the Bodhisattva,

original: skal ba yod kyi gzhan du min //🔽zhes smras te /
analyzed: skal ba yod kyi gzhan du min // zhes smras te /
translated: It is possible for them, not for others.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: khyod kyis dang por /
analyzed: khyod kyis dang por /
translated: “Didn’t you say earlier:

original: de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: That is the supreme person.

original: sems can dam pa byang chub mchog /'dod par gyur pa de dag la //
analyzed: sems can dam pa byang chub mchog /'dod par gyur pa de dag la //
translated: Those who desire the supreme enlightenment of the excellent beings,

original: zhes ma smras sam /
analyzed: zhes ma smras sam /
translated: Isn’t that what you said?”

original: yang 'dir 'di skad du brjod pa de ji lta bu smras pa bden te /
analyzed: yang 'dir 'di skad du brjod pa de ji lta bu smras pa bden te /
translated: Here, we say this: That is true.

original: snga ma ni ma dag pa'i rten du bzhag la 'di ni dag pa'i rten du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni ma dag pa'i rten du bzhag la 'di ni dag pa'i rten du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The former is posited as the basis of the impure, and this is asserted as the basis of the pure.

original: 'di'i don bla ma rje btsun dpal byang chub bzang pos sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di'i don bla ma rje btsun dpal byang chub bzang pos sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel par gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of this is stated by the glorious venerable master Bodhibhadra in his Commentary on the Twenty Verses:

original: 'di skad du so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa yin @258b te ;
analyzed: 'di skad du so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa yin @258b te ;
translated: “The vows of individual liberation are a branch of the bodhisattva vow.

original: phyogs gcig nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as being just a part of it.”

original: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gzhan dang ldan pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i snod du gyur ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gzhan dang ldan pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i snod du gyur ba la /
translated: Therefore, this person who possesses the other pratimoksa vows is a vessel for taking the bodhisattva vow.

original: bslab pa'i tshig 'di yang sbyin par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bslab pa'i tshig 'di yang sbyin par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the words of the precepts should be given to him.

original: 'di la srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i cho ga gzhan pa nyid ma yin zhing de rnams las kyang ldog pa yin pa la ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa len pa'i snod du gyur ba yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i cho ga gzhan pa nyid ma yin zhing de rnams las kyang ldog pa yin pa la ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa len pa'i snod du gyur ba yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not that there is no other rite for turning away from killing and so on, and it is not that one who turns away from those is not a vessel for taking the bodhisattva vow.

original: re zhig theg pa chen po'i bag chags med pa de'i rigs med pa so sor thar pa'i gtan gyi bar chad can nam /
analyzed: re zhig theg pa chen po'i bag chags med pa de'i rigs med pa so sor thar pa'i gtan gyi bar chad can nam /
translated: One who lacks the imprints of the Mahayana, one who lacks that lineage, one who has a permanent obstacle to liberation,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa med pa'i gong du de la pham pa byung ba'am bslab pa phul ba'am dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa med pa'i gong du de la pham pa byung ba'am bslab pa phul ba'am dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa'am /
translated: one who has incurred a root downfall before taking the bodhisattva vow, one who has offered back one’s commitments, one who has severed the root of virtue,

original: sdom pa de ma blangs pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang med na /
analyzed: sdom pa de ma blangs pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang med na /
translated: and one who has not taken the vow lacks the pratimoksa vow.

original: cig shos lta ga la yod du rung /
analyzed: cig shos lta ga la yod du rung /
translated: How could the other be possible?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ma log pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ma log pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: Would a bodhisattva who has not turned away from killing and so on exist?

original: smras pa de ni med de de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' la rtsa ba'i ltung ba yin par mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Therefore, since the vows of individual liberation taught by that buddha are sometimes available, they are rare, they are the principal cause for proceeding to the higher rebirths, and they are the doctrine of the Buddha, which is the opposite of the evil deeds of killing and so on.🔽The doctrine of the Buddha endures as long as the vows of individual liberation endure and it depends on them.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ni ji srid so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gnas pa de srid du gnas @259b shing de la rag lus pa yin pas so sor thar pa'i sdom pa de dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ni ji srid so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gnas pa de srid du gnas @259b shing de la rag lus pa yin pas so sor thar pa'i sdom pa de dang po kho nar bstan to //

translated: The morality of vows is the vows of the seven classes of pratimok˝ha.🔽The ordained category has five types, divided into monks, novices, and

analyzed: slong ma'i rab tu dbye bas rab tu byung ba'i phyogs ni rnam pa lnga'o // khyim pa'i phyogs gnyis te /

translated: The training for a day and night is not taught as a class of pratimoksa vows because it is not difficult to practice, it is not sexual misconduct, and it is not followed for a long time.
