original: bcu gsum ma gtogs pa lhag pa nyis brgya bzhi bcu bsrung ba'i kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dge tshul tshul dang ldan zhing rnam par dag pa dang / dge slong ma ni chos drug dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos drug legs par bsrung ba ste dge slong ma rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: bcu gsum ma gtogs pa lhag pa nyis brgya bzhi bcu bsrung ba'i kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dge tshul tshul dang ldan zhing rnam par dag pa dang / dge slong ma ni chos drug dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos drug legs par bsrung ba ste dge slong ma rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: The nun is pure and endowed with the rules who well protects the six rules and the six special rules.🔽Similarly, the monk is pure and endowed with the rules who perfectly completes the training as explained in the scriptures of the Vinaya of the true Dharma.

original: de bzhin du dge slong yang ji ltar dam pa'i chos 'dul pa'i gzhung las ji skad bshad @260b pa'i bslab pa shin tu rdzogs par bya pa dang dge slong rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin du dge slong ma yang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga brgya dang ldan zhing rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong yang ji ltar dam pa'i chos 'dul pa'i gzhung las ji skad bshad @260b pa'i bslab pa shin tu rdzogs par bya pa dang dge slong rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin du dge slong ma yang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga brgya dang ldan zhing rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the nun is pure and endowed with the rules who possesses the five hundred bases of training.

original: de dag kyang sde pa tha dad de /
analyzed: de dag kyang sde pa tha dad de /
translated: They are different sects.

original: 'di ltar phal chen pa'i sde pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba'i sde pa dang / gnas brtan pa'i sde pa dang / mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar phal chen pa'i sde pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba'i sde pa dang / gnas brtan pa'i sde pa dang / mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are the Mahāsāṃghika school, the Sarvāstivāda school, the Sthavira school, and the Saṃmitīya school.

original: de dag kyang bco brgyad du gnas te /
analyzed: de dag kyang bco brgyad du gnas te /
translated: These are further divided into eighteen schools.

original: 'di ltar / shar dang nub dang gangs ri dang // 'jig rten 'das par smra ba'i sde //
analyzed: 'di ltar / shar dang nub dang gangs ri dang // 'jig rten 'das par smra ba'i sde //
translated: Thus, there are the Pūrvaśaila, Aparaśaila, Haimavata, and Lokottaravāda.

original: btags par yod par smra ba'i sde //
analyzed: btags par yod par smra ba'i sde //
translated: There are the Prajñaptivāda and Caitika.

original: lnga tshan dge 'dun phal chen pa //
analyzed: lnga tshan dge 'dun phal chen pa //
translated: There are the five Mahāsāṃghika groups.

original: bzhi pa dag ni 'od srungs pa //
analyzed: bzhi pa dag ni 'od srungs pa //
translated: The fourth is the Kāśyapīya.

original: chos srung sde dang sa ston sde //
analyzed: chos srung sde dang sa ston sde //
translated: There are the Dharmaguptaka and Bhadrayānīya.

original: rnam par phye ste smra ba'i sde //🔽mang thos dge 'dun gos dmar po //
analyzed: rnam par phye ste smra ba'i sde // mang thos dge 'dun gos dmar po //
translated: There are the Vibhajyavāda.🔽There are the Bahuśrutīya, and the Tāmraśāṭīya.

original: gtsug lag khang chen la gnas dang // rgyal bed tshal na gnas pa dang // 'jigs med ri la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang chen la gnas dang // rgyal bed tshal na gnas pa dang // 'jigs med ri la gnas pa yi //
translated: There are the Mahīśāsaka, Kaulas, Āvantaka, and Jetavanīya.

original: gnas brtan pa yi sde pa gsum //
analyzed: gnas brtan pa yi sde pa gsum //
translated: There are the three Sthavira schools.

original: sar sgrogs ris pa'i sde pa dang // srung ba pa yi sde pa dang // gnas ma'i bu yi sde pa ste //
analyzed: sar sgrogs ris pa'i sde pa dang // srung ba pa yi sde pa dang // gnas ma'i bu yi sde pa ste //
translated: There are the Sarvāstivāda, the Vātsīputrīya, and the Dharmottarīya.

original: mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa gsum //
analyzed: mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa gsum //
translated: The Saṃmitīyas are divided into three sects.

original: yang gzhung kha cig las ni tshul de nyid las btags pa yod par smra ba'i sde pa de thams cad yod par sbyar la /
analyzed: yang gzhung kha cig las ni tshul de nyid las btags pa yod par smra ba'i sde pa de thams cad yod par sbyar la /
translated: Some texts, in addition to the above, apply the term Sarvâstivāda to all of those who assert the existence of representations.

original: mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa la ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dang / ku ru ku la'i sde pa dang ; sa sgrogs pa'i sde pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa la ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dang / ku ru ku la'i sde pa dang ; sa sgrogs pa'i sde pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the Saṃmitīyas are divided into three sects: the Vātsīputrīyas, the Kaurukullas, and the Mahīśāsakas.

original: yang gzhung kha cig las /
analyzed: yang gzhung kha cig las /
translated: Some texts say:

original: 'od srungs zhes bya chos srung ba //
analyzed: 'od srungs zhes bya chos srung ba //
translated: The Kāśyapīyas, the Dharmaguptakas,

original: sa srung ba dang gzhi kun yod //
analyzed: sa srung ba dang gzhi kun yod //
translated: the Mahiśāsakas, and the Sarvâstivādins,

original: shar nub gangs ri btags par smra //
analyzed: shar nub gangs ri btags par smra //
translated: the Pūrvaśailas, the Aparaśailas, and the Haimavatas,

original: rnam par phye smra 'jig rten 'das //
analyzed: rnam par phye smra 'jig rten 'das //
translated: the Vibhajyavādins, and the Lokottaravādins,

original: gos dmar thos mang srung ba pa //
analyzed: gos dmar thos mang srung ba pa //
translated: the Tāmraśāṭīyas, the Bahuśrutīyas, the Saṃmatīyas,

original: ku ru ku la gnas ma'i bu ;
analyzed: ku ru ku la gnas ma'i bu ;
translated: the Kaurukullas, and the Vātsīputrīyas,

original: ; rgyal byed pa dang 'jigs med pa //
analyzed: ; rgyal byed pa dang 'jigs med pa //
translated: the Jetavanīyas, the Abhayagirivāsins,

original: gtsug lag khang pa chen po pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang pa chen po pa'o //
translated: and the Mahāvihāravāsins.🔽They assert eighteen distinct sects:

original: bzhi dang drug dang lnga dang gsum //🔽tha dad rnam pa bco brgyad 'dod //🔽de ltar sde pa bco brgyad do //
analyzed: bzhi dang drug dang lnga dang gsum //🔽tha dad rnam pa bco brgyad 'dod //🔽de ltar sde pa bco brgyad do //
translated: four, six, five, and three.

original: sh'akya seng ge'i bstan pa ni //🔽gnas so 'gro ba'i bla ma de'i //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge'i bstan pa ni // gnas so 'gro ba'i bla ma de'i //
translated: The teaching of the Lion of the Shakyas

original: sngon gyi phrin las dbang gis yin //
analyzed: sngon gyi phrin las dbang gis yin //
translated: remains, by the power of the previous deeds🔽of that Guru of the world.🔽By the differences of country, meaning, teacher,

original: yul don slob dpon bye brag dang // lta ba'i bye brag tha dad kyi //
analyzed: yul don slob dpon bye brag dang // lta ba'i bye brag tha dad kyi //
translated: and the differences of views,

original: rgyu yis de dag tha dad byas //
analyzed: rgyu yis de dag tha dad byas //
translated: they are made different by causes.

original: ston pa tha dad yod pa min //
analyzed: ston pa tha dad yod pa min //
translated: There is no difference of teacher.

original: 'di dag gi lta ba dang / tshul khrims kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni gzhung chen po de dang der blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi lta ba dang / tshul khrims kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni gzhung chen po de dang der blta bar bya'o //
translated: The views and moral discipline of these should be seen in the great texts.

original: rtsa ba nyid bshad par bya ste /🔽tshangs spyod ces bya ba ni chang dang bud @261a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba nyid bshad par bya ste / tshangs spyod ces bya ba ni chang dang bud @261a * //
translated: The root is to be explained.

original: med kyi yul spangs pa'o //
analyzed: med kyi yul spangs pa'o //
translated: Brahmacharya means to abandon the objects of alcohol and women.

original: 'di ltar chang gi nyes dmigs kyang lung de dang de dag dang / mdo sde de dang der blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chang gi nyes dmigs kyang lung de dang de dag dang / mdo sde de dang der blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the faults of alcohol should be seen in this and that scripture, and in this and that sutra.

original: bud med kyi nyes dmigs kyang theg pa chen po dang theg pa chung ba'i mdo dang lung rnams su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bud med kyi nyes dmigs kyang theg pa chen po dang theg pa chung ba'i mdo dang lung rnams su blta bar bya ste /
translated: The faults of women should be seen in the Mahayana and Hinayana sutras and scriptures.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khrig pa bdun bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chung ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khrig pa bdun bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chung ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra of the Lesser Vehicle called the Teaching of the Seven Kinds of Sexual Intercourse says:

original: bram ze 'di na kha cig bdag tshangs par spyod par khas 'che zhing /
analyzed: bram ze 'di na kha cig bdag tshangs par spyod par khas 'che zhing /
translated: Brahmin, here some people vow to practice pure conduct.

original: bud med dang gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pa med kyang bud med kyi lus la mig gis bltas te de'i cha byad la zhen pa dang / bud med dang lhan cig rtsa ba dang / ca co 'don pa nyams su len pa dang / bud med kyi bsnyen bkur byed pa nyams su len pa dang /
analyzed: bud med dang gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pa med kyang bud med kyi lus la mig gis bltas te de'i cha byad la zhen pa dang / bud med dang lhan cig rtsa ba dang / ca co 'don pa nyams su len pa dang / bud med kyi bsnyen bkur byed pa nyams su len pa dang /
translated: Even though they do not engage in sexual intercourse with a woman, they look at the body of a woman with their eyes and are attached to her appearance; they practice with a woman, laughing and talking; they practice with a woman, serving her;

original: rtsig pas chod pa dang / yol bas chod pa'i bud med kyi rgyan dang / glu dang gar dang rol mo'i sgra nyams su len pa dang / pha rol po 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa la bltas nas nyams su len pa dang /
analyzed: rtsig pas chod pa dang / yol bas chod pa'i bud med kyi rgyan dang / glu dang gar dang rol mo'i sgra nyams su len pa dang / pha rol po 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa la bltas nas nyams su len pa dang /
translated: they practice with a woman, looking at her ornaments, singing, dancing, and playing music, whether she is separated from them by a wall or a curtain; they practice by looking at someone else who possesses the five objects of desire;

original: lha la sogs pa'i gnas su tshangs par spyod pa yongs su bsngo ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i gnas su tshangs par spyod pa yongs su bsngo ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: and they dedicate pure conduct to the abodes of gods and so forth.

original: tshangs par spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo chos bdun pa las kyang /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo chos bdun pa las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra of the Seven Dharmas of the Great Vehicle says:

original: rnam par rtog pas kyang 'dod pa la brten par mi bya na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas kyang 'dod pa la brten par mi bya na /
translated: “Do not rely on desire even in thought,

original: gang dbang po gnyis kyis sbyor ba lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dbang po gnyis kyis sbyor ba lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
translated: let alone in the union of the two organs.”

original: spyir 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs ni rgyal po shar ba'i bus zhus pa dang / 'dod pa la gdams pa'i mdo las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyir 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs ni rgyal po shar ba'i bus zhus pa dang / 'dod pa la gdams pa'i mdo las shes par bya'o //
translated: In general, the faults of desire should be understood from the Questions of the Layman Vira and the Sūtra on Instruction in Desire.

original: de bas na tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod pa lta bur ston pa ;
analyzed: de bas na tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod pa lta bur ston pa ;
translated: Therefore, those who are not celibate but pretend to be,

original: dge sbyong gi rtags dang mtshan mas nga rgyal du byed pas byang chub sems dpa' khyim na gnas pa chos dang mthun pa'i sgrub pa dag la rab tu byung ba'o snyam du brnyas par byed pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi rtags dang mtshan mas nga rgyal du byed pas byang chub sems dpa' khyim na gnas pa chos dang mthun pa'i sgrub pa dag la rab tu byung ba'o snyam du brnyas par byed pa /
translated: who are proud of the signs and marks of ascetics, think that the bodhisattva living at home is a monk who is practicing in accord with the Dharma.🔽They despise him,

original: tshul 'chos pa chom rkun lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa chom rkun lta bu ste /
translated: pretending to be ascetics like thieves.

original: mdo las chom rkun za'o //
analyzed: mdo las chom rkun za'o //
translated: A sūtra says, “Thieves eat.

original: chom rkun 'thung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chom rkun 'thung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The thief drinks! and so on.

original: de lta bu'i sdig pa can dge slong dang / dge tshul gyis lha dang mi'i mchod rten du gyur pa'i ngur smrig gi gos de gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sdig pa can dge slong dang / dge tshul gyis lha dang mi'i mchod rten du gyur pa'i ngur smrig gi gos de gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: The monk or novice who is such a sinner should not hold the saffron robe, which is a shrine for gods and men.

original: chos gos 'bar ba dang lhung bzed 'bar ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos gos 'bar ba dang lhung bzed 'bar ba zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained as the burning Dharma robe and the burning alms bowl.

original: ji skad du tshul khrims 'chal pa tshar gcod pa'i mdo @261b las ;
analyzed: ji skad du tshul khrims 'chal pa tshar gcod pa'i mdo @261b las ;
translated: As it is said in the Sutra for Eliminating Moral Turpitude:🔽The monk who has violated morality should not even snap his fingers while wearing the saffron flag of the Teacher.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dge slong gis ston pa'i ngur smrig gi rgyal mtshan se gol gtogs ba tsam du yang bcad bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'di'i nyes dmigs ni 'phags pa 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i mdo la sogs pa de dang der blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dge slong gis ston pa'i ngur smrig gi rgyal mtshan se gol gtogs ba tsam du yang bcad bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'di'i nyes dmigs ni 'phags pa 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i mdo la sogs pa de dang der blta bar bya'o //
translated: And the danger in this should be seen in such sutras as the Sutra Requested by Kasyapa.

original: de 'dra ba'i sdig pa can gyi dge sbyong la theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang / lam chen po de la gzhug par mi bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sdig pa can gyi dge sbyong la theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang / lam chen po de la gzhug par mi bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I think that such a sinful monk should not be made to enter the teaching of the Mahayana, that great path.

original: de lta bu'i nyes pas ma phog cing rnam par dag pa ni tshangs spyod ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyes pas ma phog cing rnam par dag pa ni tshangs spyod ces bya'o //
translated: The pure form of this is called “pure conduct.”

original: dge bsnyen dang dge tshul dang dge slob ma las kyang phul du byung bas na dge slong sdom pa dag tu bzhed ces smras te /
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang dge tshul dang dge slob ma las kyang phul du byung bas na dge slong sdom pa dag tu bzhed ces smras te /
translated: Since it is superior to the lay practitioner, novice monk, and female probationer, it is called the “monastic code of the bhikṣu.”

original: dge slong gi sdom pa rnam par dag pa ni theg pa chen po'i gzhi phul du byung zhing khyad par 'phags pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das de ltar bzhed do //
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa rnam par dag pa ni theg pa chen po'i gzhi phul du byung zhing khyad par 'phags pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das de ltar bzhed do //
translated: The Blessed One has said that the pure form of the monastic code of the bhikṣu is the superior and exalted foundation of the Great Vehicle.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The term bhikṣu refers to one who has been fully ordained through the rite of the four requests and the four exclamations.

original: de yang 'di ltar las ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar las ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of rites:

original: gsol ba'i las dang / gsol pa dang / gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las dang / las gsum brjod pa'i las so //
analyzed: gsol ba'i las dang / gsol pa dang / gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las dang / las gsum brjod pa'i las so //
translated: the rite of request, the rite of request and two exclamations, the rite of request and four exclamations, and the rite of three recitations of the rite.

original: las bzhi po de dag kyang gzhi gnyis la brten te sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can ma yin par bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: las bzhi po de dag kyang gzhi gnyis la brten te sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can ma yin par bgrang ba'o //
translated: These four rites are based on two foundations: sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: del sems can du bgrang ba'i las ni rab tu dbyung ba dang / bsnyan par rdzogs pa dang / gang zag yid mthun par bya ba dang / ltung ba las bslang ba dang / dgar ba dang / bskrad pa dang / dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dang /🔽zhag bdun dang / nyi shu dang / bzhi bcur byin gyis brlab pa dang / sems can la phan gdags pa dang / chad pas gcad pa'i las gang yin pa de ni sems can du bgrang ba gzhi'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: del sems can du bgrang ba'i las ni rab tu dbyung ba dang / bsnyan par rdzogs pa dang / gang zag yid mthun par bya ba dang / ltung ba las bslang ba dang / dgar ba dang / bskrad pa dang / dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dang / zhag bdun dang / nyi shu dang / bzhi bcur byin gyis brlab pa dang / sems can la phan gdags pa dang / chad pas gcad pa'i las gang yin pa de ni sems can du bgrang ba gzhi'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: The basis of the karma of sentient beings is the karma of fully admitting a novice or monk, the karma of fully ordaining a monk, the karma of harmonizing the minds of individuals, the karma of lifting downfalls, the karma of reconciliation, the karma of banishment, the karma of promising to remain in retreat during the rains,🔽the karma of blessing seven, twenty or forty days, the karma of benefiting sentient beings and the karma of punishment.

original: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i las ni chos gos dang lhung bzed byin gyis brlab pa dang / sra brkyang byin gyis brlab pa dang / chos gos rnams kyang mi dbul bar gzung ba dang / mtshams gcad pa dang / khyim rung bar yid mthun par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i las ni chos gos dang lhung bzed byin gyis brlab pa dang / sra brkyang byin gyis brlab pa dang / chos gos rnams kyang mi dbul bar gzung ba dang / mtshams gcad pa dang / khyim rung bar yid mthun par bya ba dang /
translated: The basis of the karma of non-sentient beings is the karma of blessing Dharma robes and alms bowls, the karma of blessing the rainy season retreat, the karma of holding Dharma robes without distributing them, the karma of establishing boundaries, the karma of harmonizing the minds of individuals in a suitable house,

original: de lta bu dang gzhi'i las gang yin pa de ni sems can bgrang ba ma yin pa'i las so //
analyzed: de lta bu dang gzhi'i las gang yin pa de ni sems can bgrang ba ma yin pa'i las so //
translated: Such and any other actions that are the basis of the downfall are the actions of incalculable sentient beings.

original: las de dag kyang tshogs gnyis kyis bya ba dang / bzhis bya ba dang / lngas bya ba dang / bcus bya ba dang / nyi @262a * //
analyzed: las de dag kyang tshogs gnyis kyis bya ba dang / bzhis bya ba dang / lngas bya ba dang / bcus bya ba dang / nyi @262a * //
translated: Those actions are performed by two assemblies, four assemblies, five assemblies, ten assemblies, twenty assemblies,

original: shus bya ba dang / tshogs bzhi bcus bya ba dang / dge 'dun mthun pas bya ba'o //🔽de la tshogs gnyis kyis bya ba'i las ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun du lan gsum brjod pa'i bshags pa'i las kyis ltung byed dam /
analyzed: shus bya ba dang / tshogs bzhi bcus bya ba dang / dge 'dun mthun pas bya ba'o // de la tshogs gnyis kyis bya ba'i las ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun du lan gsum brjod pa'i bshags pa'i las kyis ltung byed dam /
translated: forty assemblies, and by the harmonious Saṅgha.

original: nyes byas kyi nyes pa 'chags par byed do ;
analyzed: nyes byas kyi nyes pa 'chags par byed do ;
translated: The action performed by two assemblies is the action of confessing a downfall or a minor offense in the presence of the Saṅgha of fully ordained monks by reciting the Confession of Downfalls three times.

original: ; bzhis bya ba ni nyes pa sbom po bzhi'i mdun du bshags pa'o //
analyzed: ; bzhis bya ba ni nyes pa sbom po bzhi'i mdun du bshags pa'o //
translated: The action performed by four assemblies is the confession of the four serious faults.

original: bcus bya ba ni yul dbus su bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: bcus bya ba ni yul dbus su bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las so //
translated: The action performed by ten assemblies is the ceremony of full ordination in a central region.

original: tshogs lngas bya ba ni mtha' 'khob tu bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: tshogs lngas bya ba ni mtha' 'khob tu bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las so //
translated: The action performed by five assemblies is the ceremony of full ordination in a remote region.

original: tshogs nyi shus byas pa'i las ni dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba'i las so //
analyzed: tshogs nyi shus byas pa'i las ni dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba'i las so //
translated: The karma of twenty assemblies is the karma of ejecting a monk who has committed a residual offense.

original: bzhi bcus bya ba'i las ni dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba'i las so //
analyzed: bzhi bcus bya ba'i las ni dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba'i las so //
translated: The karma of forty is the karma of fullyor­daining a nun.

original: dge 'dun mthun pas byas pa'i las ni mtshams kyi las dang / gso sbyong gi las dang / dgag dbye dang gzhan de lta bu dang mthun pa'i las so //
analyzed: dge 'dun mthun pas byas pa'i las ni mtshams kyi las dang / gso sbyong gi las dang / dgag dbye dang gzhan de lta bu dang mthun pa'i las so //
translated: The karma of a harmonious saṃgha is the karma of a boundary, the karma of the poṣadha ceremony, the karma of the invitation ceremony, and other similar karmas.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i sde ba'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa btsun pa chos skyob dang / btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs dang / btsun pa dbyig bshes dang / btsun pa sangs rgyas lha dang / btsun pa bsam rdzogs dang / mkhas pa chen po nor gyi rtsa lag dang /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i sde ba'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa btsun pa chos skyob dang / btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs dang / btsun pa dbyig bshes dang / btsun pa sangs rgyas lha dang / btsun pa bsam rdzogs dang / mkhas pa chen po nor gyi rtsa lag dang /
translated: The Vinaya masters of the Sarvāstivāda school, the venerable Dharmatrāta, the venerable Ghoṣaka, the venerable Vasumitra, the venerable Buddhadeva, the venerable Samghabhadra, and the great scholar Vasurāta,

original: gnas brtan yon tan 'od dang / btsun pa sh'akya 'od la sogs pa dag na re /
analyzed: gnas brtan yon tan 'od dang / btsun pa sh'akya 'od la sogs pa dag na re /
translated: the elder Guṇaprabha, the venerable Śākyaprabha, and so on say:

original: rnam pa bcus bsnyen bar rdzogs te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus bsnyen bar rdzogs te /
translated: There are ten aspects of full ordination.

original: rang byung bas ni sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rang byung bas ni sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: The self-originated is the Buddha and the pratyekabuddha.

original: des par 'jug pa ni rten lnga pa'o //🔽dge slong tshur shog ces pas ni grags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des par 'jug pa ni rten lnga pa'o // dge slong tshur shog ces pas ni grags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the one who enters by the door of the path.🔽The sixth is the one who is called by the Blessed One himself, such as Śrīgupta.

original: ston par khas blangs pas ni 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston par khas blangs pas ni 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the one who is accepted as a teacher, such as Mahākāśyapa.

original: dri bas mnyes pa ni legs sbyin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri bas mnyes pa ni legs sbyin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the one who pleases by asking questions, such as Sudatta.

original: bla ma'i chos khas blangs pa ni skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo'i //
analyzed: bla ma'i chos khas blangs pa ni skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo'i //
translated: The ninth is the one who accepts the Dharma of the guru, such as Mahāprajāpatī.

original: pho nyas ni chos sbyin no //
analyzed: pho nyas ni chos sbyin no //
translated: The tenth is the one who is sent as a messenger, such as Dharmadinnā.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa lngas ni mtha' 'khob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa lngas ni mtha' 'khob pa'o //
translated: The eleventh is the one who is ordained by five, excluding the vinaya master, in the border regions.

original: bcu'i tshogs kyis ni dbus kyi mi rnams te skyabs su 'gro ba lan gsum bzlas pas ni sde bzang drug cu'i tshogs bsnyen par rdzogs par byas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bcu'i tshogs kyis ni dbus kyi mi rnams te skyabs su 'gro ba lan gsum bzlas pas ni sde bzang drug cu'i tshogs bsnyen par rdzogs par byas so zhes zer ro //
translated: The twelfth is the one who is ordained by a group of ten in the central region. The group of sixty good persons is ordained by the triple repetition of going for refuge.

original: dge slong ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: dge slong ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of bhikṣus:

original: ming gi dge slong dang / khas 'che ba'i dge slong dang / slong bas na dge slong dang / nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i dge slong ngo //
analyzed: ming gi dge slong dang / khas 'che ba'i dge slong dang / slong bas na dge slong dang / nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i dge slong ngo //
translated: the nominal bhikṣu, the bhikṣu by vow, the bhikṣu by begging, and the bhikṣu by destroying afflictions.

original: ding sang gi dus na tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dge slong ni shin tu dkon te /
analyzed: ding sang gi dus na tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dge slong ni shin tu dkon te /
translated: In these latter days, monks with pure moral discipline are extremely rare.

original: slob @262b dpon zhi ba lha'i zhal nas /
analyzed: slob @262b dpon zhi ba lha'i zhal nas /
translated: As Master Śāntideva says:

original: bstan rtsa dge slong nyid yin te //
analyzed: bstan rtsa dge slong nyid yin te //
translated: The root of the teaching is the monk;

original: dge slong nyid kyang dka' bar gnas //🔽zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: dge slong nyid kyang dka' bar gnas // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: It is difficult to live as a monk.

original: dge slong bslab pa la rma byung ba /
analyzed: dge slong bslab pa la rma byung ba /
translated: Therefore, those who have violated the precepts of a monk,

original: nyams pa ral ba nag nog can du gyur pa dang / zhig pa dang ma tshang bar gyur pa'i dge slong bas ni dge bsnyen rnam par dag pa theg pa chen po'i snod du bsngags so zhes bla ma dag ched cher gsung ngo //
analyzed: nyams pa ral ba nag nog can du gyur pa dang / zhig pa dang ma tshang bar gyur pa'i dge slong bas ni dge bsnyen rnam par dag pa theg pa chen po'i snod du bsngags so zhes bla ma dag ched cher gsung ngo //
translated: who have degenerated, who are corrupt, who are stained, who are broken, and who are incomplete, are praised as lay practitioners who are pure and who are vessels for the Great Vehicle.

original: yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will explain this further.

original: sdom pa zhes bya ba ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi rgyun 'gog cing sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa zhes bya ba ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi rgyun 'gog cing sdom pa'o //
translated: A vow is a restraint that stops the flow of immorality.

original: de yang 'di ltar gang las 'thob pa dang / ji ltar 'thob pa dang / sdom pa blang ba'i dus dang / ji ltar blang ba dang ; ji ltar gtong pa dang / de'i rang bzhin dang / ltung ba 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i rgyu dang /🔽ltung ba las ldang ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar gang las 'thob pa dang / ji ltar 'thob pa dang / sdom pa blang ba'i dus dang / ji ltar blang ba dang ; ji ltar gtong pa dang / de'i rang bzhin dang / ltung ba 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / ltung ba las ldang ba'o //
translated: The way to obtain the vows, the way to take them, the time to take the vows, the way to take them, the way to relinquish them, their nature, the causes of downfalls, the causes of not having downfalls,🔽and the way to rise from downfalls.🔽🔽

original: gang las 'thob ces pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa la dri ba dang / gzhung dag blta bar bya'o //🔽ji ltar gtong zhe na /🔽so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtong ba'i rgyu ni mang ste /🔽mi brda phrad pa'i drung du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bsam pa thag pa nas phul ba dang / ris mthun pa btang ba dang / pham pa'i nyes pa byung ba dang / mtshan gnyis dus gcig tu byung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa'o //
analyzed: gang las 'thob ces pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa la dri ba dang / gzhung dag blta bar bya'o //🔽ji ltar gtong zhe na /🔽so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtong ba'i rgyu ni mang ste /🔽mi brda phrad pa'i drung du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bsam pa thag pa nas phul ba dang / ris mthun pa btang ba dang / pham pa'i nyes pa byung ba dang / mtshan gnyis dus gcig tu byung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa'o //

original: ci'i phyir sdom pa de gtong ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdom pa de gtong ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: Why are these causes of relinquishing vows?

original: yang dag par gtang ba'i sems skyes pa dang / rten bor ba dang / ltung ba'i rgyu gang yang rung ba skyes pa dang / rten nyams pa dang / gzhi chad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gtang ba'i sems skyes pa dang / rten bor ba dang / ltung ba'i rgyu gang yang rung ba skyes pa dang / rten nyams pa dang / gzhi chad pa'o //
translated: The mind that is fully relinquished, the basis is discarded, any cause of a downfall arises, the basis degenerates, and the basis is severed.

original: yang 'dul ba 'dzin pa la la na re /
analyzed: yang 'dul ba 'dzin pa la la na re /
translated: Some Vinaya masters say:

original: ltung ba gcig byung bas thams cad gtong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ltung ba gcig byung bas thams cad gtong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: One relinquishes all vows through the occurrence of a single downfall.

original: kha cig dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus su gtong ngo zhes so //
analyzed: kha cig dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus su gtong ngo zhes so //
translated: Some say: One relinquishes vows at the time of the degeneration of the true Dharma.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag ni 'di skad du ltung ba gcig byung bas lhag ma mi gtong ste /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag ni 'di skad du ltung ba gcig byung bas lhag ma mi gtong ste /
translated: Sarvastivadin Vinaya masters say: The occurrence of a single downfall does not relinquish the remainder.

original: de la sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa gnyis ka yod de /
analyzed: de la sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa gnyis ka yod de /
translated: Both vows and nonvows exist in relation to that.

original: mi zhig la nor yang yod la bu lon yang chags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi zhig la nor yang yod la bu lon yang chags pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a person who has both wealth and debt.

original: ltung ba de bshags na de tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ltung ba de bshags na de tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: If that downfall is confessed, one possesses ethics.

original: sdom pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sdom pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: One does not become devoid of vows.

original: mtshan gyur pa sngon med pa'i sdom pa yang mi gtong la /
analyzed: mtshan gyur pa sngon med pa'i sdom pa yang mi gtong la /
translated: Also, the vows of one who has changed sex are not relinquished.

original: thob zin pa yang gtong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob zin pa yang gtong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor are the vows relinquished when one obtains the result of a nonreturner.

original: dam pa'i chos nub pa na yang de bzhin no //🔽cho 'phos pas gtong ba yang yang 'di ltar lus mi @263a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nub pa na yang de bzhin no // cho 'phos pas gtong ba yang yang 'di ltar lus mi @263a * //
translated: The same is true when the true Dharma disappears.

original: 'dra ba dang der sbyor ba ma byas pa dang / sdom pa mi dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba dang der sbyor ba ma byas pa dang / sdom pa mi dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vows are relinquished through transformation because one obtains a dissimilar body, one does not apply oneself to that body, and one does not remember the vows.

original: de dag ni slob dpon nor gyi rtsa lag gi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni slob dpon nor gyi rtsa lag gi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained following the master Yaśomitra.

original: gzhung de ma yin pa'i lugs mang du yod mod kyi 'dir gzhag go //
analyzed: gzhung de ma yin pa'i lugs mang du yod mod kyi 'dir gzhag go //
translated: There are many systems that are not his, but I will not elaborate on them here.

original: rang bzhin yang 'dul ba'i gzhung dag dang / rang rang sde pa'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yang 'dul ba'i gzhung dag dang / rang rang sde pa'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa la dri bar bya'o //
translated: The nature of the vows should be understood from the scriptures of the Vinaya and from asking those who uphold the Vinaya of our own and other sects.

original: ltung ba 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: ltung ba 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
translated: The causes of downfalls are twofold:

original: bya ba mi byed pa dang / mi bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba mi byed pa dang / mi bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: not doing what is required and doing what is prohibited.

original: yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang bzhi ste /
translated: There are four causes:

original: mi shes pa dang / ma gus pa dang / bag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa che ba'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / ma gus pa dang / bag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa che ba'o //
translated: ignorance, disrespect, carelessness, and strong afflictions.

original: ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lnga ste /
analyzed: ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lnga ste /
translated: 2. eating in moderation,

original: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te /
translated: 3. being diligent in yoga during the first and last periods of the night,🔽4. being conscientious,🔽5. being mindful,🔽6. being heedful,🔽7. seeing danger in the slightest faults,🔽8. reflecting properly,

original: 'dug pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal ba rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / dran pa dang ldan pa dang / bag yod pa dang / kha na ma tho ba chung ngu la'ang 'jigs par blta ba dang /
analyzed: 'dug pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal ba rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / dran pa dang ldan pa dang / bag yod pa dang / kha na ma tho ba chung ngu la'ang 'jigs par blta ba dang /
translated: 9. seeing the danger of the miserable realms,

original: tshul bzhin du sems pa ni rgyu dang po'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du sems pa ni rgyu dang po'o //
translated: 10. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of others,🔽11. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the Teacher,🔽12. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the deities who delight in the teaching,🔽13. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the wise,🔽14. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the world,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul shas cher lta ba dang / ston pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs bar spyod pa dang / bstan pa la dga' ba'i lha dag dang / skye bo mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul shas cher lta ba dang / ston pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs bar spyod pa dang / bstan pa la dga' ba'i lha dag dang / skye bo mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang /
translated: 15. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the Dharma,🔽16. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the monastic community,🔽17. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the training,🔽18. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the precepts,🔽19. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the code of rules,

original: bdag nyid la byas nas ngo tsha ba dang / khrel yod pa ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byas nas ngo tsha ba dang / khrel yod pa ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: 20. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for settling disputes,🔽21. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for the nuns,🔽22. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for the male novices,🔽23. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for the female novices,🔽24. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for the male lay followers,🔽25. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for the female lay followers,🔽26. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for the male and female lay followers,🔽27. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for the male and female novices,🔽28. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression in the presence of the rules for the male and female postulants,

original: don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba /
analyzed: don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba /
translated: 29. being ashamed and embarrassed to commit a transgression

original: las kyi mtha' nyung ba ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' nyung ba ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: Having few activities is the third cause.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dang mi 'dre bar gnas pa dang ltung ba dang ltung ba ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa ni rgyu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dang mi 'dre bar gnas pa dang ltung ba dang ltung ba ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa ni rgyu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Dwelling in solitude from householders and monks, being skilled in what is a downfall and what is not a downfall, and being diligent in virtue is the fourth cause.

original: las dang po pa dang smyos pa dang gnyid log pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa ni rgyu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang smyos pa dang gnyid log pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa ni rgyu lnga pa'o //
translated: Beginners, the insane, those asleep, those whose minds are disturbed, and those in pain are the fifth cause.

original: ltung ba las ldang ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: ltung ba las ldang ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three ways to rise from downfalls:

original: 'gyod pa lnga bskyed pa dang / yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa dang / rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa lnga bskyed pa dang / yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa dang / rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal pa'o //
translated: arousing the five regrets, being heedful in the five limbs, and dispelling regret in five ways.

original: yan lag lngas bsdus pa ni nyan thos kyis rab lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lngas bsdus pa ni nyan thos kyis rab lta bar bya'o //
translated: The five limbs are to be gathered by the śrāvakas.

original: 'gyod pa lngas bskyed pa ni 'di na la la dag la ltung ba byung ba na 'di snyam du bdag nyid la gzhi 'dis tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyod pa lngas bskyed pa ni 'di na la la dag la ltung ba byung ba na 'di snyam du bdag nyid la gzhi 'dis tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang /
translated: “I will be criticized by the teacher and by my fellow brahmacārin who are wise.”🔽“I will be criticized by the gods.”🔽“In all directions, nonvirtuous beings will speak unpleasantly of me, and my bad reputation will spread.”

original: lha dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams @263b dag tu sdig pa can gyi skye bos grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa brjod par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / mi dge ba'i gzhi 'dis bdag lus zhig nas ngan song dag tu skyes na mi rung ngo snyam 'gyod pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: lha dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams @263b dag tu sdig pa can gyi skye bos grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa brjod par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / mi dge ba'i gzhi 'dis bdag lus zhig nas ngan song dag tu skyes na mi rung ngo snyam 'gyod pa skyes pa'o //
translated: “If I die, it would not be right for me to be reborn in the lower realms on the basis of this nonvirtue.”🔽The five ways of dispelling regret are as follows:

original: rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi dang bcas /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi dang bcas /
translated: The Bhagavān said that if you have incurred a downfall, you should confess it.

original: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pas ltung ba las ldang ba'i thabs yod do snyam pa dang / mi shes pa dang bag med pa dang mgus pa dang nyon mongs pa che ba dag gis ltung ba byung ba mi shes pa nas bzhi po de dag skyes so snyam pa dang /🔽ltung ba la ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa thag pa nas sems bskyed do snyam pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag gi mdun du legs par bshags pa zin to snyam pa dang / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rab tu byung nas bslab pa dang 'gal na 'gyod pa byed pa de ni yang dag pa dang legs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pas ltung ba las ldang ba'i thabs yod do snyam pa dang / mi shes pa dang bag med pa dang mgus pa dang nyon mongs pa che ba dag gis ltung ba byung ba mi shes pa nas bzhi po de dag skyes so snyam pa dang / ltung ba la ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa thag pa nas sems bskyed do snyam pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag gi mdun du legs par bshags pa zin to snyam pa dang / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rab tu byung nas bslab pa dang 'gal na 'gyod pa byed pa de ni yang dag pa dang legs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The four thoughts that arise are: Since the teachings of the Buddha are accompanied by the means of deliverance, there is a method to rise from downfalls, Those who are ignorant, careless, timid, or overwhelmed by afflictions do not know that downfalls occur, and I have generated the awakening mind from the very depths of my heart so that downfalls do not occur, and I have completed the confession of downfalls in the presence of learned practitioners of pure conduct.

original: bdag bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gyod pa'i rgyun sgrib pa'i gnas rnam grangs du mar smad pa /
analyzed: bdag bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gyod pa'i rgyun sgrib pa'i gnas rnam grangs du mar smad pa /
translated: The four thoughts that arise are: If I were to transgress the ethical precepts of the well-spoken Dharma-Vinaya in which I have taken ordination, I would feel regret, The Blessed One has in many ways condemned the causes of regret and obscurations, and I have taken ordination in the well-spoken Dharma-Vinaya, and I have taken ordination in the well-spoken Dharma-Vinaya of the Blessed One.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos gang yin pa des mang du gnas shing dang du len par byed la /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos gang yin pa des mang du gnas shing dang du len par byed la /
translated: Whatever is an obstacle, I will not dwell on it, but will accept it.

original: sel bar mi byed la mi sel ba gang yin pa de ni bdag dge ba dang legs pa ma yin no snyam nas 'gyod pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: sel bar mi byed la mi sel ba gang yin pa de ni bdag dge ba dang legs pa ma yin no snyam nas 'gyod pa sel ba'o //
translated: Whatever is not to be removed, I will not remove it.

original: yang na sde pa so so'i rang rang gi 'dul ba las 'byung ba'i thabs kyis bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sde pa so so'i rang rang gi 'dul ba las 'byung ba'i thabs kyis bshags par bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should confess with the method that appears in the individual schools' vinaya.

original: yang na bdag gis byas pa'i ltung ba bshags pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i thabs des bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag gis byas pa'i ltung ba bshags pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i thabs des bshags par bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should confess with the method of the extensive rite for confessing downfalls that I have composed.

original: zla ba byed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon zhing gso sbyong la rab tu brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba byed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon zhing gso sbyong la rab tu brtson par bya'o //
translated: Every half month, one should recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra and strive in the poṣadha purification.

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la de ltar brtson pa ni ltung ba la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la de ltar brtson pa ni ltung ba la mkhas pa yin /
translated: A monk who strives in the training of the vinaya is skilled in downfalls.

original: ltung ba las nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: ltung ba las nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in deliverance from downfalls.

original: bdag nyid dag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pas 'gyod pa med de de khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung nas legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba'i tshul khrims nyams pa dang zhig pa dang ral ba dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid dag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pas 'gyod pa med de de khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung nas legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba'i tshul khrims nyams pa dang zhig pa dang ral ba dang /
translated: He is without regret because he is pure, clean, stainless, and without fault. Having gone forth from home to homelessness, he is without the faults of degeneration, destruction, and violation of the moral discipline of the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya.

original: nag nog can dang mi gtsang ba med cing legs par bsrung ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan bcu bdun gyis brgyan nas gnas @264a * //
analyzed: nag nog can dang mi gtsang ba med cing legs par bsrung ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan bcu bdun gyis brgyan nas gnas @264a * //
translated: He is without the faults of impurity and defilement. He is adorned with the twelve ascetic practices and the seventeen ornaments of an ascetic.

original: pa ni dge slong yang dag pa yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: pa ni dge slong yang dag pa yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: He is a true monk.

original: tshangs spyod dpal dang ldan pa yi //
analyzed: tshangs spyod dpal dang ldan pa yi //
translated: The glorious one who practices pure conduct

original: dge slong sdom pa dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: dge slong sdom pa dag tu bzhed //
translated: is accepted as a monk who has vows.

original: ces smras so //
analyzed: ces smras so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: des na mgon po mi pham pa'i zhal nas /
analyzed: des na mgon po mi pham pa'i zhal nas /
translated: Therefore the protector Ajita said:🔽The occurrence of downfalls, possessing downfalls,🔽the definite emergence from downfalls, the person,

original: ltung ba 'byung dang ldan pa dang // nges par 'byung dang gang zag dang // bcas pa dang ni rab dbye bas //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byung dang ldan pa dang // nges par 'byung dang gang zag dang // bcas pa dang ni rab dbye bas //
translated: the proscribed rules, and the divisions,

original: rnam par des phyir 'dul ba'i chos //
analyzed: rnam par des phyir 'dul ba'i chos //
translated: Because of its purity, it is the Dharma of Vinaya.

original: zhes mdo sde rgyan las gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes mdo sde rgyan las gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said in the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i skabs rdzogs so //🔽/'di ltar so sor thar pa'i sdom pa tsam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i skabs rdzogs so // /'di ltar so sor thar pa'i sdom pa tsam /
translated: The section on the vehicle of the śrāvakas is finished.🔽Thus, one should not be satisfied with merely the vows of individual liberation

original: smon pa'i sems bskyed pa tsam gyis cho ga cing de tsam la ltos par mi bya ste /
analyzed: smon pa'i sems bskyed pa tsam gyis cho ga cing de tsam la ltos par mi bya ste /
translated: or with merely the generation of the aspiration to enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las rigs kyi bu ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las rigs kyi bu ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
translated: As it says in the noble Cloud of Jewels, “Son of noble family, how are bodhisattvas restrained by the vows of training?”

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar spyod de /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar spyod de /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva practices as follows:

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa tsam gyis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa tsam gyis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus kyi /
translated: “I cannot become fully awakened into unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood merely through the vows of individual liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gang 'di mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa de dag la bdag gis bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gang 'di mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa de dag la bdag gis bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: The Tathāgata has said, “I should train in those bodhisattva practices and in those bases of bodhisattva training that are set forth in this and that sūtra.”

original: 'dir yang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rgya chen po la bslab par bya ba'i phyir bdag gis bla ma'i rjes su bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i rjes su 'brangs nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rgya chen po la bslab par bya ba'i phyir bdag gis bla ma'i rjes su bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i rjes su 'brangs nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here also, in order to train in the vast bodhisattva training, I will explain following the instructions of the guru and the Mahāyāna sūtras.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rten bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rten bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the uncommon basis of the Mahāyāna,

original: da ni shing rta chen po'i lam bstan pa'i phyir /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa dag gi //
analyzed: da ni shing rta chen po'i lam bstan pa'i phyir / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dag gi //
translated: now, in order to teach the path of the great charioteers,🔽it is said:

original: tshul khrims le'u gsungs cho ga yis //
analyzed: tshul khrims le'u gsungs cho ga yis //
translated: The chapter on ethics teaches the ritual🔽of the bodhisattva stages.

original: zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni 'phags pa thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug bkod pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni 'phags pa thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug bkod pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: The bodhisattva stages are the treatise Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras composed by Ārya Asaṅga.

original: de las kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u las so //
analyzed: de las kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u las so //
translated: Moreover, it is taught in the chapter on the perfection of morality.

original: de yang dgu yin te /
analyzed: de yang dgu yin te /
translated: And that is ninefold:

original: ngo bo nyid dang thams cad dang // dka' ba dang ni sgo kun dang // skyes bu dam pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang thams cad dang // dka' ba dang ni sgo kun dang // skyes bu dam pa nyid dang ni //
translated: 1. natural, 2. universal, 3. difficult, 4. of all doors, 5. of the holy beings,

original: rnam kun dang ni phongs shing 'dod /
analyzed: rnam kun dang ni phongs shing 'dod /
translated: 6. of all aspects, 7. of the poor and the desirous,

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde 'gyur dang // rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde 'gyur dang // rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: 8. leading to happiness in this life and the next, 9. pure morality.

original: de dag gi nang nas kyang ngo bo nyid thams cad kyi tshul khrims las @264b gsungs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas kyang ngo bo nyid thams cad kyi tshul khrims las @264b gsungs so zhes bya'o //
translated: And from among those, it is taught in the chapter on the natural morality.

original: ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: And how is it taught?

original: tshul khrims kyi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi le'u las gsungs pa'i cho gas bya'o //
translated: It is taught in the chapter on morality by the method of the rite.

original: cho ga de yang ji lta zhe na /🔽yang dag mtshan nyid ldan pa yi //
analyzed: cho ga de yang ji lta zhe na / yang dag mtshan nyid ldan pa yi //
translated: And what is that rite?

original: bla ma bzang las sdom pa blang //
analyzed: bla ma bzang las sdom pa blang //
translated: From a good guru who has the right characteristics,

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: one should take the vow.

original: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid bzang po de dang ldan pa'i bla ma bzang po de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid bzang po de dang ldan pa'i bla ma bzang po de yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is that good guru who has the right characteristics?

original: sdom pa'i cho ga la mkhas dang // bdag nyid gang zhig sdom la gnas //
analyzed: sdom pa'i cho ga la mkhas dang // bdag nyid gang zhig sdom la gnas //
translated: He is skilled in the rite of the vow, and he himself is established in the vow.

original: sdom pa 'bogs bzod snying rje ldan //
analyzed: sdom pa 'bogs bzod snying rje ldan //
translated: He is patient in bestowing the vow, and he is compassionate.

original: bla ma bzang por shes par bya //
analyzed: bla ma bzang por shes par bya //
translated: He is to be known as a good guru.

original: zhes bya ba de yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de la sdom pa'i cho ga la mkhas ba zhes pa ni de la mkhas shing byang ba'o //
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i cho ga la mkhas ba zhes pa ni de la mkhas shing byang ba'o //
translated: Among them, skilled in the rite of the vow means to be skilled and experienced in that.

original: sdom la gnas zhes pa ni bla ma'i tshul khrims nyams pa dang zhig pa med cing gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: sdom la gnas zhes pa ni bla ma'i tshul khrims nyams pa dang zhig pa med cing gtsang ba'o //
translated: Established in the vow means that the guru's morality is not impaired or broken, but pure.

original: bzod ces pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa ste sdom pa 'bogs pa la rag ma las par chas pa'o //
analyzed: bzod ces pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa ste sdom pa 'bogs pa la rag ma las par chas pa'o //
translated: Patient means to be capable, to be ready to bestow the vow without relying on others.

original: snying rje ldan zhes pa ni slob ma la bu'i 'du shes dang / gzhan gyi sdug bsngal sems mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ldan zhes pa ni slob ma la bu'i 'du shes dang / gzhan gyi sdug bsngal sems mi bzod pa'o //
translated: Compassionate means to have the perception of disciples as sons, and to be unable to bear the suffering of others.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni bla mar bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa nyid la nod par bya'i gzhan las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni bla mar bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa nyid la nod par bya'i gzhan las ni ma yin te /
translated: Guru means to be worthy of being made a guru, and to be one who receives the vow, not someone else.

original: gus pas bla mar 'dzin pa dang / de'i rjes su slob ma'i ngang tshul can dang / des bstan pa'i don la gus pa chen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pas bla mar 'dzin pa dang / de'i rjes su slob ma'i ngang tshul can dang / des bstan pa'i don la gus pa chen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a teacher who is devoted to the guru, who is a disciple in the proper sense of the word, and who has great devotion to the meaning taught by the guru.

original: yang bla ma de phun sum tshogs pa bzhi dang ldan pa yin te ;
analyzed: yang bla ma de phun sum tshogs pa bzhi dang ldan pa yin te ;
translated: Moreover, the guru is endowed with four perfections:

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: perfection of morality, perfection of good qualities, perfection of intention, and perfection of application.

original: de la bdag nyid gang zhig sdom pa gang la gnas zhes pas ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid gang zhig sdom pa gang la gnas zhes pas ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Among these, the perfection of morality is taught by the phrase “whoever abides in whatever vow.”

original: sdom pa'i cho ga la mkhas dang ; ; sdom pa 'bogs pa bzod ces pas ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sdom pa'i cho ga la mkhas dang ; ; sdom pa 'bogs pa bzod ces pas ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The perfection of good qualities is taught by the phrase “skilled in the rite of the vow, and patient in bestowing the vow.”

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Moreover, it is explained:

original: sdom la gnas zhes pa ni bla ma des sdom pa btang ba dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / chos mthun pa ma yin pa las sdom pa mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: sdom la gnas zhes pa ni bla ma des sdom pa btang ba dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / chos mthun pa ma yin pa las sdom pa mi 'thob bo //
translated: “Abiding in the vow” means that the guru does not bestow the vow on those who have abandoned the vow, who have faulty morality, or who are not suitable recipients.

original: cho ga la mkhas zhes pa ni cho ga la mkhas pa las gnod par bya'i cho ga mi shes pa las ni de nyid cho ga nyams pas sdom pa mi 'thob po //
analyzed: cho ga la mkhas zhes pa ni cho ga la mkhas pa las gnod par bya'i cho ga mi shes pa las ni de nyid cho ga nyams pas sdom pa mi 'thob po //
translated: Skill in the rite means that the rite is performed by one who is skilled in the rite, and not by one who is unskilled in the rite. The latter would be a defective rite, and the vow would not be obtained.

original: 'bogs bzod ces pa ni rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis tshul 'di lta bu la 'jug pa ni legs so //
analyzed: 'bogs bzod ces pa ni rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis tshul 'di lta bu la 'jug pa ni legs so //
translated: Able to endure means that the aspirant is able to enter into this way with a joyful mind.

original: bdag gis the tshom med par sdom pa sbyin par bya'o snyam du sdom pa steng bar nus @265a * //
analyzed: bdag gis the tshom med par sdom pa sbyin par bya'o snyam du sdom pa steng bar nus @265a * //
translated: I will give the vow without doubt means that the aspirant is able to give the vow.

original: pa'o ; / snying rjer ldan zhes pas ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: pa'o ; / snying rjer ldan zhes pas ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase endowed with compassion indicates both excellence of intention and excellence of application.

original: de la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni dad pa nyid /
analyzed: de la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni dad pa nyid /
translated: Among these, excellence of intention is faith itself.

original: bsam pa thag pa nas byed pa nyid dang / ma chags ba dang snying rje dang ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas byed pa nyid dang / ma chags ba dang snying rje dang ldan pa nyid de /
translated: It is the very fact of acting from the depths of one's heart, and being endowed with non-attachment and compassion.

original: bla ma gus pa dang ; 'dod pa chung ba dang / cho ga shes pa dang / zang zing lhur mi len pa dang / skyo ba med pa dang / pha rol gyi nyes pa bzod pa dang / khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa med pa'o //🔽sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni dge ba'i chos phyir zhing spel ba dang / gus shing 'jug pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la ma rmongs par byed pa dang / spro ba dang le lo mi byed pa dang / 'dod pa'i bde ba dang /
analyzed: bla ma gus pa dang ; 'dod pa chung ba dang / cho ga shes pa dang / zang zing lhur mi len pa dang / skyo ba med pa dang / pha rol gyi nyes pa bzod pa dang / khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa med pa'o // sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni dge ba'i chos phyir zhing spel ba dang / gus shing 'jug pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la ma rmongs par byed pa dang / spro ba dang le lo mi byed pa dang / 'dod pa'i bde ba dang /
translated: Devotion to the teacher, fewness of desires, knowledge of the rules, not being preoccupied with material things, indefatigability, patience with others' faults, and freedom from anger and resentment.

original: 'du 'dzi dag la mi dga' ba dang / sems rnam par ma g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi dag la mi dga' ba dang / sems rnam par ma g-yengs pa'o //
translated: Perfection of application is the increase of virtuous qualities, the respectful practice of them, the non-delusion of the bases of training, the enthusiasm and non-slothfulness, the non-delight in the pleasures of desire and in worldly talk, and the non-distraction of the mind.

original: de lta bu'i bla ma las sdom pa blangs na tshul khrims kyi bslab pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bla ma las sdom pa blangs na tshul khrims kyi bslab pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes the vow from such a teacher, the training in morality will increase.

original: de lta bu ni /🔽yang dag mtshan nyid ldan pa yi //🔽bla ma bzang las sdom ba blang //
analyzed: de lta bu ni / yang dag mtshan nyid ldan pa yi // bla ma bzang las sdom ba blang //
translated: Such a one🔽I think should take the vow

original: zhes bdag gis bsams so //
analyzed: zhes bdag gis bsams so //
translated: From a good teacher who has the right characteristics.

original: de yang / sdom pa len pa'i cho ga dang // grangs dang sdom ba gtong ba'i rgyu //
analyzed: de yang / sdom pa len pa'i cho ga dang // grangs dang sdom ba gtong ba'i rgyu //
translated: The number, the causes for losing the vow,🔽The causes for not losing it,

original: mi gtong rgyu dang ldan pa dang // tshul khrims kyi ni phan yon yin //🔽zhes pa ni bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtong rgyu dang ldan pa dang // tshul khrims kyi ni phan yon yin // zhes pa ni bsdus pa'o //
translated: And the benefits of morality.

original: 'dir sngon gyi mkhas pa chen po du ma'i lugs yod mod kyi 'on kyang skye bo chen po'i chos lugs shing rta chen po'i lam chen po yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir sngon gyi mkhas pa chen po du ma'i lugs yod mod kyi 'on kyang skye bo chen po'i chos lugs shing rta chen po'i lam chen po yin pas /
translated: Here there are many systems of the great scholars of the past. However, since the Dharma system of the great beings is the great path of the great charioteers,

original: slob dpon thogs med kyi lugs dang / rje btsun zhi ba lha'i lugs gnyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon thogs med kyi lugs dang / rje btsun zhi ba lha'i lugs gnyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain the systems of the masters Asanga and the venerable Śāntideva.

original: sdom pa len pa'i cho ga ni slob dpon thogs med kyis tshul khrims kyi le'ur rgyas par mdzad pa dang / yang na bdag gis byas pa'i cho gar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa len pa'i cho ga ni slob dpon thogs med kyis tshul khrims kyi le'ur rgyas par mdzad pa dang / yang na bdag gis byas pa'i cho gar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The ritual for taking the vow is set forth extensively in Asanga’s Chapter on Ethics or in the ritual I have composed.

original: slob dpon med pa'i cho ga yang tshul khrims kyi le'u de nyid na rgyas so //
analyzed: slob dpon med pa'i cho ga yang tshul khrims kyi le'u de nyid na rgyas so //
translated: The ritual without a master is also set forth extensively in that Chapter on Ethics.

original: bdag gis byas pa'i cho ga de ni 'phags pa thogs med kyi rjes su 'brangs ba'i yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa'i cho ga de ni 'phags pa thogs med kyi rjes su 'brangs ba'i yin no //
translated: The rite that I have composed is in accordance with that of the noble Asanga.

original: slob dpon zhi ba'i lhas ni cho ga 'di spyod pa la 'jug par yang mdzad mod kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba'i lhas ni cho ga 'di spyod pa la 'jug par yang mdzad mod kyi /
translated: The master Śāntideva also performs this rite in the Bodhicaryāvatāra.

original: bslab pa kun las btus par rgyas par mdzad do //
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus par rgyas par mdzad do //
translated: But he presents it in an extensive form in the Śikṣāsamuccaya.

original: slob dpon med pa'i cho ga yang de nyid du gsal bar mdzad do //🔽'dir bdag gis /
analyzed: slob dpon med pa'i cho ga yang de nyid du gsal bar mdzad do // 'dir bdag gis /
translated: And he also clearly presents the rite without a master in that same text.

original: de la 'bad pa 'di 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa 'di 'dra ba'i //
translated: Here I will present the rite without a master.

original: bla ma gal te ma rnyed na //🔽gzhan @265b la sdom pa nod pa yi //
analyzed: bla ma gal te ma rnyed na // gzhan @265b la sdom pa nod pa yi //
translated: If you cannot find such a guru🔽despite making efforts like this,🔽I will explain the rite for taking the vow

original: cho ga yang dag bshad par bya //🔽de la sngon tshe 'jam pa'i dbyangs //🔽zhes bya ba nas /🔽mi dge ba'i las rnams mi bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga yang dag bshad par bya // de la sngon tshe 'jam pa'i dbyangs // zhes bya ba nas / mi dge ba'i las rnams mi bya'o //
translated: from another person.

original: zhes pa'i bar 'dir bla ma med pa'i cho gar bkod de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar 'dir bla ma med pa'i cho gar bkod de /
translated: In that regard, the rite without a master is presented here from the lines beginning “In the past, Mañjuśrī” up to “Do not perform nonvirtuous actions.”

original: aam ba r'a dza'i cho ga 'di ni bla ma yod pa dang / bla ma med pa gnyis ka'i cho ga'i tshig yin no zhes bla ma dag gsung bas 'dir bla ma med pa'i cho gar bkod do //
analyzed: aam ba r'a dza'i cho ga 'di ni bla ma yod pa dang / bla ma med pa gnyis ka'i cho ga'i tshig yin no zhes bla ma dag gsung bas 'dir bla ma med pa'i cho gar bkod do //
translated: The gurus say that this is the ritual for those who do not have a guru.

original: bslab pa kun las btus par ni 'dis bla ma las blangs pa'i cho gar gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus par ni 'dis bla ma las blangs pa'i cho gar gsungs mod kyi /
translated: In the Compendium of Training, it is said that this is the ritual for taking the novice monk vows from a guru.

original: 'on kyang bdag ni lugs de gnyis ka'i rjes su 'brang bas na bla ma las blangs pa'i cho ga tshul khrims kyi le'u la brten zhing bkod la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag ni lugs de gnyis ka'i rjes su 'brang bas na bla ma las blangs pa'i cho ga tshul khrims kyi le'u la brten zhing bkod la /
translated: However, I follow both of these traditions, so I have arranged the ritual for taking the novice monk vows from a guru based on the chapter on ethics.

original: bla na med pa'i cho ga ni bslab pa kun las btus pa la brten zhing bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i cho ga ni bslab pa kun las btus pa la brten zhing bkod pa yin no //
translated: I have arranged the ritual for taking the unexcelled vows based on the Compendium of Training.

original: tshul khrims kyi rnam grangs ni 'phags pa thogs med kyi mdo sde ma lus pa ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i tshul khrims dgur bsdus te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rnam grangs ni 'phags pa thogs med kyi mdo sde ma lus pa ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i tshul khrims dgur bsdus te /
translated: With regard to the categories of ethics, the noble Asanga summarizes all the sutras in nine types of ethics, such as the ethics of the nature of reality.

original: tshul khrims kyi le'u de nyid las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni de tsam du zad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi le'u de nyid las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni de tsam du zad do //
translated: In the chapter on ethics, he says that the ethics of bodhisattvas is just that.

original: tshul khrims kyi bya ba yang de tsam du zad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bya ba yang de tsam du zad do //
translated: The practice of morality is just that.

original: tshul khrims kyi phan yon yang de tsam du zad do //🔽de las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phan yon yang de tsam du zad do // de las gong na yang med do //
translated: The benefits of morality are just that.🔽There is nothing higher than that.

original: de las lhag pa yang med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las lhag pa yang med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is nothing greater than that.

original: slob dpon zhi ba'i lhas ni mdo sde ma lus pa gang zag gsum gyi bslab pa mdzad de /
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba'i lhas ni mdo sde ma lus pa gang zag gsum gyi bslab pa mdzad de /
translated: Master Śāntideva has made the entire sūtra collection into the training of three persons:

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen po la goms pa che ba dang / goms pa 'bring dang / goms pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen po la goms pa che ba dang / goms pa 'bring dang / goms pa chung ba'o //
translated: those with great familiarity with the Mahāyāna, those with medium familiarity, and those with lesser familiarity.

original: goms pa che ba'i dbang du mdzad nas bslab pa kun las btus pa nas /
analyzed: goms pa che ba'i dbang du mdzad nas bslab pa kun las btus pa nas /
translated: With those of great familiarity in mind, the Compendium of Trainings says:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni //
translated: The bodhisattva vows

original: rgyas par theg pa che las 'byung ;
analyzed: rgyas par theg pa che las 'byung ;
translated: are extensive in the Mahāyāna.

original: / zhes 'byung ba dang / spyod 'jug las kyang /🔽rgyal sras rnams kyis mi bslab pa //
analyzed: / zhes 'byung ba dang / spyod 'jug las kyang / rgyal sras rnams kyis mi bslab pa //
translated: And Guide to the Bodhisattva Way of Life says:

original: 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no // zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is nothing whatsoever🔽that is not to be trained in by bodhisattvas.

original: bla ma dpal byang chub bzang po'i zhal nas kyang /
analyzed: bla ma dpal byang chub bzang po'i zhal nas kyang /
translated: Also, the guru, the glorious Jangchup Sempa, said:

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dngos su byung ba 'di dag ni mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dngos su byung ba 'di dag ni mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: Thus, these bases of training of the bodhisattvas are presented in brief.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dag gi bslab pa ni dpag tu med cing mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dag gi bslab pa ni dpag tu med cing mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the training of the bodhisattvas is immeasurable and limitless.

original: de dang de dag tu bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas nyes par 'gyur ba dang / nyes par mi 'gyur ba dag rig par bya'o zhes gsungs @266a * //
analyzed: de dang de dag tu bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas nyes par 'gyur ba dang / nyes par mi 'gyur ba dag rig par bya'o zhes gsungs @266a * //
translated: Therefore, following the teachings in this and that text, one should understand what is and is not a fault.

original: so ; ; de la goms pa 'bring po'i dbang du mdzad nas yang bslab pa kun las btus pa nas gang gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'i /
analyzed: so ; ; de la goms pa 'bring po'i dbang du mdzad nas yang bslab pa kun las btus pa nas gang gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'i /
translated: With regard to that, from the point of view of middling familiarity, the Śikṣāsamuccaya says:

original: gnad kyi gnas rnams 'dis rig bya //
analyzed: gnad kyi gnas rnams 'dis rig bya //
translated: By this, one should know the vital points🔽That do not cause downfalls.🔽My body and possessions,

original: bdag gi lus dang longs spyod dang // dus gsum skyes pa'i dge ba rnams //🔽sems can kun la btang ba dang // de bsrung dag pa spel ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang longs spyod dang // dus gsum skyes pa'i dge ba rnams // sems can kun la btang ba dang // de bsrung dag pa spel ba'o //
translated: And the virtues of the three times,🔽I give them all to sentient beings,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: And I protect, purify, and increase them.

original: goms pa chung ba'i dbang du mdzad na yang de nyid las de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar bslab pa rnams kyi nang nas bslab pa gang yang rung bsrung bar 'dod nas yi dam bca' bar byed do //
analyzed: goms pa chung ba'i dbang du mdzad na yang de nyid las de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar bslab pa rnams kyi nang nas bslab pa gang yang rung bsrung bar 'dod nas yi dam bca' bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, in the presence of a buddha or a bodhisattva, should take a vow to observe whatever training he can.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen med na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyan sngar rang gi nus pa dang sbyar nas sdom pa 'dzin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen med na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyan sngar rang gi nus pa dang sbyar nas sdom pa 'dzin no //
translated: If there is no spiritual teacher, he should take the vow in the presence of the image of a buddha or a bodhisattva, adjusting the ceremony to his own situation.

original: de bas na rang gi nus pa dang sbyar nas bslab pa gcig tsam yang yang dag par blangs la bsrung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi nus pa dang sbyar nas bslab pa gcig tsam yang yang dag par blangs la bsrung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, adjusting the ceremony to his own situation, he should take and observe at least one training precept.

original: de la sdom pa gtong ba'i rgyu ni 'phags pa thogs med kyi lugs kyis ni 'di ltar byang chub chen por smon lam btab pa btang ba dang / kun nas dkris pa chen pos pham pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la sdom pa gtong ba'i rgyu ni 'phags pa thogs med kyi lugs kyis ni 'di ltar byang chub chen por smon lam btab pa btang ba dang / kun nas dkris pa chen pos pham pa byung ba'o //
translated: As for the causes of losing the vow, in the tradition of the noble Asanga, there are two causes: giving up the aspiration for great enlightenment, and committing a pārājika offense with a great deal of mental affliction.

original: de la snga ma ni sems can gyi don la skyo ba dang / byang chub thag ring bar sems pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang phyir rol par smon pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la snga ma ni sems can gyi don la skyo ba dang / byang chub thag ring bar sems pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang phyir rol par smon pa skyes pa'o //
translated: The former is weariness with the aims of sentient beings, thinking that enlightenment is far off, and the arising of a wish for the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha vehicles and for the outsider tīrthikas.

original: de la phyi ma yang ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod par gyur cing de la 'gyod pa med par sems kyis btang ba dang / mi brda phrad pa'i drung du bslab pa'i gzhi phul ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyi ma yang ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod par gyur cing de la 'gyod pa med par sems kyis btang ba dang / mi brda phrad pa'i drung du bslab pa'i gzhi phul ba'o //
translated: The latter is shame and embarrassment, and the abandonment of those by the mind without regret, and the return of the bases of training to the presence of those who understand human languages.

original: slob dpon zhi ba lha'i lugs ni bslab pa kun las btus pa'i bdud kyi las gnod pa dang / dam pa'i chos mi 'dzin pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa bcu bzhi po rnams mi spong ba dang / yang na dran pa nyams pa dang le lo dang bag med pa dang ltung ba la mi mkhas pa dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba lha'i lugs ni bslab pa kun las btus pa'i bdud kyi las gnod pa dang / dam pa'i chos mi 'dzin pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa bcu bzhi po rnams mi spong ba dang / yang na dran pa nyams pa dang le lo dang bag med pa dang ltung ba la mi mkhas pa dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa'o //
translated: The system of the master Śāntideva is not to abandon the fourteen actions of Māra, such as not holding the true Dharma, and not to abandon the four faults of memory, laziness, carelessness, and not being skilled in downfalls, and not to abandon shamelessness and lack of embarrassment.

original: bla ma'i zhal nas ni bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la mi mkhas pa dang / dran pa med pa dang 'khrul pa dang ma gus pa'o zhes sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa las gsungs so //
