analyzed: bla ma'i zhal nas ni bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la mi mkhas pa dang / dran pa med pa dang 'khrul pa dang ma gus pa'o zhes sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa las gsungs so //
translated: The teacher says: “The causes of downfalls are lack of skill in the bases of training, lack of mindfulness, confusion, and lack of respect.”

original: de la ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: de la ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i rgyu ni /
translated: The causes of not committing a downfall are

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyi lugs ni 'di ltar shes bzhin dang dran pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa dang / nyes pa dang nyes pa med pa shes pa @266b dang ; ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyi lugs ni 'di ltar shes bzhin dang dran pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa dang / nyes pa dang nyes pa med pa shes pa @266b dang ; ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'o //
translated: as follows. The system of the noble Asanga is as follows: mindfulness, vigilance, effort, carefulness, knowledge of what is and is not a fault, shame, and embarrassment.🔽The master Śāntideva also says that these are common to both.

original: slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i yang de dag thun mong ba nyid las gnod pa bcu bzhis sel zhing spong ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i yang de dag thun mong ba nyid las gnod pa bcu bzhis sel zhing spong ba'o //
translated: He says that you avoid and eliminate downfalls through fourteen remedies.

original: slar gso ba dang / thog ma nyid nas 'gal bar mi byed pa ni 'gyod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: slar gso ba dang / thog ma nyid nas 'gal bar mi byed pa ni 'gyod pa med pa yin no //
translated: You restore your commitments and do not violate them from the beginning.

original: nyes pa la nyes par mthong na srab par byed la /
analyzed: nyes pa la nyes par mthong na srab par byed la /
translated: You see faults as faults and diminish them.

original: de nyid mthol zhing bshags na byang bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bla ma dag gsung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid mthol zhing bshags na byang bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bla ma dag gsung ngo //
translated: The gurus say that if you confess that very thing, you will be purified.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyi lugs kyis ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyi lugs kyis ni 'di ltar /
translated: In the system of the noble Asanga, it is like this.

original: ltung ba las ldang ba ni tshul khrims kyi le'u las gal te slob dpon du rung ba'i gang zag med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang kun nas dkris pa chen po'i pham pa byung na /
analyzed: ltung ba las ldang ba ni tshul khrims kyi le'u las gal te slob dpon du rung ba'i gang zag med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang kun nas dkris pa chen po'i pham pa byung na /
translated: With regard to rising from a downfall, the chapter on ethics says, “If there is no person suitable to be a preceptor,” and so forth, and “If a downfall due to a great entanglement occurs,

original: des dge 'dun gyi mdun du bshags la sdom pa slar mnod  par bya'o //🔽nyes byas ni nyan thos sam /
analyzed: des dge 'dun gyi mdun du bshags la sdom pa slar mnod  par bya'o // nyes byas ni nyan thos sam /
translated: then you should confess it in the presence of the community and take the vow again.”🔽With regard to a minor infraction, you should confess it to a hearer or

original: theg pa chen po gang yang rung ba la bshags so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po gang yang rung ba la bshags so //
translated: a follower of the Great Vehicle.🔽The master Śāntideva, in his Compendium of Trainings,

original: slob dpon zhi ba'i lhas ni bslab pa kun las btus par /🔽rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis gsungs tshul du ;
analyzed: slob dpon zhi ba'i lhas ni bslab pa kun las btus par / rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis gsungs tshul du ;
translated: says:

original: /'bad pa med na ngan song 'gro //🔽zhes pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: /'bad pa med na ngan song 'gro // zhes pa'i skabs su /
translated: If you do not strive in the way taught by the perfect Buddha, you will go to a miserable realm.

original: 'phags pa chos bzhi pa'i mdo'i don bshad pa'i skabs na gsal bar bkod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa chos bzhi pa'i mdo'i don bshad pa'i skabs na gsal bar bkod do //
translated: In the section on the meaning of the noble Sūtra on Four Qualities, he sets this forth clearly.

original: tshul khrims kyi phan yon ni ji skad du tshul khrims kyi le'u las de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po chen po 'di ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phan yon ni ji skad du tshul khrims kyi le'u las de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po chen po 'di ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu bskyed pa ste /
translated: Thus, this great aggregate of morality of the bodhisattva produces the fruit of great enlightenment.

original: 'di la brten nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di la brten nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: In dependence on it, having completed the perfection of morality, one attains manifest, supreme enlightenment.

original: ji srid sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du yang phan yon lnga thob par 'gyur te sangs rgyas kyis dgongs par 'gyur ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba chen po la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed pa dang / tshe phyi ma la yang chos mthun pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gnas pa der skye ba dang /
analyzed: ji srid sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du yang phan yon lnga thob par 'gyur te sangs rgyas kyis dgongs par 'gyur ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba chen po la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed pa dang / tshe phyi ma la yang chos mthun pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gnas pa der skye ba dang /
translated: And as long as one has not attained enlightenment, one obtains five benefits: one is considered by the buddhas, one dies in a state of great joy, one is born in one’s next life in a place where there are spiritual guides who are compatible with one’s own Dharma, one is born in a place where one can engage in the three types of morality, and one’s mind becomes fit for meditative concentration.

original: tshe 'di la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma yang rang 'khrungs kyi tshul khrims de dang de nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe 'di la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma yang rang 'khrungs kyi tshul khrims de dang de nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: And in this life, one will have immeasurable heaps of merit that perfect the perfection of morality. And in the next life, one will obtain just that very morality that one was born with.

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa nas kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa nas kyang 'di skad du /
translated: The Siksasamuccaya also says this:

original: deng sang gi dus na bslab pa bsrung ba ni shin tu phan yon che bas de la brtson par rigs so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: deng sang gi dus na bslab pa bsrung ba ni shin tu phan yon che bas de la brtson par rigs so zhes gsungs te /
translated: “In these present times, it is very beneficial to guard the trainings, so it is right to strive at them.”

original: de yang 'phags pa @267a * //
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa @267a * //
translated: And it cites the following scriptures:

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba dang / rab tu zhi ba cho 'phrul dang / zla ba sgron ma dang / dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo rnams der bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba dang / rab tu zhi ba cho 'phrul dang / zla ba sgron ma dang / dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo rnams der bkod pa yin no //
translated: the Āryaratnamegha, the Āryadharmasaṃgīti, the Āryapraśāntaviniścaya, the Candrapradīpa, and the Ratnamegha Sūtras.

original: bla ma'i zhes nas kyang de ltar na 'di ni de'i mod la ngan song du 'gro ba rnam bcad cing skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa dang / yang de ni ngan song du skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhes nas kyang de ltar na 'di ni de'i mod la ngan song du 'gro ba rnam bcad cing skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa dang / yang de ni ngan song du skye ba ma yin la /
translated: And he says that you will not be reborn in the miserable realms,

original: brgyal skyes na yang sdug bsngal drag po mi myong ba dang / myur du thar ba dang / der gnas pa na yang gzhan yongs su smin par byed do zhes sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: brgyal skyes na yang sdug bsngal drag po mi myong ba dang / myur du thar ba dang / der gnas pa na yang gzhan yongs su smin par byed do zhes sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa las gsungs so //
translated: and even if you are reborn there, you will not experience intense suffering, you will be quickly released, and while there, you will bring others to full maturity.

original: sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de la phan yon gzhan yod de /
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de la phan yon gzhan yod de /
translated: There are other benefits to taking the commitments.

original: 'phags pa tsan dra go mi'i zhal nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa tsan dra go mi'i zhal nas /
translated: Ārya Caṇḍragomin says:

original: de tshe de la dge ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de tshe de la dge ba'i phyir //
translated: At that time, because of that virtue,

original: sangs rgyas sras dang bcas rnams kyis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras dang bcas rnams kyis //
translated: the buddhas and their bodhisattva children

original: dge ba'i thugs kyis rtag par yang //
analyzed: dge ba'i thugs kyis rtag par yang //
translated: will always think of you with a virtuous mind

original: bu sdug 'dra bar dgongs par 'gyur //
analyzed: bu sdug 'dra bar dgongs par 'gyur //
translated: as if you were their beloved child.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang slob dpon zhi ba lta'i zhal nas kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang slob dpon zhi ba lta'i zhal nas kyang /
translated: And the master Śāntarakṣita says:

original: de ring sangs rgyas rigs su skyes //
analyzed: de ring sangs rgyas rigs su skyes //
translated: Today I am born into the Buddha’s family.

original: sangs rgyas sras su bdag gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras su bdag gyur to //
translated: I have become a child of the buddhas.

original: rigs dang mthun pa'i las brtsams te //
analyzed: rigs dang mthun pa'i las brtsams te //
translated: I will perform the actions that befit my family.

original: skyon med btsun pa'i rigs 'di la //
analyzed: skyon med btsun pa'i rigs 'di la //
translated: In this faultless, noble family

original: rnyog par mi 'gyur de ltar bya //🔽zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: rnyog par mi 'gyur de ltar bya // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: I will not cause any stain.

original: sdom pa blangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des tshul khrims bsrung zhing spel dgos pas /
analyzed: sdom pa blangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des tshul khrims bsrung zhing spel dgos pas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has taken the vow must guard and increase his discipline.

original: rang gi lus ngag sems ni rnam dag rgyu //
analyzed: rang gi lus ngag sems ni rnam dag rgyu //
translated: The cause for the purity of one’s body, speech, and mind🔽Is the engaged spirit of enlightenment,

original: 'jug pa'i sems kyis bdag nyid sdom gnas pas //🔽zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems kyis bdag nyid sdom gnas pas // zhes smras te /
translated: And by it one abides in the vows.

original: rang gi lus ngag sems ni rnam dag rgyu med de //
analyzed: rang gi lus ngag sems ni rnam dag rgyu med de //
translated: The cause for the purity of one’s body, speech, and mind is the engaged spirit of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje'i mdo las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje'i mdo las /
translated: As the Tathāgata’s Compassion Sūtra says,🔽“There is the purification of the body, the purification of speech, and the purification of mind.”

original: lus gtsang byed dang / ngag gtsang byed dang / yid gtsang byed do zhes gsungs pas sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis lus dang ngag gnyis dag par byed la /
analyzed: lus gtsang byed dang / ngag gtsang byed dang / yid gtsang byed do zhes gsungs pas sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis lus dang ngag gnyis dag par byed la /
translated: Thus, the ethics of restraint purifies the body and speech.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems dag par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems dag par byed do //
translated: The morality of gathering virtue and the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings purify the mind.

original: yang na tshul khrims re res kyang lus la sogs pa gsum ka dag par byed do //
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims re res kyang lus la sogs pa gsum ka dag par byed do //
translated: Or, each morality purifies the three, body and so on.

original: yang na srog gcod pa la sogs pa bdun spangs pas ni lus dang ngag dag par byed la /
analyzed: yang na srog gcod pa la sogs pa bdun spangs pas ni lus dang ngag dag par byed la /
translated: Or, abandoning the seven, killing and so on, purifies body and speech.

original: brnab sems la sogs pa gsum spangs pas ni sems dag par byed do //
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa gsum spangs pas ni sems dag par byed do //
translated: Abandoning the three, covetousness and so on, purifies the mind.

original: gzhan yang don 'di la dgongs nas mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang don 'di la dgongs nas mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, with this meaning in mind, the Sutra Requested by the King of the Kinnaras says:

original: chags @267b pa dang zhes sdang dang gti mug dang bral bas lus yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / bdag gi lha dkon mchog gsum la mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ngag yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba med pas sems yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chags @267b pa dang zhes sdang dang gti mug dang bral bas lus yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / bdag gi lha dkon mchog gsum la mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ngag yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba med pas sems yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since one is free of attachment, aversion, and ignorance, one has the morality of a pure body, the morality of a pure speech, which has the characteristic of not deceiving one’s own deity and the Three Jewels, and the morality of a pure mind, which is free of covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: de lta bu yin pas na tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la legs par slob par yang 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta bu yin pas na tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la legs par slob par yang 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since that is so, one will train well in the training of morality.

original: de la goms pa'i stobs kyis tshul khrims de la dga' ba dang spro ba dang 'dod pa dang de la brtson pa dang gus pa cher 'gyur ro zhes bsams nas smra ba ni /
analyzed: de la goms pa'i stobs kyis tshul khrims de la dga' ba dang spro ba dang 'dod pa dang de la brtson pa dang gus pa cher 'gyur ro zhes bsams nas smra ba ni /
translated: Thinking about that, one should say,

original: tshul khrims bslab pa gsum la legs bslabs nas //
analyzed: tshul khrims bslab pa gsum la legs bslabs nas //
translated: Having trained well in the three trainings of morality,

original: tshul khrims bslab pa gsum la gus cher 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims bslab pa gsum la gus cher 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One will have great respect for the three trainings of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gsum ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so//
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gsum ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so//
translated: The three trainings in morality are the morality of restraint, the morality of accumulating virtuous natures, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni bcas pa'i kha na ma thob srung ba'i so sor thar pa'i ris bdun gyi sdom pa dang / rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba srung ba'i mi dge ba bcu bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni bcas pa'i kha na ma thob srung ba'i so sor thar pa'i ris bdun gyi sdom pa dang / rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba srung ba'i mi dge ba bcu bsrung ba'o //
translated: The morality of restraint is the vow of the seven classes of individual liberation which protects against natural and proscribed offenses, and the protection of the ten virtues which protects against natural offenses.

original: de la dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu gang cung zad lus dang dag dang yid kyis byang chub kyi phyir dge ba bsags pa ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu gang cung zad lus dang dag dang yid kyis byang chub kyi phyir dge ba bsags pa ste /
translated: The morality of accumulating virtuous natures is whatever virtue is accumulated for the sake of enlightenment by means of body, speech, and mind, after having taken up the vow of restraint.

original: de yang khyad par du thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams la gcig tu dga' bas mngon par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de yang khyad par du thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams la gcig tu dga' bas mngon par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the application of delight in listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: de bzhin du dus su bla ma rnams la gsong por smra ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba dang zhes dang bcas pas kun du spyod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus su bla ma rnams la gsong por smra ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba dang zhes dang bcas pas kun du spyod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang /
translated: One should serve them, praise their good qualities,🔽rejoice in all their merits,🔽bear with their disparagement of others,🔽dedicate all one's virtues to enlightenment,🔽make various pure aspirations from time to time,

original: bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / gzhan gyis brnyas pa la bzod pa dang / dge ba thams cad byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / dus dus su yang dag pa'i smon lam dag sna tshogs pa 'debs pa dang / mchod pa'i rnam pa rgya chen pos dkon mchog gsum la mchod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / gzhan gyis brnyas pa la bzod pa dang / dge ba thams cad byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / dus dus su yang dag pa'i smon lam dag sna tshogs pa 'debs pa dang / mchod pa'i rnam pa rgya chen pos dkon mchog gsum la mchod par byed pa dang /
translated: and make offerings to the Three Jewels with vast offerings.🔽One should be diligent in virtue,🔽abandon heedlessness,🔽guard the bases of training with mindfulness and vigilance,

original: dge ba la brtson 'grus byed pa dang / bag med pa spangs pa dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bsrung ba dang / dbang po'i @268a * //
analyzed: dge ba la brtson 'grus byed pa dang / bag med pa spangs pa dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bsrung ba dang / dbang po'i @268a * //
translated: and control one's senses.

original: sgo bsdams pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar rjes su brtson pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / nyes pa dag shes shing mthong nas spang ba dang /
analyzed: sgo bsdams pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar rjes su brtson pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / nyes pa dag shes shing mthong nas spang ba dang /
translated: It is to be restrained in one’s actions, to know moderation in one’s food, to be diligent in the first and last periods of the night instead of sleeping, to rely on holy beings, to recognize and see faults and then to abandon them,

original: nyes pa chos bzhin du 'chags pa dang / de lta bu'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams srung ba dang spel ba ste /
analyzed: nyes pa chos bzhin du 'chags pa dang / de lta bu'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams srung ba dang spel ba ste /
translated: to confess faults in accordance with the Dharma, and to protect and increase virtuous qualities that are in harmony with that.

original: de ltar na dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims la gnas na dge ba'i chos kyi tshul shin tu bsdus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims la gnas na dge ba'i chos kyi tshul shin tu bsdus par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, if one abides in the discipline of gathering virtuous qualities, one will gather virtuous qualities well.

original: 'di 'dod pa'i longs spyod la lta ba cung zad tsam yang dang du len par mi byed na mang po lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'di 'dod pa'i longs spyod la lta ba cung zad tsam yang dang du len par mi byed na mang po lta ci smos /
translated: If one does not accept even a little bit of the enjoyments of the desire realm, what need is there to mention many?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is the ten perfections, the four means of gathering, and the four immeasurables.

original: byang chub kyi sems bcu'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bcu'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of the ten bodhisattva grounds.

original: sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims ni 'di la sems can gyi don bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims ni 'di la sems can gyi don bya ba yin te /
translated: One should work for the benefit of sentient beings in this world.

original: nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal can rnams la nad g-yog la sogs pa'i grogs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal can rnams la nad g-yog la sogs pa'i grogs byed pa yin no //
translated: One should help those who are suffering from disease and so on by nursing them and so forth.

original: long ba dag gi long khrid dang / 'on pa dag la lag brdas ston pa dang / rkang lag med pa dag khur ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa can dag gi de sel ba dang / gzhan gyis sma phab cing pham pa rnams de dag gi sdug bsngal sel ba dang /
analyzed: long ba dag gi long khrid dang / 'on pa dag la lag brdas ston pa dang / rkang lag med pa dag khur ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa can dag gi de sel ba dang / gzhan gyis sma phab cing pham pa rnams de dag gi sdug bsngal sel ba dang /
translated: One should guide the blind, make signs to the deaf, carry burdens for the crippled, dispel the lust of the lustful, and remove the suffering of those who are despised and defeated by others.

original: lam gyis ngal ba dag la bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / khang pa dag gis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: lam gyis ngal ba dag la bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / khang pa dag gis phan 'dogs so //
translated: One should help those who are tired on the road with food, drink, clothing, and shelter.

original: gso pa'i rig pas nad pa dag la zang zing med pa'i sems kyis mi skyo bar phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gso pa'i rig pas nad pa dag la zang zing med pa'i sems kyis mi skyo bar phan 'dogs so //
translated: One should help the sick with medical knowledge, without thought of material reward, and without getting discouraged.

original: mdor na sems can gyi sdug bsngal thams cad sel ba dang / de bsal bar sems bskyed pa dang / dge ba thams cad gzhan gyi don du bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na sems can gyi sdug bsngal thams cad sel ba dang / de bsal bar sems bskyed pa dang / dge ba thams cad gzhan gyi don du bsngo ba'o //
translated: In brief, it is the removal of all the sufferings of sentient beings, the generation of the thought to remove them, and the dedication of all virtue to the benefit of others.

original: 'di dag gi don rgyas par tshul khrims kyi le'u ru blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi don rgyas par tshul khrims kyi le'u ru blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of these should be understood in detail from the chapter on morality.

original: de lta bu tshul khrims kyi sdom pa rnam pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin pas tshogs de rdzogs par bya'o snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: de lta bu tshul khrims kyi sdom pa rnam pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin pas tshogs de rdzogs par bya'o snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Thus, one should think, “I will complete that collection by means of the three kinds of moral discipline, which are the collection of merit.”

original: de bas rnam dag rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: de bas rnam dag rdzogs byang chub //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva who is skilled in means,

original: sems dpa'i sdom pa'i sdom dag ni //🔽'bad pa byas pas rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: sems dpa'i sdom pa'i sdom dag ni // 'bad pa byas pas rdzogs byang chub //
translated: having taken up the vow of the bodhisattva,🔽completes the collection of merit

original: tshogs ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: tshogs ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: by striving for perfect enlightenment.

original: de bas na rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod cing de'i rgyu bsod nams rdzogs par 'dod na byang chub sems @268b dpa'i sdom pa 'bad pa dang rtsol ba byas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod cing de'i rgyu bsod nams rdzogs par 'dod na byang chub sems @268b dpa'i sdom pa 'bad pa dang rtsol ba byas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if one wishes to attain perfect enlightenment and to perfect the cause of merit, one should understand that by striving and exerting oneself in the Bodhisattva vow, the accumulation of merit will be perfected.

original: sdom pa'i sdom dag ni zhes ba ni 'phags pa thogs med kyi lugs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i lugs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i sdom dag ni zhes ba ni 'phags pa thogs med kyi lugs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i lugs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: The vow of the vow is the Bodhisattva vow of the system of the noble Asanga and the Bodhisattva vow of the system of the master Santaraksita.

original: de lta bu'i shing rta chen po'i lam gnyis la gnas nas 'bad pa dang / brtson par byas na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shing rta chen po'i lam gnyis la gnas nas 'bad pa dang / brtson par byas na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byas te /
translated: If one strives and exerts oneself in the two paths of such great charioteers, one will perfect the two accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhes bla ma dag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhes bla ma dag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One will attain perfect enlightenment. This is what the gurus have said.

original: bla ma'i zhal nas de lta bu'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gsum ni yang dag par blangs pa dang / rjes su bsrungs pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal nas de lta bu'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gsum ni yang dag par blangs pa dang / rjes su bsrungs pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
translated: The teacher said, “These three trainings in morality are virtuous because they are taken up correctly and then guarded, and they lead to the benefit and happiness of both oneself and others.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dpag tu med pa bsdus pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dpag tu med pa bsdus pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable because they include the bodhisattva’s immeasurable trainings.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: They are helpful because they accomplish the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu len par byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu che bar rig par bya'o zhes sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu len par byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu che bar rig par bya'o zhes sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa las gsungs so //
translated: You should know that they have a great result because they lead to the result of unsurpassed, complete, perfect enlightenment.”

original: de ltar bla ma dam pa las bslab pa de lta bu legs par bslangs shing /
analyzed: de ltar bla ma dam pa las bslab pa de lta bu legs par bslangs shing /
translated: Thus, having properly received these trainings from a holy teacher,

original: chos dang mthun par bsrung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi lam thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: chos dang mthun par bsrung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi lam thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'dod pa de ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas who wish to generate the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation on the path of accumulation in accordance with the Dharma should🔽

original: tshe rabs snga ma'i bag chags bzang po yod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma'i bag chags bzang po yod pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to generate the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, the path of the bodhisattva’s assembly that protects in accordance with the Dharma, has good habitual tendencies from previous lives.

original: mgon po byams pas dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: mgon po byams pas dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: The Lord Maitreya, in the Madhyāntavibhāga, says:🔽The ripened result is said to be a suitable vessel,

original: snod gyur rnam par smin brjod dang // de yi dbang gis stobs dang ni //
analyzed: snod gyur rnam par smin brjod dang // de yi dbang gis stobs dang ni //
translated: and by its power, strength,

original: 'dod dang 'phel dang rnam dag ste //
analyzed: 'dod dang 'phel dang rnam dag ste //
translated: desire, increase, and purity.

original: 'bras bu rnams ni go rims bzhin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams ni go rims bzhin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The results are in order.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sngon gyi skye ba dag tu dge ba la goms par bslabs pas tshe 'dir de'i snod du gyur pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sngon gyi skye ba dag tu dge ba la goms par bslabs pas tshe 'dir de'i snod du gyur pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, through training in the practice of virtue in previous lives, in this life becomes a suitable vessel for the practice of virtue. This is the ripened result.

original: de rnams 'dir byas pa'i stobs can du gyur pa ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'dir byas pa'i stobs can du gyur pa ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The power of those practices in this life is the dominant result.

original: de nyid la phyir zhing 'dun pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid la phyir zhing 'dun pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The desire for those practices again and again is the result that resembles the cause.

original: 'dir bslab pa dag mngon par 'phel @269a * //
analyzed: 'dir bslab pa dag mngon par 'phel @269a * //
translated: Here, the trainings are greatly increased.🔽

original: ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Here, the increase of the trainings is the human effort result.

original: de'i sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams dang bral ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams dang bral ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The freedom from the stains of the obscurations to that is the separation result.

original: 'dir bdag po'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa bzhi ni ris mthun pa'i 'bras bur bgrang gi 'di nyid la rdzogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bla ma mkhas pa chen po sh'an ti pas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir bdag po'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa bzhi ni ris mthun pa'i 'bras bur bgrang gi 'di nyid la rdzogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bla ma mkhas pa chen po sh'an ti pas gsungs so //
translated: Here, the four results excluding the dominant result are counted as the result of the homogeneous class, but they are not complete in this life. This was taught by the great scholar Shāntideva.🔽The great scholar master Āryadeva also says:

original: slob dpon mkhas pa chen po nor gyi rtsa lag gi zhal nas kyang byang chub sems dpas byang chub tu sems bskyed phan chad tshe rabs tshe rabs su /
analyzed: slob dpon mkhas pa chen po nor gyi rtsa lag gi zhal nas kyang byang chub sems dpas byang chub tu sems bskyed phan chad tshe rabs tshe rabs su /
translated: From the time a bodhisattva generates the Thought of Enlightenment, in lifetime after lifetime

original: bde 'gro rigs mtho skye dbang tshang //
analyzed: bde 'gro rigs mtho skye dbang tshang //
translated: he is born in the happy realms, of high caste, with complete faculties,🔽male, remembering his lifetimes, and irreversible.

original: phor gyur tshe rabs dran mi ldog / byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan pa'i don du sdug bsngal la mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: phor gyur tshe rabs dran mi ldog / byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan pa'i don du sdug bsngal la mi skyo ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is not discouraged by the suffering for the sake of helping sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten na zong gis ma nyos pa'i bran ni byang chub sems dpa' de yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten na zong gis ma nyos pa'i bran ni byang chub sems dpa' de yin pas /
translated: He is like a slave who is not bought with money, a bodhisattva.

original: bdag nyid chen po de la 'byor pa'i mchog khyad par can yod kyang des nga rgyal dang khengs par mi 'gyur bar snying rjes gzhan gyi dbang du gyur bas bdag nyid sems can thams cad kyi drung na khyi lta bu dang / bran lta bu dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po de la 'byor pa'i mchog khyad par can yod kyang des nga rgyal dang khengs par mi 'gyur bar snying rjes gzhan gyi dbang du gyur bas bdag nyid sems can thams cad kyi drung na khyi lta bu dang / bran lta bu dang /
translated: Although that great being has the most excellent wealth, he does not become proud or arrogant because of it. He is controlled by compassion. He is like a dog in the presence of all sentient beings. He is like a slave.

original: gdol pa lta bur nga rgyal bcag nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gdol pa lta bur nga rgyal bcag nas gnas pa ste /
translated: He lives having broken his pride, like a low-caste person.

original: gzhan gyis brnyas pa dang gnod par byas kyang bzod cing /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brnyas pa dang gnod par byas kyang bzod cing /
translated: Even if others despise him and do him harm, he is patient.

original: ngal ba dang brnags pa thams cad nyams su len pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ngal ba dang brnags pa thams cad nyams su len pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: He practices all the hardships and austerities.

original: de lta bu'i gang zag ni theg pa chen po pa yin par shes so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gang zag ni theg pa chen po pa yin par shes so //
translated: One should know that such a person is a follower of the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhan yang tshe rabs tshe rabs su byang chub kyi sems ma nyams pa'i rtags ni mdo las ji skad du de ngan song gsum spangs pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshe rabs tshe rabs su byang chub kyi sems ma nyams pa'i rtags ni mdo las ji skad du de ngan song gsum spangs pa yin //
translated: Moreover, the sutra mentions the signs of not losing the Thought of Enlightenment from lifetime to lifetime.

original: yul mtha' 'khob spangs pa yin /
analyzed: yul mtha' 'khob spangs pa yin /
translated: He has abandoned the three lower realms.

original: skyes bu dam pa yod pa'i sa phyogs su skye ba dang ; rigs mthon por skye ba yin /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa yod pa'i sa phyogs su skye ba dang ; rigs mthon por skye ba yin /
translated: One is born in a place where there are holy beings, and one is born into a high caste.

original: gzugs bzang ba yin /
analyzed: gzugs bzang ba yin /
translated: One has a good body.

original: shes rab che ba yin /
analyzed: shes rab che ba yin /
translated: One has great wisdom.

original: nad med pa yin /
analyzed: nad med pa yin /
translated: One is free from illness.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: One has compassion.

original: gzhan yang de mi khom pa brgyad spangs shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang de mi khom pa brgyad spangs shing /
translated: Moreover, one abandons the eight fetters and

original: khom pa'i yon tan bcu dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: khom pa'i yon tan bcu dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: has the ten virtues of leisure.

original: gzhan yang rtags ni de rang bzhin gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa yin te /🔽mdo las de ma bstan pa'i sbyin pa can yin zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtags ni de rang bzhin gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa yin te / mdo las de ma bstan pa'i sbyin pa can yin zhes pa nas /
translated: Moreover, one naturally has the six perfections:🔽The sūtras say that one has generosity that is not taught, and so on up to:🔽One has wisdom that is not taught.

original: de ma bstan pa'i shes rab can yin zhes pa'i bar dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs so / gzhan yang slob dpon zla grags kyi zhal nas /
analyzed: de ma bstan pa'i shes rab can yin zhes pa'i bar dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs so / gzhan yang slob dpon zla grags kyi zhal nas /
translated: The master Candrakīrti says:

original: so so skye bo'i dus na stong nyid @269b thos ;
analyzed: so so skye bo'i dus na stong nyid @269b thos ;
translated: When you are an ordinary being, you hear about emptiness

original: / nang gi dga' ba yang dang yang du 'byung //
analyzed: / nang gi dga' ba yang dang yang du 'byung //
translated: And you experience inner joy again and again.

original: dga' ba las byung mig ni mchi mas gang //
analyzed: dga' ba las byung mig ni mchi mas gang //
translated: From that joy, tears flow from your eyes.

original: lus kyi spu ldang ba yang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus kyi spu ldang ba yang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The hairs of the body stand on end.

original: gang yin de la byang chub sa bon yod //
analyzed: gang yin de la byang chub sa bon yod //
translated: In that person is the seed of enlightenment.

original: don dam bden pa de la bstan par bya //
analyzed: don dam bden pa de la bstan par bya //
translated: The ultimate truth should be taught to him.

original: der rtogs pa yi yon tan de las 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: der rtogs pa yi yon tan de las 'byung // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The qualities of realization arise from that.

original: slob dpon nor gyi rtsa lag gi zhal nas kyang bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon nor gyi rtsa lag gi zhal nas kyang bshad de /
translated: The master Dhanisthira says:

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni /
translated: The root of merit that is conducive to liberation

original: gang la bdag med pa'i gtam dang 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi gtam brjod pa thos na mchi ma 'khrug pa dang / spu zing byed pa de la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la bdag med pa'i gtam dang 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi gtam brjod pa thos na mchi ma 'khrug pa dang / spu zing byed pa de la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: is in the person who, when the teaching on selflessness, the faults of cyclic existence, and the virtues of nirvana is heard, weeps, and whose hairs stand on end.

original: dbyar myu gu skye ba las na sa gzhi'i gseb na de'i sa bon yod par shes pa bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbyar myu gu skye ba las na sa gzhi'i gseb na de'i sa bon yod par shes pa bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Just as from the arising of sprouts in the summer one knows that their seed is in the ground.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: Thus, the noble Descent into Lanka says,

original: du ba las ni mer shes shing ;
analyzed: du ba las ni mer shes shing ;
translated: From smoke one knows fire,

original: / chu skyar las ni chu bzhin du //
analyzed: / chu skyar las ni chu bzhin du //
translated: Just as the water is known from the water fowl,

original: blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: so the wise know the bodhisattva

original: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams las shes //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams las shes // zhes gsungs so //
translated: from the signs of his lineage.

original: de ltar sdom pa srung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa des dus thams cad du lus dang gnas dang longs spyod thams cad dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sdom pa srung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa des dus thams cad du lus dang gnas dang longs spyod thams cad dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is a beginner and who guards the vow should at all times know that all bodies, abodes, enjoyments, and all dharmas of samsara and nirvana are like a dream.

original: rmi lam lta bu'i dkon mchog gsum la rmi lam lta bu'i sri zhu bya ba dang / rmi lam lta bu'i 'khor ba la skyo bar bya ba dang / rmi lam lta bu'i sems can la rmi lam lta bu'i sems kyis snying rje bya ba dang ;
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i dkon mchog gsum la rmi lam lta bu'i sri zhu bya ba dang / rmi lam lta bu'i 'khor ba la skyo bar bya ba dang / rmi lam lta bu'i sems can la rmi lam lta bu'i sems kyis snying rje bya ba dang ;
translated: He should serve the Three Jewels which are like a dream with a service which is like a dream, he should be weary of samsara which is like a dream, he should have compassion for sentient beings who are like a dream with a mind which is like a dream,

original: rmi lam lta bu'i sems can mgu bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i sems can mgu bar bya ba'o //
translated: and he should please sentient beings who are like a dream with a mind which is like a dream.

original: sems can thams cad jo bor yid la bya ba dang / skye ba med pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems yid la bya ba dang / 'chi ba yid la bya ba dang / tshul khrims yid la bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad la ma chags pa'i yid la bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad jo bor yid la bya ba dang / skye ba med pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems yid la bya ba dang / 'chi ba yid la bya ba dang / tshul khrims yid la bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad la ma chags pa'i yid la bya ba dang /
translated: One should keep in mind the thought that all sentient beings are like one’s father and mother; the thought of non-arising; the thought of the Awakening Mind; the thought of death; the thought of moral discipline; the thought of non-attachment to any entity;

original: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bag yod pa dang / tshul bzhin du sems pa yid la bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bag yod pa dang / tshul bzhin du sems pa yid la bya'o //
translated: the thought of mindfulness, alertness, and carefulness; and the thought of proper reflection.

original: gzhan yang las dang po pa des dus thams cad du thabs la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang las dang po pa des dus thams cad du thabs la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the beginner should always be skilled in means.

original: 'di ltar bdag gi sdig pa gzhan gyi sdig phar byas te 'chags pa @270a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gi sdig pa gzhan gyi sdig phar byas te 'chags pa @270a * //
translated: In this way, one should confess one’s own evil deeds, and those of others, as well.

original: dang ; gzhan gyi sdig pa bdag gi sdig par byas te 'chags pa dang / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa bar byed pa dang gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bdag gir byed pa dang / bdag gi bde ba gzhan gyi bde bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dang ; gzhan gyi sdig pa bdag gi sdig par byas te 'chags pa dang / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa bar byed pa dang gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bdag gir byed pa dang / bdag gi bde ba gzhan gyi bde bar byed pa dang /
translated: transforming others' negative karma into one's own negative karma and confessing it, transforming one's own roots of virtue into others' roots of virtue, taking others' roots of virtue as one's own, transforming one's own happiness into others' happiness,

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gir byed pa dang / bdag gi sdug bsngal gyis gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba dang / gzhan dag bde ba mthong ba dang thos pa na de la yid dga' ba dang / gzhan dag sdug bsngal la thos sam mthong na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gir byed pa dang / bdag gi sdug bsngal gyis gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba dang / gzhan dag bde ba mthong ba dang thos pa na de la yid dga' ba dang / gzhan dag sdug bsngal la thos sam mthong na /
translated: taking others' suffering as one's own, dispelling others' suffering with one's own suffering, being delighted in one's mind when seeing or hearing of others' happiness,

original: ma la bdag gis nam zhig na 'di dag sdug bsngal las thar bar bya snyam du yid gdung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos la sems btang ba dang / gzhan gyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / grags pa snyan pa la phrag dog mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis nam zhig na 'di dag sdug bsngal las thar bar bya snyam du yid gdung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos la sems btang ba dang / gzhan gyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / grags pa snyan pa la phrag dog mi bya ba dang /
translated: and being tormented in one's mind, thinking, When will I free these from suffering? abandoning thoughts of worldly phenomena, not being jealous of others' gain, respect, fame, and praise,🔽and not being discouraged by others' faults.

original: bdag ni 'di ltar rigs dang / gzugs dang / 'khor dang yo byad dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa snyan pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes nga rgyal dang khengs pa med cing gzhan dman pa dag la brnyas par mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: bdag ni 'di ltar rigs dang / gzugs dang / 'khor dang yo byad dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa snyan pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes nga rgyal dang khengs pa med cing gzhan dman pa dag la brnyas par mi bya ba dang /
translated: I am of such a family, such a form, such a retinue, such possessions, such five sciences, such gain, such honor, such fame and renown.

original: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de gzhan dang thun mong du byas nas byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba dang / gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang pa dag dang thun mong du byas nas byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba dang /
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de gzhan dang thun mong du byas nas byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba dang / gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang pa dag dang thun mong du byas nas byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba dang /
translated: I dedicate to great enlightenment the roots of virtue that I have made common to all beings, and I dedicate to great enlightenment the roots of virtue of others that I have made common to all beings.

original: bdag gi sdig pa yang gzhan gyi sdig pa dang thun mong du byas nas so sor bshags pa dang / gzhan gyi sdig pa yang bdag dang thun mong du byas nas so sor bshags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sdig pa yang gzhan gyi sdig pa dang thun mong du byas nas so sor bshags pa dang / gzhan gyi sdig pa yang bdag dang thun mong du byas nas so sor bshags pa'o //
translated: I confess my own sins as common to all beings, and I confess the sins of others as common to myself.

original: gzhan yang de kun du spyod pa phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de kun du spyod pa phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, he is not mistaken in his practice.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
translated: The noble Cloud of Jewels says,

original: de za na /
analyzed: de za na /
translated: “When he eats,

original: de 'thung na /
analyzed: de 'thung na /
translated: when he drinks,

original: de 'gro na /
analyzed: de 'gro na /
translated: when he goes,

original: de nyal na /
analyzed: de nyal na /
translated: when he lies down,🔽when he lies on his right side, and so on.

original: de glo g-yas pas nyal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mdo de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de glo g-yas pas nyal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mdo de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should look at that sūtra.

original: gzhan yang de dam bca' ba phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dam bca' ba phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that is a correct vow,

original: sngon gyi rgyal po nam mkhas 'di skad du /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal po nam mkhas 'di skad du /
translated: because King A mara­megha said this:

original: di ring phan chad nam du yang //
analyzed: di ring phan chad nam du yang //
translated: From today onward,

original: bdag la 'dod chags sems byung na //
analyzed: bdag la 'dod chags sems byung na //
translated: if I ever give rise to a thought of desire,🔽I will have deceived all the buddhas

original: phyogs bcu dag na bzhugs pa yi //🔽sangs rgyas thams cad bslus par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag na bzhugs pa yi // sangs rgyas thams cad bslus par 'gyur //
translated: who reside in the ten directions.🔽I will not give rise to🔽a thought of anger,

original: tha ba'i sems dang gnod sems dang // phrag dog dang ni ser sna dang // di ring phan chad mi @270b bya'o ;
analyzed: tha ba'i sems dang gnod sems dang // phrag dog dang ni ser sna dang // di ring phan chad mi @270b bya'o ;
translated: envy, or stinginess.

original: / tshangs par spyod la gnas bgyi zhing //
analyzed: / tshangs par spyod la gnas bgyi zhing //
translated: I will abide in pure conduct,

original: sdig pa 'dod pa yongs su spang //🔽tshul khrims sdom dang des pa la //
analyzed: sdig pa 'dod pa yongs su spang // tshul khrims sdom dang des pa la //
translated: and give up desire for evil.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su bslab par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su bslab par bya //
translated: I will train in the Buddha’s way🔽of moral discipline, restraint, and gentleness.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las /
translated: And the noble Sūtra on Exhortation to Higher Intention says,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag deng slan chad de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar yi dam 'di lta bu bca' bar bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag gis deng slan chad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i gang zag gi ltung ba med pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag deng slan chad de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar yi dam 'di lta bu bca' bar bya'o // bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag gis deng slan chad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i gang zag gi ltung ba med pa yang rung ste /
translated: Blessed One, from now on we will make this kind of commitment in the presence of the Tathāgata.🔽Blessed One, if from now on we should mention the faults of a person in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, even if they are faults that do not exist, we will have deceived the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: glengs na bdag cag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bslus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: glengs na bdag cag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bslus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te mdo nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should read the sūtra itself to understand what it says.

original: gzhan yang de bsngo ba phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bsngo ba phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that dedication is unmistaken.

original: gser 'od dam pa'i bsngo ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyi yongs su bsngo ba chen po bcu dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs nyi shu pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa'i bsngo ba'i le'u la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gser 'od dam pa'i bsngo ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyi yongs su bsngo ba chen po bcu dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs nyi shu pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa'i bsngo ba'i le'u la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dedication of the Suvarna-prabhāsa-sūtra, the ten great dedications of the Bodhisattva Vajra-dhvaja, and the twenty-fold accumulation of merit by Nāgārjuna, and the chapter on dedication in the Bodhicaryāvatāra.

original: gzhan yang de smon lam phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de smon lam phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is a correct aspiration prayer.

original: 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa dang / 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i smon lam chen po bcu dang / bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya 'od kyi rgyal po'i smon lam chen po bcu gnyis dang / slob dpon rta dbyangs kyis mdzad pa'i smon lam bdun cu pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa dang / 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i smon lam chen po bcu dang / bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya 'od kyi rgyal po'i smon lam chen po bcu gnyis dang / slob dpon rta dbyangs kyis mdzad pa'i smon lam bdun cu pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great aspiration prayers of the ten grounds of the noble ones, the twelve great aspiration prayers of the Blessed Medicine Buddha King of Beryl Light, and the Aspiration in Seventy Verses composed by Ācārya Aśvaghoṣa, and so forth.

original: gzhan yang bla ma'i zhal nas byung ba'i mdo sde ma lus pa'i don bsdus pa pha dang ma lta bu dang / bu dang bu mo lta bu'i chos lnga bcu po rnams kyang skad cig skad cig la dran par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bla ma'i zhal nas byung ba'i mdo sde ma lus pa'i don bsdus pa pha dang ma lta bu dang / bu dang bu mo lta bu'i chos lnga bcu po rnams kyang skad cig skad cig la dran par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva should remember from moment to moment the fifty Dharma teachings that are like a father and mother and like a son and daughter, which are the essence of all the sūtras that have come from the mouth of the guru.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' des dus gcig la rtag tu mdo sde ma lus pa bklag par yang bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' des dus gcig la rtag tu mdo sde ma lus pa bklag par yang bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva should always read all the sūtras at one time.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las dang po pa gnyen po shas chung zhing rkyen la ltos pa yin pas mdo sde blta ba la brtson par bya'o //🔽gzhan yang mdo sde'i don ma lus par bsdus pa yin pas mdo kun las btus pa dang / bslab pa kun las btus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / tshul khrims kyi le'u dang / sdom pa nyi shu pa rnams kyang dus dus su @271a * //
analyzed: las dang po pa gnyen po shas chung zhing rkyen la ltos pa yin pas mdo sde blta ba la brtson par bya'o // gzhan yang mdo sde'i don ma lus par bsdus pa yin pas mdo kun las btus pa dang / bslab pa kun las btus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / tshul khrims kyi le'u dang / sdom pa nyi shu pa rnams kyang dus dus su @271a * //
translated: Because the beginner has little power of antidotes and depends on conditions, he should strive to read the sūtras.

original: blta ba dang / mnyan pa dang / bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: blta ba dang / mnyan pa dang / bri bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, because they are the essence of the meaning of the sūtras, the bodhisattva should from time to time read, listen to, and write the Compendium of the Sūtras, the Compendium of Trainings, the Bodhisattva’s Activity, the Chapter on Ethics, and the Twenty Verses on the Vows.

original: gzhan yang theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i don dang / sngon gyi slob dpon chen po rnams dang / da ltar gyi bla ma mkhas pa chen po rnams kyi dgongs pa yin pas bstan bcos 'di nyid kyang blta ba dang / mnyan pa dang / bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i don dang / sngon gyi slob dpon chen po rnams dang / da ltar gyi bla ma mkhas pa chen po rnams kyi dgongs pa yin pas bstan bcos 'di nyid kyang blta ba dang / mnyan pa dang / bri bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since this treatise is in accord with the meaning of the Mahāyāna sūtras, and is the intention of the great masters of the past and the great scholars of the present, you should study, listen to, and write it.

original: gzhan yang nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum phung po gsum pa gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum phung po gsum pa gdon par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, you should recite the Three Heaps three times during the day and three times at night.

original: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
translated: As it says in the Questions of Ugra Sūtra:

original: des nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du khrus byas te /
analyzed: des nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du khrus byas te /
translated: “Three times during the day and three times at night, you should bathe,🔽put on clean clothes, and recite the Three Heaps.”

original: gos gtsang ma bgos nas phung po gsum pa gdon par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: gos gtsang ma bgos nas phung po gsum pa gdon par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And as it says in the Noble Sūtra on the Non-Origination of All Phenomena:

original: nyin dang de bzhin mtshan mo lan gsum du //
analyzed: nyin dang de bzhin mtshan mo lan gsum du //
translated: Three times during the day and likewise during the night,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mgos phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mgos phyag 'tshal //
translated: bow your head to the bodhisattvas.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
translated: And as it says in the Noble Cloud of Jewels:

original: de ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du mchod par byed do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du mchod par byed do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Aryakalyanamitrasutra it is said:🔽“He confesses his sins day and night.”

original: des nyin mtshan du bshags pa byed do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal nas kyang /🔽byang chub sems dpa' myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang sdig pa so sor bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang /
analyzed: des nyin mtshan du bshags pa byed do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal nas kyang / byang chub sems dpa' myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang sdig pa so sor bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang /
translated: And the noble Asanga says:

original: gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba rnams kyang bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba rnams kyang bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The Bodhisattva who wishes to attain enlightenment quickly should make prostrations, offer worship, confess his sins, rejoice in his merits, request the Buddhas to teach, pray to them, and dedicate his merits, three times each day and three times each night.”

original: de dag gi phan yon yang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi mdo dang chos bshad pa brgya pa /
analyzed: de dag gi phan yon yang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi mdo dang chos bshad pa brgya pa /
translated: And the benefits of these practices are described in the noble Avalokana-sutra, the Dharmasamgitisutra, and the noble Akasagarbhasutra.

original: slob dpon dpa' bo'i rin po che phreng ba lta bu'i gtam dag tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dpa' bo'i rin po che phreng ba lta bu'i gtam dag tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should look at the discourse in the Precious Garland of Master Āryaśūra.

original: de yang 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i gzhung gis kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa'i gzhung gis kyang bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should do it with the text of the noble Sagaramati Sūtra.

original: yang na phung po gsum pa'i mdo nyid gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na phung po gsum pa'i mdo nyid gdon par bya'o //
translated: Or one should recite the very text of the Sūtra on the Three Heaps.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa thos pas brgyan pa des ni 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa 'di nyid la gnas nas bla ma'i zhal las 'byung ba'i gdams ngag gi cho ga rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa thos pas brgyan pa des ni 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa 'di nyid la gnas nas bla ma'i zhal las 'byung ba'i gdams ngag gi cho ga rgyas par bya'o //
translated: Or else, that wise and intelligent bodhisattva adorned with learning, having taken up this very noble Sagaramati Sūtra, should perform the extensive rite of instruction that comes from the guru’s mouth.

original: de bas na @271b slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i zhal nas /
analyzed: de bas na @271b slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i zhal nas /
translated: Therefore, as Master Śāntideva says in the Introduction to the Bodhisattva’s Way of Life:

original: nyin dang mtshan mo lan gsum du //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo lan gsum du //
translated: Three times a day and night

original: phung po gsum pa gdon par bya //
analyzed: phung po gsum pa gdon par bya //
translated: recite the Sūtra on the Three Heaps.

original: rgyal dang byang chub sems brten pas //
analyzed: rgyal dang byang chub sems brten pas //
translated: By relying on the buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: ltung ba'i lhag ma des zhi bya //🔽zhes spyod pa la 'jug pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: ltung ba'i lhag ma des zhi bya //🔽zhes spyod pa la 'jug pa las gsungs so //
translated: you will purify the remaining faults.

original: de lta bu'i cho ga de'i rjes la gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / ltung ba'i nyes pa so sor bshags la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i cho ga de'i rjes la gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / ltung ba'i nyes pa so sor bshags la /
translated: After such a ritual, one should go for refuge in the Three [Jewels], and individually confess the faults of downfalls.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis bskyed nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis bskyed nas /
translated: Then, one should generate the two aspects of bodhicitta,

original: bdag gis theg pa chen po'i mdo sde nas gsungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ma lus pa thams cad la bslab par bya'o zhes mos par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis theg pa chen po'i mdo sde nas gsungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ma lus pa thams cad la bslab par bya'o zhes mos par bya'o //
translated: and think, “I will train in all the bodhisattva trainings taught in the Mahayana sutras.”

original: de bas na de lta bu'i nyin dang mtshan du don med par mi gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba de ni phun sum tshogs pa gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i nyin dang mtshan du don med par mi gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba de ni phun sum tshogs pa gsum dang ldan te /
translated: Therefore, the yogi who does not remain in meaningless [activities] day and night in that way possesses the three perfections.

original: bla ma'i zhal nas 'di skad du phun sum tshogs pa gsum gyis bde ba la reg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal nas 'di skad du phun sum tshogs pa gsum gyis bde ba la reg par 'gyur te /
translated: The guru says, “One will touch bliss through the three perfections:

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba dang / bsam pa dang / sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba dang / bsam pa dang / sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of application, the perfection of intention, and the perfection of past causes.

original: de la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes pa rgyun du mi byed la sdig pa 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes pa rgyun du mi byed la sdig pa 'chags pa'o //
translated: The perfection of application is not continuously committing faults of body, speech, and mind, and confessing misdeeds.

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di ltar bdag chos kyi bsam pas yin gyi log par 'tsho ba la sogs pa chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di ltar bdag chos kyi bsam pas yin gyi log par 'tsho ba la sogs pa chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The perfection of intention is as follows: “I am practicing the Dharma, not for wrong livelihood, etc.,

original: bdag kyang byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag kyang byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba yin gyi /
translated: I am seeking great enlightenment,

original: 'jig rten pa'i bde ba don du gnyer ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bde ba don du gnyer ba ma yin /
translated: not worldly pleasures.

original: de la sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni des sngon gyi dus su bsod nams byas shing /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni des sngon gyi dus su bsod nams byas shing /
translated: The perfection of prior cause is that, in former lives, he has accumulated the roots of virtue of generosity, etc.

original: dge ba byas pas da ltar gos dang zas dang yo byad rnams kyis phongs par ma gyur pa yin zhing gzhan la yang bgo bsha' byed pa'i dang tshul can yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge ba byas pas da ltar gos dang zas dang yo byad rnams kyis phongs par ma gyur pa yin zhing gzhan la yang bgo bsha' byed pa'i dang tshul can yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The perfection of present conditions is that he is not lacking in the necessities of life, such as clothing, food, and bedding, and he shares them with others.

original: 'di ltar las dang po ba'i slob ma blo chung ba de dang po nyid nas lam la 'jug pa mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar las dang po ba'i slob ma blo chung ba de dang po nyid nas lam la 'jug pa mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, the beginner, the disciple of small mind, should not at first enter the path.

original: de la thog mar byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rgya chen po bkod pa'i mdo sde dang / bstan bcos thams cad bshad par bya zhing tshul de mkhas par byas nas /
analyzed: de la thog mar byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rgya chen po bkod pa'i mdo sde dang / bstan bcos thams cad bshad par bya zhing tshul de mkhas par byas nas /
translated: The gurus say that first of all one should explain all the sutras and treatises that set forth the vast bodhisattva trainings, and that one should become learned in that method.

original: gzod gang zag lam la 'jug pa'i cho ga bya'o zhes bla ma dag gsung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzod gang zag lam la 'jug pa'i cho ga bya'o zhes bla ma dag gsung ba yin no //
translated: Then, one should perform the rite of engaging the person in the path.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dkon mchog gsum gus yul la zhen pa spangs //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gus yul la zhen pa spangs //
translated: Abandon attachment to objects of respect, the Three Jewels.

original: 'chi ba rjes dran tshul khrims gtso bor byed //🔽bla ma la @272a * //
analyzed: 'chi ba rjes dran tshul khrims gtso bor byed // bla ma la @272a * //
translated: Remember death and make ethics primary.🔽Have faith and respect for the guru.

original: gus dad ldan g-yo sgyu med //
analyzed: gus dad ldan g-yo sgyu med //
translated: Be without deceit and guile.

original: sdig pa'i grogs spangs thun tshigs sbyor bar ldan //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs spangs thun tshigs sbyor bar ldan //
translated: Abandon sinful friends and be endowed with the practice of the sessions.

original: thun tshigs brug ba dum bu bco brgyad 'gyur //
analyzed: thun tshigs brug ba dum bu bco brgyad 'gyur //
translated: The sessions are divided into eighteen parts.

original: snga dro'i thun la dum bu gsum yod pa'i //
analyzed: snga dro'i thun la dum bu gsum yod pa'i //
translated: In the morning session there are three parts.

original: dum bu dang po dum bu bar pa la //
analyzed: dum bu dang po dum bu bar pa la //
translated: In the first part of the middle part

original: nyes pa byung ba dum bu tha ma der //
analyzed: nyes pa byung ba dum bu tha ma der //
translated: of the session,

original: byang chub sems brjed sems dpa' nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub sems brjed sems dpa' nyams par 'gyur //
translated: if one forgets bodhicitta, the bodhisattva vow will degenerate.

original: phyi ma lnga yang de yis bsgre bar bya //
analyzed: phyi ma lnga yang de yis bsgre bar bya //
translated: The latter five should be multiplied by that.

original: dum bu dum bur legs par gso byed pa //
analyzed: dum bu dum bur legs par gso byed pa //
translated: The best person is one who repairs them well,

original: skyes bu rab yin 'bring ni gnyis lags so //
analyzed: skyes bu rab yin 'bring ni gnyis lags so //
translated: piece by piece. The middling is one who does so in two parts.

original: dum bu tha mar gso ba tha ma ste //
analyzed: dum bu tha mar gso ba tha ma ste //
translated: The least is one who repairs them in one part.

original: rab kyi rab ni skad cig dang por gso //
analyzed: rab kyi rab ni skad cig dang por gso //
translated: The best of the best repairs them in the first moment.

original: rab kyi 'bring ni skad cig gnyis par gso //
analyzed: rab kyi 'bring ni skad cig gnyis par gso //
translated: The middling of the best repairs them in the second moment.

original: rab kyi tha ma skad cig tha mar gso //
analyzed: rab kyi tha ma skad cig tha mar gso //
translated: The least of the best repairs them in the last moment.

original: de ltar gyur pas skyes bu rab 'bring rgyu //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pas skyes bu rab 'bring rgyu //
translated: Since this is so, the best and middling persons are causes

original: phyi ma kun yang de yis bsgre bar bya //
analyzed: phyi ma kun yang de yis bsgre bar bya //
translated: for the future, and all of them should be multiplied by that.

original: bla ma mkhas pa chen po kha cig ni 'di skad du gsung ste /
analyzed: bla ma mkhas pa chen po kha cig ni 'di skad du gsung ste /
translated: Some great, wise gurus say the following:

original: nyes ba byung ba nyid kyi rjes la gso byed pa //🔽skyes bu rab yin skad cig gnyis pa sogs //
analyzed: nyes ba byung ba nyid kyi rjes la gso byed pa // skyes bu rab yin skad cig gnyis pa sogs //
translated: The best person is one who repairs them after the fault has arisen.

original: de yi rjes la gso ba 'bring po ste //
analyzed: de yi rjes la gso ba 'bring po ste //
translated: The middling is one who repairs them in the second moment and so on.

original: skyes bu thams dus tshigs drug por gso //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bu thams dus tshigs drug por gso // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The least is one who repairs them in the sixth moment.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bstan zin to /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bstan zin to /
translated: The training in superior discipline has now been presented.

original: // /'di ltar tshul khrims 'ba' zhig tsam gyis ni chog par ni mi bzung ste /
analyzed: // /'di ltar tshul khrims 'ba' zhig tsam gyis ni chog par ni mi bzung ste /
translated: You should not think that it is sufficient to have only the training in discipline.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag kyang bskyed dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag kyang bskyed dgos pa yin no //
translated: You should also develop meditative stabilization and wisdom.

original: 'on kyang tshul khrims la brten nas ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshul khrims la brten nas ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, meditative stabilization arises in dependence on morality.

original: 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: nyon mongs med pa'i ting 'dzin myur thob ste //
analyzed: nyon mongs med pa'i ting 'dzin myur thob ste //
translated: You quickly attain the meditative absorption of freedom from reactive emotions.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims rnam dag phan yon yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i zhal nas tshul khrims ni ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa yin te zhes pa dang / yang de bas na ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i sbyor ba gang ci yang rung ba de dag ni tshul khrims kyi nang du 'dus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims rnam dag phan yon yin // zhes gsungs so // slob dpon zhi ba'i lha'i zhal nas tshul khrims ni ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa yin te zhes pa dang / yang de bas na ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i sbyor ba gang ci yang rung ba de dag ni tshul khrims kyi nang du 'dus par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the benefit of pure morality.🔽The master Śāntideva says, “Morality is the basis for achieving meditative stabilization,” and “Therefore, whatever is a cause of meditative stabilization should be understood as included in morality.”

original: de bas na ting nge 'dzin don du gnyer bas dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi ngang tshul can du bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ting nge 'dzin don du gnyer bas dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi ngang tshul can du bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: And, “Therefore, those who seek meditative stabilization should be inclined toward mindfulness and introspection.”

original: yang tshul khrims don du gnyer bas kyang ting nge 'dzin la 'bad par bya ste zhes pa dang / yang tshul khrims don du gnyer ba gnyis gcig gis gcig 'phel bar byed pa 'di gnyis kyis sems yongs su sbyang ba @272b yongs su grub po zhes gsungs pas tshul khrims med pa'i ting nge 'dzin skye bar mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims don du gnyer bas kyang ting nge 'dzin la 'bad par bya ste zhes pa dang / yang tshul khrims don du gnyer ba gnyis gcig gis gcig 'phel bar byed pa 'di gnyis kyis sems yongs su sbyang ba @272b yongs su grub po zhes gsungs pas tshul khrims med pa'i ting nge 'dzin skye bar mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: By these two, the complete purification of the mind is accomplished.

original: de'i phyir tshul khrims la 'bad par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul khrims la 'bad par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one must strive for morality.

original: de bas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mngon par shes pa bskyed nas gzhan gyi don bya ba dang / tshogs rnam pa gnyis bsags pa'i thabs ni mngon par shes pa yin pas de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mngon par shes pa bskyed nas gzhan gyi don bya ba dang / tshogs rnam pa gnyis bsags pa'i thabs ni mngon par shes pa yin pas de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the method for gathering the two collections is superknowledge, in order to demonstrate that, the root text says:

original: bsod nams ye shes rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes rang bzhin gyi //
translated: The collections, which are the nature of merit and wisdom,

original: tshogs ni yongs su rdzogs pa yi //
analyzed: tshogs ni yongs su rdzogs pa yi //
translated: are completely perfected.

original: rgyu ni sangs rgyas thams cad dag / mngon shes bskyed pa nyid du bzhed //
analyzed: rgyu ni sangs rgyas thams cad dag / mngon shes bskyed pa nyid du bzhed //
translated: The cause is held to be the generation of the superknowledges of all the Buddhas.

original: ces bya ba de yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba de yin no //
translated: This is the verse.🔽One who wishes to gather the two stores,

original: tshogs gnyis bsag par 'dod pa dang // rtag tu gzhan don byed 'dod pas //
