translated: Thus, great perfect enlightenment depends on the two collections.

original: tshogs rnam pa gnyis kyang gzhan gyi don la rag las /
analyzed: tshogs rnam pa gnyis kyang gzhan gyi don la rag las /
translated: The two collections also depend on the welfare of others.

original: de yang mngon par shes pa yang zhi gnas la rag las /
analyzed: de yang mngon par shes pa yang zhi gnas la rag las /
translated: Moreover, the superknowledges depend on serenity.

original: zhi gnas kyang tshul khrims la rag las pas /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyang tshul khrims la rag las pas /
translated: Serenity depends on moral discipline.

original: dang po tshul khrims bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po tshul khrims bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, moral discipline is taught first.

original: de bas na tshul khrims las zhi gnas 'byung la /
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims las zhi gnas 'byung la /
translated: Thus, serenity arises from moral discipline.

original: zhi gnas las mngon par shes @274b pa 'byung bas /
analyzed: zhi gnas las mngon par shes @274b pa 'byung bas /
translated: And since the superknowledges arise from serenity,

original: mngon shes 'byung bar mi 'gyur la //🔽de phyir zhe gnas bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mngon shes 'byung bar mi 'gyur la // de phyir zhe gnas bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: the superknowledges will not arise🔽if serenity is not accomplished.🔽Therefore, strive again and again

original: yang dang yang du 'bad par bya //🔽zhes smras so //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'bad par bya // zhes smras so //
translated: to accomplish serenity.

original: mngon par shes pa ni 'di ltar lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni 'di ltar lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: The superknowledges are the superknowledge of the divine eye, the superknowledge of the divine ear, the superknowledge of knowing the minds of others, the superknowledge of recollecting former lives, the superknowledge of performing miracles,

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: and the superknowledge of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: de lta bu'i mngon par shes pa de dag zhi gnas las 'byung ba yin pas zhi gnas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mngon par shes pa de dag zhi gnas las 'byung ba yin pas zhi gnas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Since such supernormal powers arise from serenity, one must achieve serenity.

original: zhi gnas yan lag rnams nyams pas //
analyzed: zhi gnas yan lag rnams nyams pas //
translated: The nine factors beginning with the elimination of the five faults are the branches of serenity.

original: rab tu 'bad de bsgom byas shing //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad de bsgom byas shing //
translated: If one meditates with great effort

original: lo ni stong phrag dag gis kyang //
analyzed: lo ni stong phrag dag gis kyang //
translated: for thousands of years,

original: ting 'dzin 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting 'dzin 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one will not achieve concentration🔽if one's branches of serenity are impaired.

original: zhi gnas yan lag ces pa ni bla mas mdzad pa'i ting nge 'dzin tshogs kyi le'u'i spang bar bya ba la sogs pa dgu'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas yan lag ces pa ni bla mas mdzad pa'i ting nge 'dzin tshogs kyi le'u'i spang bar bya ba la sogs pa dgu'o //
translated: The branches of serenity are the nine factors beginning with the elimination of the five faults, as explained in the chapter on the requisites of concentration composed by my lama, the glorious venerable Jangchub Sangpo.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The other lines are easy to understand.

original: de bas na yan lag nyams na zhi gnas mi 'grub pa de'i phyir bdag gi bla ma rje btsun dpal byang chub bzang pos ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u las yan lag dgu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na yan lag nyams na zhi gnas mi 'grub pa de'i phyir bdag gi bla ma rje btsun dpal byang chub bzang pos ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u las yan lag dgu gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, if the branches are impaired, serenity will not be achieved.

original: 'di ltar spang bar bya ba dang / sngon du 'gro ba dang / ldog par bya ba dang / gdung ba gcad pa dang ; yid 'byung bar bya ba dang / yon tan rjes su dran par bya ba dang / brtson par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar spang bar bya ba dang / sngon du 'gro ba dang / ldog par bya ba dang / gdung ba gcad pa dang ; yid 'byung bar bya ba dang / yon tan rjes su dran par bya ba dang / brtson par bya ba dang /
translated: Thus, the eight branches are: that which is to be abandoned, that which is preliminary, that which is to be turned away from, that which is to be cut off, that which is to be made to arise, that which is to be remembered, that which is to be striven for,

original: 'brel bar bya ba dang / gnas pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel bar bya ba dang / gnas pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: and that which is to be connected.

original: de lta bu'i yan lag rnams shes par byas la de la legs par gnas par bya'o zhes bla ma gsung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yan lag rnams shes par byas la de la legs par gnas par bya'o zhes bla ma gsung ba yin no //
translated: Having understood those branches, one should abide well in them. This is what the guru has said.

original: de rnams kyi don ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of those should be seen in that very chapter on the equipment of concentration.

original: 'dir yan lag tha ma'i don cung zhig bri bar bya'o ste /
analyzed: 'dir yan lag tha ma'i don cung zhig bri bar bya'o ste /
translated: Here, I will write a little on the meaning of the last branch.

original: bla ma'i zhal nas ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u las 'di skad du /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal nas ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u las 'di skad du /
translated: From the guru's mouth, in the chapter on the equipment of concentration, it is said:

original: de ltar yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa des /
analyzed: de ltar yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa des /
translated: Thus, one who has the eight branches

original: gnas rjes su mthun par kha zas dang spyod lam rjes su mthun pa dang gos dang grogs rjes su mthun pa dang ldan par byas la /
analyzed: gnas rjes su mthun par kha zas dang spyod lam rjes su mthun pa dang gos dang grogs rjes su mthun pa dang ldan par byas la /
translated: One should be in a place that is suitable, with suitable food, suitable conduct, suitable clothes, and suitable friends.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag par bya'o zhes pa dang / yang gsungs pa des mnyam par ma bzhag pa na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bklag pa dang / tsha tsha dang / bskor ba la sogs pa bsod @275a * //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag par bya'o zhes pa dang / yang gsungs pa des mnyam par ma bzhag pa na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bklag pa dang / tsha tsha dang / bskor ba la sogs pa bsod @275a * //
translated: And it is also said, When one is not in meditative equipoise, one should exert oneself in the accumulation of merit by reading the perfection of wisdom, by making images, by circumambulation, and so forth.

original: nams kyi tshogs la 'bad par bya'o zhes pa dang / yang gsungs pa sems mnyam par 'jog 'dod pa des spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: nams kyi tshogs la 'bad par bya'o zhes pa dang / yang gsungs pa sems mnyam par 'jog 'dod pa des spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom par bya ste /
translated: And it is also said, The one who wishes to place the mind in meditative equipoise should cultivate the eight applications of abandonment.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i chos ni 'di dag go //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i chos ni 'di dag go //
translated: These are the antidotes to the five faults.🔽The five faults are laziness,

original: nyes pa lnga ni le lo dang // gdams ngag brjed dang bying dang rgod ;
analyzed: nyes pa lnga ni le lo dang // gdams ngag brjed dang bying dang rgod ;
translated: forgetting the instruction, laxity and excitement,🔽nonapplication, and application.

original: /'du mi byed dang 'du byed dang // 'di dag nyes pa lngar 'dod do //
analyzed: /'du mi byed dang 'du byed dang // 'di dag nyes pa lngar 'dod do //
translated: These are asserted to be the five faults.

original: de dag gi gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dag kyang /
translated: The eight applications of abandonment that are their antidotes are as follows.

original: gnas dang de la gnas pa dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnas dang de la gnas pa dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du'o //
translated: The cause, and the result.🔽Not forgetting the object of meditation,🔽Recognizing laxity and excitation,🔽Actively engaging in their abandonment,

original: dmigs pa brjed par ma gyur dang // bying dang rgod pa rtogs pa dang // de spong mngon par 'du byed dang // zhi tshe rnal du 'jug pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa brjed par ma gyur dang // bying dang rgod pa rtogs pa dang // de spong mngon par 'du byed dang // zhi tshe rnal du 'jug pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: And inwardly stabilizing when they are pacified.

original: mdo sde rgyan las kyang /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las kyang /
translated: The Ornament for the Mahāyāna Sūtras also says:

original: gcig ni 'bad par byed pa ste //
analyzed: gcig ni 'bad par byed pa ste //
translated: One is the one that makes effort.

original: gnyis pa phan 'dogs bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: gnyis pa phan 'dogs bdag nyid yin //
translated: The second is the one that is helpful.

original: gsum pa gtong bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: gsum pa gtong bar byed pa ste //
translated: The third is the one that lets go.

original: bzhi pa gnyen po nyid yin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa gnyen po nyid yin no // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The fourth is the antidote.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: It also says:🔽Desire for objects, malice,🔽lethargy, sleep, excitation,

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: and regret, and doubt.

original: de la rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi 'khor ni /
analyzed: de la rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi 'khor ni /
translated: Lethargy and sleep are a retinue of lethargy.🔽They are lassitude, unhappiness, yawning, overeating,

original: rmya ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / bya rmyangs dang / zas kyi tshod ma zin pa dang / sems zhum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rmya ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / bya rmyangs dang / zas kyi tshod ma zin pa dang / sems zhum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and mental sinking.

original: las ni sems zhum par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las ni sems zhum par byed pa'o //
translated: Their function is to cause mental sinking.

original: gnyen po ni snang ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: gnyen po ni snang ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote is the perception of light.

original: rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i 'khor ni nye du'i rtog pa dang / sngon dgod pa dang / dga' ba dang / rtses pa dag rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i 'khor ni nye du'i rtog pa dang / sngon dgod pa dang / dga' ba dang / rtses pa dag rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The retinue of agitation and regret is the thought of relatives and the recollection of former laughter, joy, and play.

original: las ni sems ma zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: las ni sems ma zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: The function is to disturb the mind.

original: gnyen po ni zhi gnas so //🔽dmigs pa gang rung cig dag la //
analyzed: gnyen po ni zhi gnas so // dmigs pa gang rung cig dag la //
translated: The antidote is calm abiding.🔽The mind should be placed on virtue

original: yid ni dge la gzhag par bya //
analyzed: yid ni dge la gzhag par bya //
translated: with regard to any of the meditative objects.

original: dmigs pa ni sems kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni sems kyi yul yin te /
translated: The meditative object is the domain of the mind.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dbu ma rtog ge 'bar ba las //
analyzed: dbu ma rtog ge 'bar ba las //
translated: In the Madhyamaka-tarka-jvālā

original: yid kyi glang po log g-yo ba //🔽dmigs pa'i ka ba brtan po la //
analyzed: yid kyi glang po log g-yo ba // dmigs pa'i ka ba brtan po la //
translated: The elephant of the mind is unsteady.🔽It is tied with the rope of mindfulness

original: dran pa'i thag pas nges bcings te //
analyzed: dran pa'i thag pas nges bcings te //
translated: to the firm pillar of the meditative object

original: sems ni zhi la gzhag par bya //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems ni zhi la gzhag par bya // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and the mind is placed in peace.

original: gang rung cig dag la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang rung cig dag la zhes pa ni /
translated: With regard to any of the meditative objects,

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas dang / mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas dang / mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas so //
translated: there is calm abiding with signs and calm abiding without signs.

original: de yang bla ma'i zhal snga nas ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u las 'di skad @275b du 'dir zhi gnas ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang bla ma'i zhal snga nas ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u las 'di skad @275b du 'dir zhi gnas ni gnyis te /
translated: Here, meditative serenity is twofold:

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: (1) that possessed of signs and (2) that devoid of signs.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa la gnyis te /
translated: The one possessed of signs is twofold:

original: kha nang du bltas pa dang / kha phyir bltas pa'o //
analyzed: kha nang du bltas pa dang / kha phyir bltas pa'o //
translated: (1) that which observes an internal object and (2) that which observes an external object.

original: nang du bltas pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: nang du bltas pa la gnyis te /
translated: The one that observes an internal object is twofold:

original: lus la dmigs pa dang / lus la brten pa la dmigs pa'o ;
analyzed: lus la dmigs pa dang / lus la brten pa la dmigs pa'o ;
translated: (1) that which observes the body and (2) that which observes what is based on the body.

original: / lus la dmigs pa la gsum ste /
analyzed: / lus la dmigs pa la gsum ste /
translated: The one that observes the body is threefold:

original: lus nyid lha'i rnam par dmigs pa dang / keng rus la sogs pa la mi sdug pa'i rnam par dmigs pa dang / kha tv'am ga la sogs pa mtshan ma khyad par can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus nyid lha'i rnam par dmigs pa dang / keng rus la sogs pa la mi sdug pa'i rnam par dmigs pa dang / kha tv'am ga la sogs pa mtshan ma khyad par can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: (1) that which observes the body as a deity's body, (2) that which observes the body as repulsive, such as a skeleton, and (3) that which observes special signs, such as the vowels and consonants.

original: lus la brten pa la lnga ste /
analyzed: lus la brten pa la lnga ste /
translated: The one that observes what is based on the body is fivefold:🔽(1) that which observes the breath, (2) that which observes bindu, (3) that which observes light, (4) that which observes the form of the deity, and (5) that which observes the hand implements.

original: dbugs la dmigs pa dang / mtshan ma phra mo la dmigs pa dang / thig le la dmigs pa dang / 'od zer gyi yan lag la dmigs pa dang / dga' ba dang bde ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs la dmigs pa dang / mtshan ma phra mo la dmigs pa dang / thig le la dmigs pa dang / 'od zer gyi yan lag la dmigs pa dang / dga' ba dang bde ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of meditation is the breath, subtle symbols, drops, light rays, joy and bliss.

original: kha phyir bltas pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: kha phyir bltas pa la gnyis te /
translated: The outward-looking object of meditation is twofold:

original: khyad par can dang / phal pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can dang / phal pa'o //
translated: the special and the ordinary.

original: khyad par can la gnyis te /
analyzed: khyad par can la gnyis te /
translated: The special object of meditation is twofold:

original: sku la dmigs pa dang / gsung la dmigs pa'o //🔽'di dag ni zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i yan lag go zhes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas ni /
analyzed: sku la dmigs pa dang / gsung la dmigs pa'o // 'di dag ni zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i yan lag go zhes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas ni /
translated: the body and speech of the deity.🔽These are the branches of engaging in serenity.🔽The same text says that the serenity of the absence of signs is as follows:

original: yang de nyid las mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas so sor rtog pa'i shes rab nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas so sor rtog pa'i shes rab nyid las /
translated: The serenity of the absence of signs is the wisdom of discernment itself.

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i lhag mthong rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung zhes te zhes pa dang / yang de nyid las mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas la brten pa pas ni mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas la dmigs nas lhag mthong skyes pa'i phyogs 'di bsngags te /🔽de la gnas pa brtan pa dang / zhi gnas 'ba' zhig gis nyon mongs pa sel ba dang / rab tu gnon par 'gyur bas de ni 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //🔽yang de nyid las ji lta bsgom pa ni 'dir mi brjod de gzhung mngas pa'i 'jigs pa dang / bla ma dam pas nyams su myong ba'i man ngag la brten par rigs kyi /

original: bsgom pa'i man ngag ni yi ger gnas pas shes par dka' ba'i phyir dang / zhib tu ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan pa las bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i man ngag ni yi ger gnas pas shes par dka' ba'i phyir dang / zhib tu ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan pa las bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The esoteric instructions for meditation are difficult to understand because they are set down in writing, and they are explained in detail in the instructions on serenity and insight.🔽Thus my guru has said.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas zhi gnas grub par gyur nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas zhi gnas grub par gyur nas /
translated: When a practitioner has achieved serenity in this way,

original: @276a * // sngar bshad pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga po dag 'grub par 'gyur ba la the tshom med do zhes bla ma gsung ngo //
analyzed: @276a * // sngar bshad pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga po dag 'grub par 'gyur ba la the tshom med do zhes bla ma gsung ngo //
translated: there is no doubt that he will achieve the five superknowledges explained above.

original: gzhan yang mngon par shes pa bskyed pa'i thabs su gyur ba 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyis zhus pa'i chos bdun pa'i mdo las 'byung ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi de dag kyang nyams su blang bar bya ba dang / mdo de nyid kyang dus dus su kha ton du gdon par yang bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par shes pa bskyed pa'i thabs su gyur ba 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyis zhus pa'i chos bdun pa'i mdo las 'byung ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi de dag kyang nyams su blang bar bya ba dang / mdo de nyid kyang dus dus su kha ton du gdon par yang bya'o //
translated: Moreover, you should practice the bases of training that are taught in the Sutra of the Questions of Avalokitdvara on the Seven Qualities, which is a method for generating the superknowledges, and you should recite that sutra from time to time.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa myur du thob par 'dod pas nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa myur du thob par 'dod pas nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang /
translated: The noble Asanga also says:🔽The bodhisattva who wishes to quickly attain the superknowledges should strive in prostration, offering, confession, rejoicing, requesting,

original: gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba la brtson par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba la brtson par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: beseeching, and dedicating, three times each day and three times each night.

original: gzhan yang 'dod pa chung ba dang chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang rang tu dben pa la sogs pa zhi gnas kyi tshogs thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod pa chung ba dang chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang rang tu dben pa la sogs pa zhi gnas kyi tshogs thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he should have all the prerequisites for śamatha, such as few desires, contentment, ease of support, and solitude.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa zhi gnas la legs par gnas pa ni 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa zhi gnas la legs par gnas pa ni 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes par 'gyur te /
translated: The yogi who is well-established in śamatha in this way will have few desires and be content.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya ba las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya ba las /
translated: As it says in the noble Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas:

original: dge slong bsam gtan la sems cung zhig blan pa rnams ni gos kyi 'du shes chung ba yin /
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan la sems cung zhig blan pa rnams ni gos kyi 'du shes chung ba yin /
translated: Monks who have a little mastery of concentration have little perception of clothing.

original: zas kyi 'du shes chung ba dang / pags pa'i mdog snum pa yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zas kyi 'du shes chung ba dang / pags pa'i mdog snum pa yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: They have little perception of food and their skin has a shiny color.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor ba de ni 'jig rten pa'i nor la zhen pa spangs nas 'phags pa'i nor bdun la 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor ba de ni 'jig rten pa'i nor la zhen pa spangs nas 'phags pa'i nor bdun la 'bad par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva yogi/nī, having abandoned attachment to worldly wealth, strives for the seven noble riches.

original: de rjes su dran pa drug yid la byed do //
analyzed: de rjes su dran pa drug yid la byed do //
translated: He/she brings to mind the six recollections.

original: drug las kyang re zhig sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rjes su dran par byed do //
analyzed: drug las kyang re zhig sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rjes su dran par byed do //
translated: From among the six, he/she first brings to mind the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: dbang po rnon po dang / dbang po rtul po'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dang / dbang po rtul po'i dbye bas so //
translated: This is because of the distinction between those with sharp faculties and those with dull faculties.

original: dbang po rnon pos rjes su dran par bya ba ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mdo dang / 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo dang / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo la sogs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon pos rjes su dran par bya ba ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mdo dang / 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo dang / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo la sogs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those of sharp faculties should look at the following sutras: the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutras, the noble Buddha-Remembrance Sutra, the noble Sky Treasury Sutra, the noble Aksayamati Sutra, and so on.

original: de la dbang po rtul pos rjes su dran par bya ba ni 'phags pa dad pa'i @276b stobs bskyed pa'i mdo dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas bgro ba dang / chos bgro ba dang / dge 'dun bgro ba'i mdo dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mdo de nyid dang /
analyzed: de la dbang po rtul pos rjes su dran par bya ba ni 'phags pa dad pa'i @276b stobs bskyed pa'i mdo dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas bgro ba dang / chos bgro ba dang / dge 'dun bgro ba'i mdo dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mdo de nyid dang /
translated: Those of dull faculties should look at the noble Sutra on Generating the Power of Faith, the noble Sutra on the Recitation of the Buddha, the Recitation of the Dharma, and the Recitation of the Sangha, the noble Buddha-Remembrance Sutra,

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mdo chung ba dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde gzhan du yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mdo chung ba dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde gzhan du yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: and the Short Sutra on the Remembrance of the Buddha, and also at other Mahayana sutras.

original: gzhan yang mdo'i dgongs pa 'chad pa yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo'i dgongs pa 'chad pa yin pas /
translated: Moreover, since I am explaining the intention of the sutras,

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa'i dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa'i skabs su yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa'i dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa'i skabs su yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the chapter on the Three Jewels in the Compendium of Trainings.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa de la lhag mthong yang skye par 'gyur te 'di'i don 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa de la lhag mthong yang skye par 'gyur te 'di'i don 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Such a yogin will also develop insight, the meaning of which will be explained below.

original: de bas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la rnal 'byor du byed pa ni lam la gnas pa zhes bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: de bas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la rnal 'byor du byed pa ni lam la gnas pa zhes bya ba yin pas /
translated: Thus, one who practices yoga in serenity and insight is said to abide in the path.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang ; 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams la rim gyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang ; 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams la rim gyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will then abide in the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa bstan zin to //
translated: The training in the higher mind has been explained.

original: da ni thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel par shes pa'i shes rab kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shis kyi tshogs gnyis zung du 'brel bar rdzogs par bya'o snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: da ni thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel par shes pa'i shes rab kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shis kyi tshogs gnyis zung du 'brel bar rdzogs par bya'o snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Now, thinking that one should complete the two collections of merit and wisdom in union by means of the wisdom that knows the union of method and wisdom,

original: shes rab pha rol phyin sbyor dang // bral bas sgrib pa zad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin sbyor dang // bral bas sgrib pa zad mi 'gyur //
translated: and that obscurations will not be exhausted without the union of method and wisdom,🔽one should think as follows.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is said:🔽“Without the union of method and wisdom, obscurations will not be exhausted.”

original: zhi gnas kyis ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / chos kyi sgrib pa la sogs pa spong par mi nus te /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyis ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / chos kyi sgrib pa la sogs pa spong par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, śamatha alone is not able to eliminate the obscurations of karma, afflictions, ripening, and phenomena, and so on.

original: lhag mthong gis de dag spangs nas zad par 'gyur bas lhag mthong brten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis de dag spangs nas zad par 'gyur bas lhag mthong brten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: However, since they are eliminated and exhausted by vipaśyanā, one should rely on vipaśyanā.

original: da ni thabs dang shes rab rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni thabs dang shes rab rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, method and wisdom will be explained in detail.

original: gang phyir bcings pa zhes gsungs pas zhes pa ni 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri'i mdo dang / 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las thabs dang bral ba'i shes rab ni 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: gang phyir bcings pa zhes gsungs pas zhes pa ni 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri'i mdo dang / 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las thabs dang bral ba'i shes rab ni 'ching ba'o //
translated: Because it is said to be bondage.🔽This is from the Sublime Gaya Peak Scripture and the Sublime Scripture of Vimalakirti, which say that wisdom without skillful means is bondage.

original: shes rab dang bral ba'i thabs kyang 'ching ba'o zhes gsungs so //🔽de bas gnyis ka spang mi bya //
analyzed: shes rab dang bral ba'i thabs kyang 'ching ba'o zhes gsungs so // de bas gnyis ka spang mi bya //
translated: The passage because it is said to be bondage refers to the noble Gayasirsha sutra and the noble Vimalakirti sutra, which say that wisdom without means is bondage, and that means without wisdom is bondage.

original: zhes pa ni /🔽dpal ye shes grags pa'i zhal nas 'di skad du /🔽shes rab kyi @277a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni / dpal ye shes grags pa'i zhal nas 'di skad du / shes rab kyi @277a * //
translated: Therefore, it says therefore, both should not be abandoned.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: This is what the glorious Jnanakirti said: The essence of the perfection of wisdom is the practice of the means, such as generosity.

original: de yang 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri las gnyis po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri las gnyis po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: And the noble Gayasirsha sutra says, These two are the concise path of the bodhisattva.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: thabs dang shes rab po zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab po zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: means and wisdom.

original: thabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dang de la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba ste /
analyzed: thabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dang de la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba ste /
translated: The means is the divisions of the perfections such as generosity, the immeasurables, the means of gathering disciples, and so forth.

original: de nyid kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa dang / dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa'i mdo las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa dang / dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa'i mdo las gsungs pa'o //
translated: That is also taught in the Akṣayamati, Ratnamegha, and other sūtras.

original: shes rab ni thabs de phyin ci ma log par yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni thabs de phyin ci ma log par yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Wisdom is the cause of unmistakenly discerning that means.

original: des kyang thabs yang dag par brtags nas /🔽phyin ci ma log pas /
analyzed: des kyang thabs yang dag par brtags nas / phyin ci ma log pas /
translated: Also, having examined the means,🔽one practices for one's own and others' aims without error.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su len pas sngags kyis zin pa'i dug dang 'dra bas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de yang mdo sde de nyid las thabs ni bsdu ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su len pas sngags kyis zin pa'i dug dang 'dra bas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro // de yang mdo sde de nyid las thabs ni bsdu ba shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, like poison held by a mantra, one does not become afflicted.🔽Also, that sūtra says, “The means is knowing how to gather.🔽Wisdom is knowing how to discern.”

original: shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa shes pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa shes pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the Ārya-śraddhābalādhāna-sūtra says,

original: thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is skill in means?

original: gang chos thams cad kyi bsdu ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi bsdu ba shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the inclusion of all phenomena.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: gang chos thams cad dbyer med par shes pa la mkhas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad dbyer med par shes pa la mkhas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the skill in knowing the indivisibility of all phenomena.

original: 'di dag ni sa la gnas pas kyang brten par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sa la gnas pas kyang brten par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since these are to be relied upon even by those abiding on the grounds,

original: shes par bya ba tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par bya ba tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: they are not merely objects of knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir sa bcu la sogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bcu la sogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Because it is said in the Dashabhumika and other sutras:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang mi spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang mi spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas /
translated: One does not fail to practice the remaining perfections either.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu thams cad du yang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la kun du spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu thams cad du yang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la kun du spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said that the bodhisattva should practice all the perfections on all ten grounds.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Moreover, with reference to the bodhisattva who delights solely in the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'phags pa yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo chos thams cad bsdus pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo chos thams cad bsdus pa las /
translated: in the noble Sutra of Complete Purity, which includes all dharmas,🔽it is said:

original: byams pa gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par gzung bar bya ba de la /
analyzed: byams pa gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par gzung bar bya ba de la /
translated: Maitreya, those fools who say that bodhisattvas should not practice the six perfections for the sake of enlightenment,

original: skyes bu blun po rnams 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu @277b phyin pa 'ba' zhig la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu blun po rnams 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu @277b phyin pa 'ba' zhig la bslab par bya ste /
translated: but that bodhisattvas should train only in the perfection of wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams kyis ci zhig dgos zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams kyis ci zhig dgos zhes zer zhing /
translated: and who disparage the other perfections, will be reborn as stupid creatures.🔽And the noble Illuminating Lamp Dhāraṇī says,

original: des pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma gzhan smod par sems par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa las kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di ni snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba can /
analyzed: des pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma gzhan smod par sems par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa las kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di ni snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba can /
translated: “This gnosis of omniscience has great compassion as its root,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu can /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu can /
translated: the spirit of enlightenment as its cause,

original: thabs kyi mthar phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs kyi mthar phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the perfection of skillful means as its culmination.”

original: de bas na gnyis ka yang dus thams cad du brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka yang dus thams cad du brten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, both should be relied upon at all times.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One’s non-abiding nirvana is established.

original: de yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis ni gzugs kyi sku dang / zhing dang / 'khor la sogs pa'i longs spyod chen po'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pas /
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis ni gzugs kyi sku dang / zhing dang / 'khor la sogs pa'i longs spyod chen po'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pas /
translated: Moreover, through the means of generosity and so forth, he fully possesses the result of great enjoyment, such as the form body, pure land, retinue, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par mi mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One does not abide in nirvana.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyin ci log spangs pas 'khor bar gnas par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyin ci log spangs pas 'khor bar gnas par mi mdzad do //
translated: Through the perfection of wisdom, he does not abide in samsara, having abandoned error.

original: 'khor ba ni phyin ci log gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang yang chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pas chos rnams kyang spang bar bya bas na /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni phyin ci log gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gang yang chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pas chos rnams kyang spang bar bya bas na /
translated: Because samsara has the nature of error.

original: chos ma yin pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, it is said, “One should abandon even the Dharma, knowing that the Dharma is like a raft, let alone the non-Dharma.”

original: de la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa spang par bya'o zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa spang par bya'o zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: One should abandon the false imagination.

original: dgos pa'i don rdzogs pa'i don du yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa'i don rdzogs pa'i don du yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not say, One should not stand in the object of the purpose.

original: de yang chos yongs su gzung bar bya ste /🔽log pa ni gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang chos yongs su gzung bar bya ste / log pa ni gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And it says, One should take up the Dharma,🔽but not the false.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: And it says, Therefore,

original: dus kun du ni thabs dang ni //
analyzed: dus kun du ni thabs dang ni //
translated: one should always rely on the method,

original: shes rab pha rol bdag can ni //🔽brten bya gang phyir de las ni //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol bdag can ni // brten bya gang phyir de las ni //
translated: and on wisdom, and on the self,

original: mi gnas mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //🔽zhes khungs dang bcas par gsungs so //🔽bla ma'i zhal nas kyang de lta bas na dus thams cad du thabs dang shes rab gnyis ka dang ldan par bya zhing /
analyzed: mi gnas mya ngan 'das par 'gyur // zhes khungs dang bcas par gsungs so // bla ma'i zhal nas kyang de lta bas na dus thams cad du thabs dang shes rab gnyis ka dang ldan par bya zhing /
translated: because from that there is non-abiding nirvana. 🔽And it says, Therefore, at all times one should have both method and wisdom,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zung du 'brel par bsag par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zung du 'brel par bsag par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and one should accumulate the two collections of merit and wisdom.

original: de ltar thabs dang shes rab gnyis zung du 'brel ba 'jug pa de gnyis ka dang ldan par bya'o zhes bya ba de bstan nas /🔽da ni thabs @278a * //🔽zhes bya ba dang shes rab ces bya ba de gnyis nyid ji lta bu yin pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang shes rab gnyis zung du 'brel ba 'jug pa de gnyis ka dang ldan par bya'o zhes bya ba de bstan nas / da ni thabs @278a * // zhes bya ba dang shes rab ces bya ba de gnyis nyid ji lta bu yin pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the union of method and wisdom should be possessed by both of those two.🔽Now, in order to explain just what those two are, method and wisdom,

original: shes rab gang dang thabs gang zhes //
analyzed: shes rab gang dang thabs gang zhes //
translated: it is said:

original: the tshom dag ni spang ba'i phyir //🔽thabs de dang ni shes rab kyi //
analyzed: the tshom dag ni spang ba'i phyir // thabs de dang ni shes rab kyi //

analyzed: rgyu rnams kyis ni ci zhig dgos /

analyzed: dngos po med las bsgyur du med //

analyzed: gnas skabs de dngos ji lta bu //

analyzed: dngos las gzhan pa'ang gang zhig yin //

analyzed: med pa'i tshe na dngos med na //

analyzed: de bas skye bo 'di dag ni //

analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med //

analyzed: ces rgyas par gsungs so //

analyzed: dngos po rang las mi skye zhing //

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rang bzhin med //
